text:
Recently came to this ramen spot on an impromptu ramen tour with my boyfriend when we were visiting Las Vegas. I would consider myself a ramen connoisseur of sorts. I tend to seek out new ramen spots frequently. I've been spoiled with the likes of Shin-sen-gumi and Santouka so I have standards set pretty high.

Per my fellow Yelpers positive reviews for Ramen Sora I visited to taste their ramen.

Experience as follows:

-Ambience: great spot, friendly staff. Nothing in particular stands out, typical privately owned Japanese ramen shop. We went around 2 for a late lunch, place was not full.

-Service: service was prompt and mostly friendly. I wouldn't say they went out of their way to give us great service, but I have no complaints on quality or speed of service.

-Food: we ordered the pork fried rice, shoyu ramen, and the shio ramen. We aren't particular for toppings so we usually go plain (bf) or with negi and egg (me).

*pork fried rice: it tasted great. Perfectly seasoned, great balance of pork and flavor. Rare is the day when we get a delectable side more appetizing than the main course. 

*shio ramen: broth was weak and had an undesirable aftertase. Noodles were nothing special and the seasoned egg was flavorless. I was very disappointed in the broth.

*shoyu ramen: this was my bf's meal. His words: "it's plain". I believe one thing that makes ramen delicious is its ability to give you complex flavors. When a broth is nothing more than dashi stock and soy sauce, you've got a problem.

Overall/last remarks: while the ramen wasn't particularly good or special, I don't think this is a bad spot. Anyone who likes to have a variety of broths/styles would come here. But for me, I'm very particular about a ramen spot to take pride in their ramen. Generally that's done when a spot takes care to perfect a particular broth or soup. When they stretch themselves too thin their ramen tends to suffer. I would recommend this place to newbies or anyone looking for a decent lunch spot.
Tasted like Tokyo To Me !Really Really good Ramen! Get the Spicy Soyu! So much flavor and a very nice burn
I love this place better than Monta but please stop Yelling to every customer when they come in or when they leave "annoying voice ever"!!!!
Good is always fresh and fast. Service has always been friendly and helpful. Today, Sunday afternoon and very few customers just right for me.

Decided to check out this place seeing it gets over 200 reviews! Love this quaint little restaurant. The Ramen is absolutely fabulous, we had tonkatsu ramen which the soup base is really to die for. Also, Chasu was really really yummy!!  I'll give it 5* for service, our waitress was spot on. 
We'll be back! ;)

AUGH! I'm used to Fukumimi's ramen, so this place was a real let down. I should have turned tail the moment we walked in - the two people with me agreed that it smelled like dirty diapers. Yes. It smelled like someone was trying to hide some sort of hideous diaper explosion that had just taken place. Cleaning chemicals barely mask the smell of fresh baby butt. I don't understand why.... or well, I didn't until our food came out and our ramen had the faint eau de diaper essence. Why? What are they using to flavor the ramen? I'm not sure if I really want to know. The only decent thing was the gyoza. Also, I don't normally leave reviews, but this place was so disappointing that I had to bust my phone out while in the middle of eating.

At least the server was really nice!

Mediocre is what i will rate it.   I ordered miso base, i would rate the broth 3.5 stars.

The reason i took away 1.5 star was because i was served my ramen hot but not pipping hot when it should be, due to this half way through the meal the broth was barely warm.   Also the tamago was over cooked.

I had Monta yesterday, thats a 5 star tonkatsu ramen i had.

I'm a Ramen kinda girl! Ramen Sora you did justice to my ramen craving. I ordered the deluxe miso ramen. The broth was right on point. My husband got the spicy ramen which was really delicious if you love spicy then it's definitely worth getting. No worries they have an even more hotter ramen for all you bold people.

I will definitely be back here to try more of their ramen.

Really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere! First time visiting and didn't really get a good description on how things are done. No distinction between a "raw" food plate and a cooked food plate, brought back the meet and didn't have a place to put the cooked food...didn't want to contaminate cook food with raw chicken juices!

I've been to all the 4-star plus ramen spots in town and this place is my favorite. The noodles here are the thick wrinkled kind and they just go so well with all of the delicious broths! I usually get the spicy miso ramen and it never disappoints. Sometimes there may be a short wait when you come, which is understandable because I always see taxis dropping off hungry tourists, in addition to the locals who visit, but it's worth the wait!

Of all the ramen places in town, there's something about Sora that always keeps me coming back. They provide a great atmosphere to enjoy your meal. Not to mention how incredible the food is, you seriously won't be disappointed no matter what you try! And that melon creamy soda is addicting, definitely recommend to everyone I know and any fan of ramen looking in the Vegas area!

Chashu bowl was incredibly delicious, I don't think I've eaten chashu better at any ramen place than here. Also ordered Nori Miso ramen, and it tasted great as well. Soup is rich in flavour, but a bit too salty for my preference. Service was quick and waitress was friendly, had a great dining experience here!

Ate here earlier this week and ordered a shio ramen with corn. I love ramen but this place didn't impress me. It's just alright. Have had better ramen in Japan and Mitsuwa marketplace. I don't really like the soupbase. I prefer tonkotsu soup base. It's not bad but nothing special either. I prefer monta ramen over ramen sora.
Ive tried a few of the ramen places in Las vegas and so far this place is my favorite! Manta Ramen is also pretty good but I would say that Ramen Sora is my overall fave!

Came here after checking for ramen place near Chinatown. It wasn't packed when we arrived around 5:30pm. Parking could be tricky because of limited space in the lot. Ordered the shoyu deluxe sora ramen and miso ramen. You can upsize your ramen to large or super large but we stick with regular size. The ramen didn't disappoint, broth was flavorful, tender pork slices. We also shared a bowl of mini chashu curry bowl. Well, it wasn't my favorite as there were a lot of burned chashu pieces and also we think it was salty.

The restaurant is bigger than Monta Ramen, but leaves some things to be desired.  The gyoza is a little bland, and the chashu bowl is just alright.  The chashu doesn't melt on your tongue, and it's a little chewy.  The ramen is a bit bland, but their noodles are perfect.  I haven't had such perfect ramen noodles since leaving Japan.  I'd prefer going to Monta Ramen.

I bounce back and forth between a few different ramen places for...well...the difference in ramen.  We have a couple of choices here, and I re discovered Ramen Sora by default because of the wait at Monta and a rather hungry and impatient friend. Glad we did. 

Noodles were cooked perfectly, not as salty, more options, and the spicy miso is something that I think Will become one of those dishes you sit at home about craving. 

The place itself is... Well needs a spacial designer.  It's a horrible set up with not enough tables and a lot of open space. It's super irritating to wait when there is enough room to put in at least another 6-8 tables.  Once seated its all worth it.
Definitely a weekly lunch spot, great food at a good price. If you're going for lunch there is usually a bit of a wait, but its well worth it... Gotta get my ramen fix

Perfect ramen. I can't even imagine how it could get better.

I usually get the spicy shoyu and my wife gets the miso and they never let us down. I've been there maybe around 10 times.

Place was delish! Spent a few years in Japan "Misawa" and have been craving it since being back in the states. Ordered the Spicy Miso along with an order of Gyoza. The broth was just how I remebered it along with the melt in your mouth pork. The gyoza were nice and juicy and just kicked ass. You get greeted as you do in Japan and that made me excited. The ramen it's self was a 7/10. There were things missing but that can be looked over. The wait was about 20min at 8pm on a friday night so not to bad. It was calm by the time we left at 9. Will ne going back for sure before leaving.
Hands down the very best Ramen and Fried Rice I have ever had in my life!!!!! I highly recommend the Spicy Ramen it's absolutely amazing. Everything is. Just get here. :)

I know everyone has there favorite ramen spot in vegas (we only have like 3-4 to choose from...LOL!), but I think Ramen Sora is the best in Vegas.  I think the broth is perfectly flavored, noodles are nice and a little chewy, and the pork and veggies are great.  The best thing for me is that the soup comes out piping hot.  I know everyone has there own opinion, but Ramen Sora is my spot for ramen in Vegas.
It used to be a different restaurant and I love it. Now I still like this place, I been to Ramen Sora only once and I will go again sometime soon.

Great food, bad experience, sad family, evening ruined. 

Jan 1, 2017
* 7:12pm my elderly mother, 2 elderly aunts, myself and my fiancé arrive at the crowded restaurant on a very cold and windy night. Wrote our name on the waitlist and waited in a very confined space, blocking exits and clearly in violation of fire escape routes. 
* 7:32pm finally was able to speak to the hostess about estimated time of wait, said it would be 30-45 from our arrival time. 
* 7:58 still waiting, my mom and aunts were cold and hungry, I had my fiancé order a soft drink for them to share while we waited (our party was next to be seated) and they made him pay for the drink rather than start the dinner tab
* 8:11 finally seated after nearly an hour. Had the hostess take our order right away bc we were not going to wait for them to come back later. 
* 8:17 server brought our water to the table
* 8:48 still no food yet, no water refill, the server came to tell us our food will be coming soon. She told us the cause for delay was that they ran out of miso and had to cook a fresh batch. Aren't you a ramen restaurant??? On a busy night, shouldn't there be another batch ready at all times?
* 9:06 food finally arrives: Miso Ramen, Spicy Miso Ramen, and 3 Nori Miso Ramen. The food was delicious, fresh miso tasted amazing, but at this point, my family was so miserable from the long wait. No one was happy. 
* 9:08 had to go up to the counter to refill my aunt's water myself. 
* 9:12 finally get a visit from the server to ask if everything's ok. It's so moot by now, I just nodded my head so she would go away. 
* 9:15 my fiancé walks up, pays the bill, and we leave shortly after. The plan was to eat and then hit the casinos afterward, but after the exhausting wait, party plans were canceled and we came back tired, grumpy, and miserable. This restaurant ruined our only evening of our short one-night LV trip. 

In summation, this establishment has been chopped.

We knew we had stumbled upon something special when the place was packed full of Japanese-speaking locals within half an hour of opening. They specialize in Hokkaido-style miso ramen. Choice of soup base consists of shio, miso, and spicy miso. Spicy miso isn't really spicy and adds a scoop of ground pork. They use yellow ramen noodles which have a nice chew to them. It comes with a single piece of chashu which is better than most, but for a nicer treat, order the premium chashu. For an extra dollar you can get a large bowl, or two dollars for super-size. Extra toppings such as negi, nori, and menma are available for an additional cost. Prices are reasonable as long as you don't go overboard with extra toppings. Service is decent with a nice ambiance to match.  

While not quite as tasty as our fave, tonkotsu ramen, this is the current top ramen spot in town hands-down. Finally a Vegas ramen restaurant worth returning to!
Great little place! Near my work, so I go here a few times a month for lunch. Great service, great food, and super fast! My favorite is the Spicy Miso Ramen!

My friends brought me to this place, and it's delicious. I normally go to Monta Ramen, it is still questionable if one was better than the other, i'd say it depends on what your taste buds are looking for. Sora provides spicy and flavorful broths. You can order broth bases such as Miso or Shoyu, and they have a wide selection of extra ingredients you can add. I must say, I love their gyoza! Cooked perfectly; crispy at the bottom, where it's been pan fried, and moist and juicy everywhere else. 

I ordered my miso ramen with cold draft kirin. Best combo ever!

My friend and I often have a restaurant-off, where we'll pick a type of food and whoever finds the better restaurant wins.

Our latest challenge was Ramen, and I'm happy to report that I won with the help of Ramen Sora. He said it couldn't be done. He said there is no better Ramen in Las Vegas than Monta Ramen. I proved him wrong.

This place is fantastic. There are no words to describe how perfect the ramen is, every time. The noodles are not too firm, not too soft. The broth is expertly prepared to just the right flavor. The meat is so tender, it falls apart with a gentle tug of your chopsticks. Who could ask for anything more?

The service here is also top notch. Your soup comes out fast and just how you order it, every time. The servers are friendly and happy to explain the different types of Ramen to you if you're a first timer. I told my server I like spicy, but don't like ground meat (which is what makes their spicy Ramen bowl spicy). My bowl came out with a side of chili sauce so I could flavor it to my liking.

The only downside is this place is so good, it can get crowded fast. But, it's worth the wait for the yummy yummy Ramen.

This is my favorite spot to have Ramen! It is "Oishi Oishi"! The noodles are perfect, the broth is perfect, I love it here! Do not hesitate or consider any other Ramen establishment, you must visit here and I guarantee you will be a returning customer. Oh and by the way, I live in california and no matter how much time passes between my visits, the food has remained the same, amazing and just what I expect every time!

On my recent trip to Vegas for a bachelorette party, we visited Ramen Sora as soon as it opened at 11:30am on Saturday morning.  We had checked out of our hotel room and had a few hours to spare before most of the girls boarded our plane home.  We arrived about 10 minutes before Sora opened, so there was definitely no line and we were the first group seated.  The rest of our crew arrived about 20 minutes later (11 total).  The place filled up fast by noon time so I'm glad we were able to get our big party seated before the rush.

After reading reviews of Monta vs. Sora, I assumed Monta ramen would be better.  Imagine my surprise when Sora ramen knocked it out of the park. The broth is quite flavorful almost too intensely salted.  The menu mentioned the capability to dilute the flavor with more broth if needed.  The noodles were my favorite - fresh, chewy consistency that was absolutely delish.  That's how real RAMEN noodles should taste! Go with the Delux to try a bit of everything.  I loved the thick broth and variety of toppings. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely make a pit stop here again.

Came here last weekend and was definitely happy that I did! I had the shiyo ramen which was perfect :) I ate every last noodle! We also had the small curry rice and fried rice dish. A great place for sharing while listening to upbeat music. Service was very pleasant and quick. I'm hoping to try the corn butter ramen on my next visit. We will absolutely without a doubt be back.
This place continues to amaze me, the screaming is awesome......what is really great is the leftovers after a couple days....even better...the flavors are unlike any others anywhere, fabulous.....

This was my first ramen experience and I was pleasantly surprised with it. I love walking into restaurants and being greeted by people yelling from across the room and this place did it to perfection!

Kirin is on tap and a great deal at $5 for the 24oz.

The food was pretty good, but I could not get over the smell of the ramen bowl. I'm not sure what it was, but it smelled like spoiled something. I pushed through the smell and kept eating though because it was tasting very good. All in all, I would say my bowl was okay.

The one thing to note is that there is nothing for vegetarians here since all the broth is meat based. My SO had to get friend rice with veggies and it was not good at all.

Out of all the Ramen places I have been to in vegas, Sora is and always will be the best place EVER !! My personal fave is the miso corn butter ramen, I get it every time along with the gyoza which is also really good.  The staff is really nice, the atmosphere is pretty cool & the ramen is amazing !

I love their Corn&Butter Shio Ramen and Gyoza. On the other hand, I don't really like any other flavor they have.
I like all the topping they have and Gyoza taste pretty good. Types of noodle they use isn't my favorite ramen noodle but it goes well with Shio ramen I think.
My friends who likes spicy food love their spicy miso ramen. So far everyone I took here with me all like it here:)
They don't really have many appetizers beside ramen toppings. But if you just wanna go eat Ramen, what else you need other than a good bowl of ramen?:)

Not bad for a ramen place in Vegas.  Good size portion and the pork that came with my soup was pretty big.  Not to far from the strip and a lot cheaper than eating on the strip.  Got seated pretty fast and the service was great.  Big water cups which is good.  Usually Asian places have small water cups so you have to wait for servers to refill all the time.  Will come again. :)

Best Ramen in town! to be honest, it was the first and only time i ate ramen and it was great! very nice and cozy place, awesome staff, tasty ramen, great prices for good meal!

Can't wait to go there again for my next ramen!

Really good Ramen. Would come back again to try the shoyu and miss broths. Shio a bit salty, but you are warned on the menu. Noodles are nice and firm, pork is flavorful and everything works well together.

Ramen Sora, what can I say other than that this is my favorite spot by far! The service is great an so is the ambiance. You may have to wait a few minutes, but it's definitely worth the wait! I order the Chasu Miso Ramen and Gyozas whenever I go cuz those are my favorite things from there! The Miso broth is so delicious with the pork belly slices on top of noodles, garnished with egg and bamboo slices making this a great mixture of goodness! As for the Gyozas, they're the best along with their dipping sauce that make this combo the best yet! My husband orders the Spicy Miso Ramen and with that you can always order the level of heat you like! He enjoys it super spicy and orders the larger size. Its satisfying in so many ways and most definitely thee best Ramen place in Chinatown! It's never a disappointment!..:)

After trying out Monta, I was eager to see how Ramen Sora compared. The restaurant is more modern and there is no bar seating where you can watch them cook. The ramen style was completely different from what we had at Monta, but not bad. We had the deluxe sora ramen with miso and the corn butter ramen with shio. The noodles are much thicker and chewier than Monta's and the miso was more complicated and heavily seasoned. The shio was clear and light. They're good at what they do, and this would be a fine alternative if I wanted something different.

The food was great . As a kid I always enjoyed ramen . I never had authentic ramen. Just straight out of a bag . If you want delicious and great tasting authentic ramen...  come here to eat . The servings are quite delightful as well.
Delicious....Just tried today....Mochi ice cream  pricy @ $2.50 for 2 pieces split in half....mango only but did not ask if other flavors had. Definite returning customer...

I've tried both Sora & Monta and I'm pleased to say I'm a SORA fan (I'm sure there are those who will argue). I've been to Monta twice and both times just didn't hit it for me, broth/stock wasn't there and what was up with that tiny-ass chasu bowl?! LOL (You can get a Chasu Bowl meal @ Sora). The first time I went to Sora... BOOM! And I've been back a few more times after that. Don't forget, Monta was shut down last March with 47 demerits! So they should NOT be given the title of Top Ramen in LV. In fact, they should change their name to "Kitanai" Ramen LMAO! I guess the results are in Monta Ramen = BLAH vs. Ramen Sora = ICHIBAN DAISUKE!

Just ate here tonight.  Was pretty good.  
I will admit, I'm more a fan of hakata style ramen, so I'm not too eager to go back, but I'm rating this for what it is.  
The only reason it lost a star was that their gyoza wasn't too great.  Not bad, and pretty well priced, but I've had many a plate of superior gyoza.
That said, the pork was very flavorful, the soup was very rich, the menma added some very nice flavor, the waitresses were courteous and refilled my water very quickly.  
If you're a fan of ramen, definitely give them your business, but be warned, this is northern style, so it could be a bit rich for you like it was for me.  That said, I'll definitely be back to have my friends try it, they just still haven't stolen the number one spot in my heart from monta...  Well, the number 2 spot, number 1 is ramen stadium back in hakata.

we went to try based on the reviews but the service was really bad. the girl just trow the menu at us and went away. while we were waiting, another couple entered and she asked them really fast what they wanted to drink. we waited 15 minutes to get drinks. when we got our food.it smelled really bad like rotten we tried other ramen places before they never smell this bad. we wont return to this one.

This place wasn't what I expected. It was tiny but roomy inside. There isn't a lot of tables so I suggest going at a time you believe might not be crowded. We went around 2ish. 3 tables were taken. People started coming in after our food arrived. 

The food was great. We ordered the regular and spicy miso ramen along with gyozas. The regular size bowl was just enough for me. I left content. Not full, but not hungry still, with room for dessert elsewhere. The pork was delicious! My 6 year old had the shiyo(?) ramen. She had a lot left over and didn't look as if she was enjoying it too much unlike the way she would kill a bowl of pho. I think she just didn't like that soup taste.

This was our first visit and I would definitely come back to fulfill my cravings for ramen... And try the curry instead of the order my daughter had.  Price-wise, affordable. I think our regular size bowls were under $8 per. A dollar more for a size up.

Also, I appreciate the Japanese way of greeting their customers as they enter/leave. Felt like I was in Japan again. Sort of :)

Been going here for a long time with friends and family. Today I decided to take some new friends, my wife accidentally wrote her name in the wrong spot on the waiting page and one of the servers told her that because of her mistake we now had to wait even longer. She made it a point to make my wife feel like shit in front of our friends and strangers. Really!!?? Their food is amazing but the customer service leaves much to be desired. They have no idea that I belong to a huge global food service organization.

Definitely a must if you love ramen. Sora's ramen has to be the best ramen I have ever had and trust me I have been to lots of ramen restaurants and this one beats all! My friends and I eat here at least once a week because it's that good.

Best ramen house in Vegas! The food and service are great. The ramen miso broth is my favorite add some sweet corn and butter, life is good! This place is small, so plan your visit accordingly because when they are busy prepare to wait for a seat. It can also get a little warm inside.

Outstanding!

Visited Ramen Sora during a short trip to Vegas with my wife.  We got the screaming vengence ramen, spicy miso ramen & chasu bowl.  The food arrived quickly and everything was delicious! 

Pros:
-Outstanding food
-Excellent Service
-Short wait (less than 10 minutes)

Highly recommend trying Ramen Sora!!
Long wait to get seated and for food, but overall the ramen was good, especially the chashu. I would come back if I wasn't dying of starvation and could wait.

Came on a Saturday night and had to wait for about 30 minutes prior to being seated. Stood cramped by the door in 30 something degree weather while waiting, and people were constantly in and out opening the door. It's a very small place. Finally seated and took our drinks/meal order. Kind of hard to ask for utensils, napkins, straws, etc. They also had to wash more chopsticks before they could give us some. We all ordered ramen since that's what we came for, but we also wanted to order their fried rice. We were told that it would take 20-40 minutes to make since they ran out of it and will have to make another batch. We finished eating our ramen, and the fried rice finally came after. Service is a bit slow since they're busy, but not a bad place for ramen in Las Vegas. Food was decent, pricing is reasonable.. Slow service is my only complaint.

I've dined in and taken my ramen to go (just recently found out that this was even an option, yay!)

I haven't had a bad experience here. The staff is fun and friendly. The food is hot and consistently on-point!

I always order the Screaming for Vengeance shio Ramen with fried rice, gyoza, and the mini chasu bowl. All a delightful taste sensation...

Don't trust my reviews on spicy food if you have low tolerance for spicy food. For my tastes, Screaming for Vengeance is just above a medium level of spiciness. I'd say it's about as hot as the xxtra flaming hot cheetos in the black bag. It'll make your nose run, but it's highly tolerable and still has flavor. One of my dining partners did not share the same sentiment. He thought it was insanely hot and he basically chucked the rest of his rice and tea down to calm the burn... My tip? Let it cool down temperature wise and the spiciness won't be so intense.

Yum!!
Best ramen in Vegas!
My favorite is miso ramen. It is not salty like other place and very authentic. 
They are not cheap on portions or broth quantity.
I'm coming to this place every time I come back to Vegas! Noodles were packed with flavor.  Environment was clean and we were greeted on the spot. Quick, fast service , every one was vary friendly.

It's true !! They are the best. 

No matter what combination of broth and toppings - it's just that good !!
We ordered the spicy with shio base - barely finished and it was spicy. The pork belly meat is the best I've ever had !!  Hubby ordered #1 deluxe with miso base and mom had the basic in miso base. WOW !!  Very tasty and filling !!

The staff are attentive and very sweet !!

Lived in Northern Japan for years amd this place is one of the best ramen houses in Vegas that remind us of our time there. The place is small so if you are the impatient type then time your visit well! Food portions are excellent and they taste awesome! Usually we have several orders of gyoza and chasu ramen with shoyu. That or the killer spicy ramen with shoyu. Both excellent! Wife usually gets the chasu with miso.  LOVE IT HERE!!

My FAVORITE Ramen shop in West coast =D hands down. 

So Ramen  has many different style, but 2 basic soup base, one been tonkotsu (thick creamy pork broth) and chicken clear base. 

Sora dose the clear broth perfect, their soup is not too thin and not too thick, and when it comes to ramen, i love perfect clear broth. 
Mota dose the tonkotsu base fairly well, but my personal reference, i like the Sora soup. 

Noodle is thicker than what i like but their noodle is thick "chijire" (means wiggly and not straight) and gose really well w. the soup. 

service is quck and loved that they serve tea at the end. I will keep going back here when i'm in vegas

Out of all the ramen places in Vegas this is the best one!   

When I go here I always have gyoza, fried rice and negi ramen.  All super delicious.   Fried rice is easy to make but it is rare for a place to make it well and his place makes it awesome!

I much prefer Monta's miso broth (heartier, more flavor) over Roman Sora's. Still, I finished my bowl feeling pretty satisfied. The wavy type noodle was a nice surprise.

But seeing as I'm a fan of cheap prices and bargains...

Sora's prices are a little more expensive (everything from the drinks to the ramen) than Monta's and you only get one slice of chashu pork in your soup.

(Even better, if you want really inexpensive and tasty ramen order a bowl ($5) from Big Wong)

Ramen Sora, Cheap, Simple, and absolutely Delicious. The menu is simple, and the flavors are never lacking in every bowl. Side dishes are pretty great and I can't go without having a Melon Creamy Soda!
Better than monta. But I don't know why all ramen in US have to be so salty. It's really not healthy

Great miso ramen and pork fried rice is so addictive. We showed up 10 minutes before opening on 4th of July. There was already a line of patrons waiting for the restaurant to open, now that's how you know it's good.
Hands down the best ramen in vegas. I've eaten the twice in one day. The miso broth is so creamy and rich it's just out of this world

I love ramen sora. it's one of my favorite to go places when I'm in vegas. i've tried majority of the broth on the menu and usually get the shoyu which it's done with perfection. Their chashu meat just melts in your mouth so i order more on the side. its always packed here, I've never seen it empty but its definitely worth the wait imo.

Torn is the best way to describe it.   I'll just come out and say that I've been a Monta fan for years and probably always will be.   Buuuuuuuuuut, I gotta say that Ramen Sora is right up there, and actually eclipses Monta in some aspects.   Needless to say, you can't go wrong with either one of them, but let's just focus on Ramen Sora.  I love hot stuff, so obviously I ordered the Screaming for Vengance.   I gotta say, it was hot, but I've had hotter.   Not saying that I wanted it hotter, but in my opinion, it was just enough heat to make you say......Damn!   But not enough heat where you couldn't actually taste the food you were eating.  I loved the texture of the noodles and the chashu was very tender and tasty.   The gyoza was good, but I didn't like the fact that you didn't have the shoyu, vinegar, and chili oil on the table to make your own gyoza dipping sauce.   Not a deal breaker, but I typically like the sauce more acidic than how their's was.   Our friends ordered pork fried rice as well which was very tasty.   This spot is super busy, and unfortunately since everybody waits inside, you can't help but feel rushed.   At least at Monta's the long line is outside......hahaha

Yummy place to eat.  Our waitress was extremely friendly and helpful, and had no problems giving extra help on our 1st visit.  This is definiately on my list for places to frequent each trip to Vegas.

My girlfriend and I decided to go out for ramen. We decided on Ramen Sora after reading the yelp reviews. The ramen is good; even better than some of the more known places in the Bay Area. Plus, there's no wait. I ordered the corn butter ramen and my girlfriend got the ramen that really spicy. This ramen is even spicy for her, which is a rarity. I will definitely go back to this place next time I'm in town.

First off I would like to say to all of the other Yelpers out there, please stop comparing this place to Monta, just because they both serve ramen doesn't make them the same, it's like comparing northern Italian food to southern Italian food, they're just different.

Ramen Sora serves Sapporo style ramen, which is a little thicker and chewier, but I like it, it feels a little more substantial.  They have two main broths, a shio (salt) or a miso based one.  The miso broth is a little thicker, but tastes really good, especially with the pork and veggies.  The shio broth is much lighter, both in color and flavor, but as the waitress described it, it's perfect for summer.  The pork was delicious, and they don't skimp on the serving size either which is nice.

I got the deluxe bowl which pretty much comes with everything, which was a plus and minus for my first time.  I discovered that I do not care for nori in my ramen, as I didn't like how it's flavor paired with the pork.  I also thought that the hard boiled egg I had in my soup was slightly overdone, but that could just be a preference of mine.

I also got the gyoza, and just so everyone knows, it takes 8 minutes to cook, so order when you sit down or you'll end up getting them after your meal.  The gyoza were fine, crispy on one side, with a very nice dipping sauce.  They give you a ready made dipping sauce, but you can also make your own if you like.

On the whole, a very pleasant and somewhat inexpensive lunch experience.

As a ramen lover, I really love this place. From the outside, it gives you the feeling that no one would eat here. However, I saw the word "ramen". It just lured me in. The parking is behind the restaurant. My girlfriend and I ordered Spicy Miso ramen, Mini chashui bowl and the mini curry bowl. The soup base is very good. It satisfies my ramen-taste-bugs. The ramen they use is different from Monta. I prefer here because you have more choices of ramen. I will come back and try different ramen.

My husband & I came here for lunch today. Arrived 5 mins after they opened and the place was already full. We were seated on a table that sat 4. We ordered gyoza as our appetizer. It was ok.  The couple seated next to us were done eating and left. The younger [I can't say Asian because all of them are Asian] lady server came up to us and said " Can you move over to this table so I can seat a party of 4?"  I WAS SHOCKED!! I didn't want to embarrass my husband so we moved over as told.  Our ramen came out and it wasn't what I expected. NEVER EVER in all my 33 years of living was I seated at a table at a any restaurant and then be TOLD to move so they could accommodate another party. OHN! That's very very RUDE! I will not come back here again.
My absolute favorite ramen place in town the ultimate spicy is friggin awesome.

Yay a new ramen place in Vegas.  Sora only has basically 2 types of broth to choose from shio(salt base) and miso.  I wish they had shoyu and tonkotsu broth.  This place is almost but not quite there to the ramen I had southern california.  Overall this place is clean, has tasty ramen, and provides good service.

Authentic Japanese ramen house.  Ended up getting the spicy ramen, and its NO JOKE.  I didn't get the insanely hot one though, because anytime I've tried super hot, it has NO FLAVOR.  It was not the case here.  My broth was spicy and delicious.  The pork cutlet included in the ramen was soft and delicious.  Will come again and again!

This ramen shop can get busy very quickly. One of the reasons is that the place is small. The broth is pretty good, but not above my expectation. I've had better broth. The noodle is okay, not bad. The servers are very nice and very quick to serve you. Overall, it's an okay place to eat ramen.

My husband and I attempted to go here for lunch today and we were met with a locked door. After trying to open the door, a young lady came to the door and said "we're closed today. We're out of soup". I hope that is good news - that they're so busy they ran out of product. We were told they would reopen tomorrow at 11:30am. I'm very disappointed in today's experience. I will definitely try again tomorrow to hopefully experience the food this time.

I had a free day at a trade show so wanted to find some good ramen.  I chose Ramen Sora and wasn't disappointed.  I had the miso spicy ramen and it was excellent!  Just the right amount of spice and the ramen noodles were excellent!  Get there early as there are only 10 tables but it's worth the wait! Make sure you put your name on their waiting list when you first arrive. Would highly recommend Ramen Sora to anyone wanting some excellent ramen!

Another great ramen spot.. 
Cute and quaint, hip music and good service.
Ramen is full of flavor and fills you up.  We both ordered the deluxe ramen. I think this is the best cha shu I've had (that's how they spelt it) 
It's a little fatty but so grinds!

Monta has this place beat. I tried the Menma Ramen (bamboo shoots) with the shoyu broth. For starters, the broth is super salty. My brother had the spicy ramen and the salt level on that was much more tolerable. We both agreed that the noodles left much to be desired as they reminded me of Hawaiian saimin. Also, the waitresses there were unfriendly and unhelpful. I'd rather stand in line at Monta than go here again ...

Short: Pros: Great ramen. 
Cons: Loud, fast- moving atmosphere so don't expect a friendly chat.
Not the best prepackaged noodles, and a tad overpriced.
Do go here if you're interested, it's worth your time. 

Long: Went here with a friend and it was good that we arrived early; they got packed quick. We were sat down, ordered our food. One of the downfalls here is that the place is small, and as it's a ramen joint, it's expected of you to eat quick and get a move on. The place is loud with chatter, and you don't have much time to really sit down and comfortably chat. 
Food arrived quick. For $11 for their special in a large, it's good proportions, but I don't see where all that money went--especially since ramen elsewhere is a budget outing. Soup was great, the meat was as tender as all hell, sides were great, BUT, the noodles weren't the best pre-packaged and that just crashed the whole deal for me. They're good, but I think the whole dish would be better with cheapy ramen noodles off the store shelf. As the main ingredient for ramen, I can't overlook that.

Still, 4 stars for good ramen. If you want to try this place, I can't see why not.

The one word that comes to mind about Sora Ramen is inconsistent. Every time I go to Sora, the ramen tastes differently and that is not a good thing. One week, their ramen will taste great. The next time, it will taste average. The next time, it will taste bad. Then it will taste good again. However, the great times are few and far between. One time I even got miso ramen with NO MISO IN IT. I don't get it. When Sora does their miso ramen correctly, it is amazing. However, I do have to say that it is very oily. That is the one thing that Sora is consistent about - their ramen is very oily and nearly greasy. Especially this last time I went. Also, their shio ramen and shoyu ramen are very poor. They don't taste anything like actual shio and shoyu ramen, which is a shame because you really can't find shio ramen in Las Vegas except at Sora.

Lastly, when it comes to ramen shops these days, I have a system by which I judge their ramen. If I would rather eat Japanese Instant Ramen (Instant ramen from Japan is really excellent quality), then the ramen at the shop isn't good for me. I would rather eating Japanese instant ramen than go to Sora.

I had the Spicy Soy Ramen size large for a dollar extra. It wasn't salty at all and had just a kick of spiciness in it. The large was a bit much. If you order the regular, it would've been fine. The pork tasted really good and the egg was cooked very well. If you want something a little more salty, the soy based soup would be best to get. I'd come back here again. It was a nice stop on a cold night.

Man....let me tell you something. When you are in Vegas, this is a must go to place. We went there 2 years ago for the first time. The ramen was out of this world. Food is reasonably priced. Service is always excellent. i think we ate there 3 times on our last trip to Vegas. They must have thought I was stalking them. ha.
The restaurant is a little small so it does get crowded during lunch and dinner. But they open late. i don't remember what their hours are, but one time we stopped by after 11 and they were still open. They do have some beer on draft (Sapporo?) if you want to cool down the heat from their spicy noodle bowls.
Go there. Enjoy the ramen. Tell them I sent you.

This place is amazing! Even with the restaurant packed, we only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the brooth tasted so good, not too salty..just amazing. The wait staff were friendly and were constantly asking if we needed anything! Will definitely recommend to my friends!

Very solid ramen. If you want something filling for $8, this is the perfect place. Comes with a respectable amount of pork, half an egg, menma, and nori. If it weren't always so busy it would be my go to ramen in Vegas.

This place is certainly overrated perhaps there's not many good Japanese Ramen restaurant in Vegas. We came Monday night and it was a horrible experience. I felt like I was being timed for how long I occupied my seat when actually there were lots of empty tables around. 
The food quality was pretty bad also. Soup is too oily and salty. The meat was not fresh. 
I'll never come to this place.

The mini chasiu bowl was a little bit of heaven! I had the miso ramen which was amazing..the broth was perfect, the noodles were thick and the chasiu melts in your mouth. One minor complaint is that the tamago was overdone. My only comparison with Monta, since I read that the two places shouldn't be compared food-wise, is that Sora is much roomier and there was no wait. We will be back!

I ordered the Spicy Miso Ramen and it was nothing special.  I didn't like the texture of the noodles (seemed undercooked) or the flavor of the broth.  My ramen included a boiled egg and it was so dried out that the yolk looked like yellow plastic.  I tasted the Spicy Shio Ramen and liked that broth only slightly better.  Overall, it didn't satisfy my ramen craving.   One more thing....it didn't bother me but it may upset parents with younger kids....Sir Mix-A-Lot's "Baby Got Back" was playing loudly.

it was a pretty hot day for ramen, but I can't help it because I was really excited to try out Ramen Sora. Wanting to try their spiciest ramen but not yer build up enough courage and settle for spicy ramen with shoyu broth, ordered side of gyoza and an iced green tea to make it a meal.
The noodle was cooked perfectly, their pork was tender, and best part has to be the boiling egg that to me was cooked just right, tender on the outside with a runny yellow... my mouth water just writing about this..
I had try out other ramen joint, and ramen sora will be one of my top choice.. so if ur ever in vegas, craving for a ramen, even on a scorching hot day, go to ramen sora and have yourself a bowl..
until my next trip..

Been wanting to eat here for a long time. It has always had a long wait. The place is very small and always at capacity it seems. But we came by tonight just before last seating at 10:30 and got a table for two rather quickly. It's cold outside and I was in the mood for something with a little heat so I ordered the miso spicy ramen. The service was swift and our food came out in less than ten minutes. I could tell from the first bite that this was the best I've had so in Las Vegas. The noodles were perfect. The pork was delicious, the bamboo and egg and all other ingredients were perfect. I will definitely be back and try some other varieties. I've been to Monta and Jinya several times and although this is my first visit, Ramen Sora is my new favorite. Wow, just great!
Very POOR SERVICE! Servers have bad attitude. We lost our appetite due to bad service and went to other Ramen bar instead. NOT COMING BACK TO THIS KIND OF PLACE!!!

I came here with family to try some ramen and mix it up during our stay here. The food was delicious! We ordered and all the food came within 5 minutes of placing the order! Food consumed:

- gyoza: hot, fried nicely, and the dipping sauce/spices were a nice touch 
- spicy pork fried rice: best part of the dinner! The meat was so scrumptious and the spice was just right... it also makes you stay hydrated, which isn't a bad thing in my book 
- corn butter ramen/miso base: pretty good! It wasn't the best ramen I've ever had, but it's far from the worst! The noodles were nicely done, the broth was yummy and watching the pat of butter melt into the broth was a fun touch. 

Would likely come back! Quick service and good food

After a long day of work, a nice hot spicy ramen is a good way to end the day. The place looks very simple as you would expect for a Japanese place. I would have to say though, after I was done eating, I liked this place better than Monta. If you like spicy hot ramen, this is the place to go. The only reason I didn't give it all 5 stars was that the food took longer to come out than I expected. Maybe it'll be different next time I go.

I came here often :-) 
They have a good service and foods.
This place is super busy whenever we came but they are good at taking care of customers. I wanna recommend my favorite which is chashu ramen :) if you want, you can add an eggs, seaweeds, chashu, corn and so on. :) price is decent. Sora ramen is the best Japanese noodle restaurant in this town.

Ordered online due to positive reviews but very disappointed when I ate the ramen. Idk maybe the cook  was just in the bad mood because the broth was too salty and fishy. For the price i paid, i could have eaten more and way better if I ordered from Jinya. Never again.

We had a great time at Ramen Sora. I never had chef made ramen and it was a great treat. I got the deluxe and loved the seaweed it made it taste like fish. We had the small pork dish as well, which was nutty flavored. Everyone in the group was surprised at how good it was. Dishes came out fast and I even liked the house Sake.  I would go there again who knew there was a chinatown in Vegas!  I know want more.

Finally I've found a ramen that is actually spicy. I've been searching for so long and everybody claims this is spicy but it not. The label on the menu said try if you dare and I did and it was amazing. Spicy but not to spicy for me. This is a must try when you go here. The fried rice was also very yummy.

The noodle soup it just to salty! Try eat twice I had same salty noodle soup.
Service is great!

The place lacks welcoming, good service.
So my wife and I walk in, first time, told the server and she totally ignore that, she didn't even walk us through their menu, the place wasn't even full. Only reason I gave three star their food was actually decent.
Authentic ramen....the fried rice and gyoza on the side were perfect compliments!

After a long 12hrs shift at the hospital, I convinced my girlfriends to go there because we were all craving Ramen.  We were really excited but when our food arrived, we were disappointed.  Our soup was OILY!  I mean really oily where every sip and bite, you can feel the oil in your mouth.  Plus you can see an immense amount of oil floating on the soup.  YUCK!  I was also disappointed they didn't have shoyu ramen as an option.  I had really high hope for this place because of the high amount of star from yelp, but I wasn't too fond of it.

First time here but not disappointed and good to know I got a new Ramen place to go to next time I'm in town.    Place is not that big but service is fast so customer come in then out after eating in 20-30mins. Soup base is delicious, noodles, meats and other ingredients are cooked just right. The Ramen price is inexpensive at under $10 way cheaper than those that I've tried in Los Angeles, Riverside, Orange County SoCal. Highly recommended.

My Favorite Ramen house in Vegas!! You need to make sure you get your name written on the counter as soon as you walk in to get seated right away!! 

The ramen is amazing, i do like monta as well but if to chose i'll go Ramen Sora always!! It's just all about the ramen. Spicy Miso Ramen is my go to order! Go and try it out. I just wished they open later in the evening for those late night cravings.

This is the real deal! One of my favorite ramen places in Japan is at the Hokkaido Airport by the name of... wait for it... Ramen Sora. This place in Vegas seems to be the same chain, slightly Americanized. The ramen is almost as good as that from Hokkaido. My only wish is that they would serve the roasted corn butter ramen here, but the corn butter ramen is still amazing!

So now I have finally been to this ramen restaurant! Compared to the other popular ones in town, I think I'll be going here more than the others.
They have some ramen bowls I haven't seen any where else, and really it was super good. The broth wasn't heavy like it is in other places, the noodles aren't over piled in your ramen, and for the sizing of the bowls, it's really decent. Very fulfilling and satisfying.
If you haven't been here, and been sticking to the other ramen places in town, try this place out! It's super worth it, and the scenery/vibe is a good view for a couple friends/family dinner.

Finally visited Ramen Sora for the first time. I went after work around 11:40am. Since I had just left work I felt like taking something home. I didn't want to take the Ramen home because wanted my Ramen experience to be in the Ramen Sora restaurant the next time around. So ordered the large pork chashu bowl and the Kurodoma Dango to go. The staff was very nice and my food didn't take long. When I got home to eat the pork chashu bowl was so good as well as the dango!! I really have to visit Ramen Sora again to try the ramen. I sort of kicked myself now for not staying in to try the ramen when I was there.

Dear Sora,

I'm sorry that I didn't take the time to get to know you earlier, but I'd been dating another ramen house at the time and thought she was the bomb diggity. It was pretty casual and we weren't exclusive, but I finally pulled the plug when I got fed up from waiting in line EVERY time and just WASN'T GETTIN' ANY. 

I don't want you to think you were some rebound though - it was some time before I decided to stop by for a visit, but I have to admit that when I walked in and saw there weren't hordes of people jonesing for a table, I wondered if you were my type. After being seated right away though, I perused the menu and knew we'd hit it off. 

Pulling my usual first-date move, I opted for the miso ramen and it was love at first bite. Your bowl of piping hot broth housed a generous portion of noodles that was bedazzled with tender pieces of chashu pork, crispy menma bamboo shoots that snapped with every chew, nori strips for a good crackling, an egg boiled just right, and other veggie toppings. After a few more nights out with you, I came to appreciate that we could be spontaneous with each other. Sometimes I wanted a different broth, or wanted to add other ingredients like corn, butter, or extra pork. Other nights I'd be in a chashu rice bowl mood. Either way, I liked that you were always game to MIX IT UP. 

Let me know when you are ready to make it Facebook official. Text me. 

XOXO, Sandy

Great ramen! As well as the pork fried rice! Theyre really spot on when it comes to their food. 

Highly recommended!

Great place for ramen when in town.
We get a little tired of eating on the strip sometimes, and this is the first place we think of. Proportions are good, price is right, and the flavor is authentic and delicious.

This is also one of the few ramen places that get the noodles right.

Went here for lunch recently.  I did not have to wait for a table and they brought out my ramen within 6 minutes! I took away a star because my chashu was cold and I had to let it sit in the soup to warm up.

Have tried several ramen places in Vegas and Ramen Sora is my favorite.  Have been dining here for at least two years and the food is consistently excellent and the staff is great.

Favorites are miso based screaming for vengeance ramen, spicy ramen, spicy pork fried rice and curry bowl. 

Sora can get very busy and there are some long wait times but they clear the list quickly.

I had the Negri ramen. My husband had the shoyu ramen. Both ramen did not smell appetizing.  I took two bites of mine and it was disgusting to say the least. our waitress saw me several times not eating we made eye contact and she never bother to come to our table to asked me if something was  wrong. When we asked for the bill since we were with a friend we took separate checks. She finally asked at that time if something was wrong when she saw a full bowl of ramen sitting there in front of me. we told her I did not like it and I do not want to change it to something else since I tasted my husband and I did not like that either. My husband did not like his ramen he said it was a weird smell and taste to it. His ramen was also warm almost cold.

I was still charge for my meal and I know its a business so I decide to pay for the dinner I didn't eat. Just the fact that she saw me not eating and not bother to come was what pissed me off the most horrible service not accommodating restaurant.

I would like to start this review by saying DON'T order the Screaming Vengeance ramen if you are on a first date or still in the early awkward nervous stage of your relationship. My girlfriend had recommended I try this place so we stopped in for dinner. After careful review of the menu I decided to order the Screaming Vengeance to impress my girlfriend and show I was a strong, tough guy machismo. WHAT A HUGE MISTAKE! It was delicious but ridiculously spicy. I ended up sweating as if I was in a sauna and went to the bathroom twice to rinse my mouth with water. I'm surprised they didn't charge me for the stack of napkins I used to wipe off my sweat. My girlfriend had a very concerned and confused look the whole time as i was trying to hide the pain. This ramen lives up to its name and is not for anyone who can't handle heat.

This is place has good ramen in yummy broth and a price that doesn't hurt the wallet lol.
 The side's you can order were tasty and small, perfect to have along with ramen. The seared cha-su was really good!
Came here on the weekend, with a  big group of friends, no probelm getting a table a 6:00.Things picked up after 6:30, it got really busy! Its a small but cozy spot, parking is small and a little tight.

Yay! we didn't have to wait in line since we got there as it opened up. by the time, we left 40 minutes later, a lot of people were waiting around. 

I tried their butter corn ramen and the broth (grab the Miso) was very rich. You definitely can taste the butter (d'oh!), but ohhh! it's good. In term of Chashu, I have had better but I am not complaining. 

My hubby ordered the Spicy miso ramen and he liked it. It was good stuff and I actually like the spicy ramen better than the butter corn ramen since the broth is not as rich.

I like everything about this place. It's a small joint but their food are excellent. My favorite would be their spicy Ramen and when say spicy they really do mean it. Get extra napkins to wipe the sweat off your face...lol
My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our ramen! Hands down some of the best ramen we've had! Must try!

Sora has been inconsistent for me, last time I ate there broth was disappointingly plain, perhaps not cooked for enough time to extract the flavor. Not worth the long wait for me when so many other decent ramen in Las Vegas.

I've been to Sora twice. I don't like the flavor of Sora's broth for their ramen. It has an odd flavor that I can't describe. Also, the spicy ramen is not spicy enough for me. My husband loves the ramen at Sora and is always begging me to go here. I would much rather go to Monta, but there is always a line there. Monta's broth tastes much better and they cook the eggs so well. Guess I will have to just wait in line.

I like this place. The soup base taste great and noodles are fresh! I love my noodles kind of hard, which in my opinion beats Monta Ramen all the way.  I'm very glad another successful restaurant has opened in the Valley.  It hurts my heart when I see another restaurant go out of business like the one that was there before Ramen Sora. Let's support restaurants in the Valley that is worthy in saying in business.

I used to live in Japan since my return to the U.S. several years ago, I've been searching for an acceptable ramen shop surrogate. I've found it! I loved the atmosphere, especially the customary Japanese greeting, "Irashaimase" that I've missed in so many other places. I had the Miso Chashu ramen and it was delicious! The miso broth was so creamy & full of flavor, I wanted to order another bowl. I also had the gyoza and the pork fried rice (chahan), both delicious as well. I think this will be a favorite for my Japanese wife and I when we visit LV to shop at the Asian markets in Chinatown.
Good Portions, super friendly staff and always consistent. For less than $10 you will certainly fill your stomach and want to come back again.
Really good ramen very chewy ramen and the broth is great. The only thing is the place is small so we waited for almost an hour to get our tern. Still worth the wait, will be back!
I really like noodles and flavor.Compare to the price this is amazing.But be aware of spicy item if you have spicy allergic.

the food was good. my wife says she will never eat another pack of noodles again. I had the deluxe and she had the corn butter. the stock was tasty, the pork melts in your mouth. my wife is the pickiest eater on the planet and wants to come here every week. good job sora

Ramen Sora does a really good job for the type of ramen they make. It is pretty tasty. 

I only knocked off a star because I prefer Ramen Tatsu, Jinya or Monta over it. But they are really different styles. The broth was a little too strong for me. That said, they give you a very large serving which makes me happy for sure.

Gyoza was 5-stars

I'm always in searching for the best tonkotsu ramen in the states.  Since I'm in Vegas for the weekend, why not try Ramen Sora.  I had  the chasiu miso ramen.  Maybe I was still hung over, but I thought the broth was too salty ( and I love SALTY).  However, the pork belly, half soft-broiled egg, and the noodle was delicious. Definitely recommend this place.
I come here every week. The ramen is so good. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is the seating is very limited so try to get there before regular dinner time.

This is a great place for a different kind of Ramen.  Sapporo style ramen is slightly different.  I go here for the super Spicy kind of ramen as well as the only place that has Shio.  It gets a little busy, but overall, the service is amazing and the food is great.  I recommend when you want some good ramen.
Lived in Tokyo for 6 years. This is hands down the most legit Japanese Ramen in Vegas. It's small so expect to wait during busy hours but stick it out, it's worth it.

First visit, I ordered the regular shio ramen, and my friend the spicy miso ramen. Mine was pretty good, but I honestly liked the spicy ramen better, since I like the kick to it. 

Second visit, I ordered the spicy killer ramen out of curiosity. I have very high tolerance for spicy food, and this gave me a nice challenge. I finally finished all the noodles with like 5 cups of water, but the leftover soup was too good to go to waste, so I took it home and ate it with rice. It was that good.

I really wish that they have something in between the killer and regular spicy ramen though, the middle would give the best flavor. 

I would definitely come back when I get a chance to.

Ahhhh forget about it!!!! This truly is one of the best ramen experiences I have has. Everything we had was delicious. The appetizers of the pork belly cause us to order 3 times. Fried rice was tasty although I wish there was a bigger serving. Great cold beer to go with our dinner. Be prepared to wait though, but it's well worth it!!!

We got there at 11:00am and there were already a few people waiting at the door (they open at 11:30). People kept coming and there were soon a line outside the door, and half of them were JAPANESE! (Good sign) 

I ordered the corn and butter with miso base and I loved it! My friends tried deluxe and spicy and they liked it as well, I think the key is miso base, their miso is great!! I have been to a lot of ramen place and I have to agree with other reviewers that this one is the best so far! So come early and try it yourself!!!

I don't understand how this place got 4 stars. The porks are thick and tasteless and they are like the one you use to make broth. Noodles are okay but the soup base is not good. Save yourself time and just go to monta already
Ncie atmosphere and friendly staff, but ramen was a bit gluey. It also gets packed here during the weekends.

Service: 
Service was a little rushed at first, but the ramen took a long time coming out. Arrived at 11:30 on a Thursday before the lunch rush. By 12 it was packed with 10+ people waiting. 

Ambiance:
Kinda reminds me of some of the ramen places in Japan. 

Food:
We have dined here twice in the past. The first time the ramen was not hot. On our second visit we asked to make it EXTRA HOT and it was... hot enough? This time we again asked to make the soup EXTRA HOT... It was not extra hot. 

There was no steam coming off the soup. The menma (bamboo shoots) were still cold(!?). The soup was kind-of hot, but not nearly hot enough. With mostly japanese workers and japanese clientele eating Ramen you would think they would understand that the soup should be served AS HOT AS POSSIBLE. I want to use my asbestos lips and burn a few layers of skin off the roof of my mouth as is tradition when eating ramen. We told the staff and they touched our bowls to check the temperature? Weird. 

Besides the consistent temperature issues....

The chashu's dominate flavor is soy sauce. It lacks depth. The soup is rich, although plain. The noodles were simultaneously clumped and broken. It was one of the worst ramens I have had. 

Do not recommend.
Amazing hidden spot for locals. I recommend the   corn butter ramen, with shoyu based & no bamboo. The fried rice is extremely good & service is always quick & good.

This ramen was amazing. Hands down some of the best ramen I've had in a while. We're from out of town and wanted something that would hit the spot. This did that and more. The restaurant looks unassuming from the outside but inside it's actually really nice. Small dining area but the wait wasn't longer then 10 mins. We placed our orders quickly and the food was ready and at our table within minutes. My bf got the killer ramen challenge which he loved. The meat itself is what's spicy, by the end he was sweating enough to have to take his hat off. He would've gotten seconds if he hadn't been so full. I got chasu pork ramen in a soy sauce base with extra chasu, butter and corn. O. M. G. So freaking delicious. The total came out to under 30 bucks. Great food, great price we're definitely hitting this spot again when we come back next year

chasu bowl is my fav menu here. sweet and salty together and very smelly grilled pork . it s so good
i come here many time and never be dissapointed

My favorite ramen place! Love the thick noodles (the only kind they serve) and the fact that they have mango mochi for dessert. My kids always eat everything in their bowls here. Only thing is that everything is pretty high sodium, but then again all ramen seems salty so as long as they keep refilling my water glass I'm good!

we came because of the review.  they tried to imitate Japanese Ramen but didn't come close. the quality of the meat was no good.  soup was very salty w/ a bunch of subpar ingredients. waitress was rushing us to order, to finish, and to pay...  when they chanted "thank you" to departing customers, they didn't even look at them.  so it's more like noise than appreciation.  the only reason they scored 2 stars is because food came out pretty quick BUT the meat was cold.  you figure!

Richard Pro here with another review.

The ramen here is excellent, and prices are very reasonable. A Super size gives you double the noodles for $2. 

The broth is flavorful, the noodles are nice and soft, and they are very generous with their chashu slices.

This place was delicious!! Although, caveat, we had just flown in from the East Coast and were STARVING so at that point, even a half eaten chicken nugget might have been delicious. The noodles were really good, as was the broth. I also like how you can order a bowl of ramen with eggs, pork and seawood. The pork portions were really generous. My sister and I both enjoyed the eggs and thought they were especially tasty. If you get this platter, it comes with these eggs that have some kind of yummy sauce on them.It also had house made bamboo shoots which were also really tasty. I highly recommend this place. Like many other ramen joints, it seems like if they're really crowded, there would be a bit of a wait.

We had a minimal wait at 2:00pm and we came just in time as a bunch of parties arrived after us.  Everything we ordered was good...side fried rice, gyoza, shoyu ramen, miso ramen and the deluxe shoyu ramen.  Everything hit the spot on a chilly afternoon.  Glad we found this place and will return the next time we're in town.

I have been spoiled because i have not been able to find a place that is just as good in Chicago as Ramen Sora when I left LV.  I always get the Shio Broth Base,  its very light and not heavy like a miso base but it hits all the right spots with the Chashu, the noodles are soft but the right kind of chewy...all the ingredients work all together and make a perfectttt ramen.

Let me preface this review by saying that I have been coming here for over a year. Love the shoyu ramen, chashu, curry etc...However, tonight will be the last time I go because I found hair in my shoyu ramen and when I notified the waitress she told me that they wear hats in the kitchen, so she doesn't think its their fault. The hair was obviously not  mine because it was black and no one in my party has black hair. I explained I would take a small replacement as opposed to the large I ordered since I ate some until I found the hair. She then had to check to see if she could since they wear hats. Kidding?! Needless to say, I will never go back. Not even a sorry...just an implication that it had to be me cus they wear hats. What a shame...

This is the genuine Japanese Ramen!
I moved to San Francisco from Japan last year and have been missing Japanese Ramen.
Yes, I tried to look for the best ramen shop in San Francisco and San Mateo, but I couldn't find the one satisfied my Ramen love.
But finally I bumped into a genuine Ramen shop in America. Ramen Sora is absolutely amazing!! I really recommend it's Miso Ramen as our pride of Japan.

Never had ramen that wasn't made in the microwave until now. Chose to have my first bowl here at Ramen Sora. I had the deluxe Sora Ramen with a miso base, a melon cream soda and mochi ice cream for dessert. All of it equally delicious. The staff were very attentive and kind as well. If I ever find myself in Vegas again, I will definitely be making a trip back.

Tried their shio ramen along with a side order of curry rice.  After sitting down, order was taken quickly, and my hot tea was topped off three times before my meal arrived.  From there, things started going downhill a bit.  I had to move myself to a different spot on the table because it was so dark, I couldn't see what was in my bowl.  

The first sip of a bowl of ramen did not trigger all those wonderful memories of good ramen experiences.  For a shio ramen, the broth was definitely lighter in texture, not unlike cup noodle soup.  I know they say it's stock from over 24 hours of boiling black pork bones.  But the taste is definitely infused with too concentrated tastes of a variety of vegies.  And the after taste hung around too long on the palates, not like the deep seated after taste from savory fats, but from something more like MSG, or concentrated condiments.  If shio ramen is oil painting, I believe they served water colors.  My tongue was confused, and thirsty from the soup, and now that I needed tea, it stopped coming.

The high notes of vegies did not stop there.  The curry curiously had a strong carrot and tomato paste taste, unlike any Japanese curry.  At the end, I had to ask the waitress, is the chef Japanese?

Like all foods made with instant condiments, or chemicals, it actually "tastes" pretty good.  I do not have any evidence that their food didn't go through long hours of preparation so if I have offended anyone, particularly owner or chef, I do apologize.  But I do challenge that in the tradition of a good ol' bowl of ramen, the convenience of offering customers, hey if you think it's too light we have stuff to make it heavier, or if too heavy, we have stuff to thin it down, etc perhaps is too wishy washy.  Take a stance on Ramen Sora's take of what a shio ramen should taste like and present us with That.

Best Ramen House in Las Vegas in my opinion! The Deluxe Sora Ramen with miso broth is amazing. The chashu (slices of roast pork) that they lay out on top of the ramen is beyond delicious. The noodles are so chewy and delicious. They also serve a tasty chashu ramen. (get it with miso broth) Didn't know how good the chashu fried rice was until my wife ordered it. The service is normal. Not too expensive and you leave satisfied and full. I also enjoy the Japanese draft beer.

I have never eaten ramen that was not purchased from the local supermarket.

I do not know how to use chopsticks.

However, I know good food when I taste it.  And it's hard to find anything better than the ramen at Ramen Sora.

I went with the spicy miso, there was so much going on in that medium-sized bowl of noodles, pork, and broth.  

What seperates Ramen Sora from other restaurants of its ilk is the service.  As a big, goofy-looking white guy, let's just say that at many Chinatown restaurants, sometimes service is.......well........less than friendly.  Not the case here, everyone was very nice.  

This will be a regular spot in the rotation and I'm looking forward to trying different menu items.  You should do the same!  :)
Very tasty and I loved the texture of the ramen noodles. The chasiu had such great flavor, I loved it.  Great find off the strip at an affordable price. Definitely order a side of the gyoza as well.

I walked in at 10:33pm and there are only a handful of people in the restaurant, and was told they are closed because they stop serving at 10:30pm.  Well, how about you change your hours?  Never going back.

Had the spicy miso ramen. Chashu was average/so-so. Nothing special. Broth was alright. Ramen, decent. Service on the hand was good. Our server stopped by to check on us once and another came to refill our water.

Wish they blast the a/c. It would be nice when you're having hot soupy stuff on a hot summer night in Vegas. It was too warm inside the restaurant! Also, their front entrance needs to be more well lit. For a minute there (when I went), I thought they were closed.

All in all, 3.5 stars. Not bad, but moving on to try other places.

Finally, We've got other ramen restaurant other than Monta, (personally I do not consider Anime Ramen as a ramen restaurant, I haven't been there and I actually do not wanna visit).
I visited twice and this place is crowded, but the dining area is spacious and I like the confortable area. I also like Monta's environment, it's small and feels like a traditional japanese ramen shop, but I hate it when you seats near the entrance and those who are waiting will stand next to the dining area, it make me uncomfortable if I were seat there.
I've tried the Shio, Spicy Miso, Pork Fried Rice w/ house special sauce, Premium Pork ChaShu and Kurogoma dango.
The first visit of my Shio ramen was totally tasteless, I am not a fan of heavy seasoning, so the ramen soup is almost no favour at all, but the Spicy Miso was good. I also ordered Kurogoma dango with my girlfriend, it looks pretty but not really like it.
I ordered the Pork Fried Rice w/ house special sauce, Premium Pork ChaShu, and Shio ramen on my second visit. The Shio was pretty good, much better than my previous visit, but they forgot the order of my extra egg. My girlfriend and I love the premium chashu, they are delicious but also expensive $3.98 for 2 pieces!? I was like "are you kidding me?" anyway, the pork fried rice was just ok, it's tasteless and I like monta's fried rice better and i was kinda curious of the house special sauce because my server told me its just grave sauce, but I didnt taste any grave in the fried rice. Maybe the grave is supposed to put on top and they forgot.
The menu of Ramen Sora is meaningless, it looks like they got a lot of choices, but if you pay attention and you will find out that they only have FOUR different ramen with TWO different soup bases. if you order the Shio ramen and add the topping of green onion it became Negi ramen. it applies to all the others. its really not a necessary put to different ramen with each toppings on the menu.
I found i like monta better
Really like that they offer a spicy ramen here.  Great ramen place!

I love this place! Honestly, I like Sora more than Monta. 

The only problem I really had was when they gave us our soup spoons & dishes to put our gyoza sauce, they were all a little wet.

I usually wipe reusable utensils before I use them, but I still found it a little weird I had to dry them myself.

It would be nice if they invested in onetime use chopsticks.

Still good nonetheless!
Menu was confusing. probably will try the other ramen spot next just to compare. Spicy options are limited. Gyoza's weren't that good. Ramen was mediocre at best.

This is the only ramen shop in town and I know and the only one I need to know. I have been coming to it for about a year now, and its one of my favorite places to go to when Im just hungry and don't know what to get. Wheter I go with a large group of friends or just me and my sister, this places has not disappointed me once. Really big portions, great taste, and its cheap which is the best part. I mainly only eat ramen but recently I started eating their dumplings and theyre just as god damn good. Place is great for whatever occasion you want. Yes sometimes you have to wait awhile due to the fact that the place is usually very busy but I never mind waiting because I love the place so much. Great food, good beer, and great atmosphere.

Really on a soup kick these days. I ordered their large super super spicy ramen in miso broth because everywhere else's "spicy" has not had the kick I need. I got the spicy meat on the side per server recommendation and glad I did. Wasn't even halfway through before my nose got stuffy and my eyes started watering from how spicy this bowl of ramen was. Took breaks from the inferno that was my broth to devour the perfectly cooked pork and egg. My face is still tingly as I'm on my way home and I can gladly say my ramen/ spicy craving has been fulfilled. Will definitely be back to experience this strange yet delightful ramen induced pain again.

Excellent! Amazing taste, spicy ramen with extra spicy meat and oolong tea, service was quick, atmosphere roudy and fun!

edit: second time around, ordered house #1 special shio (salt) flavor...underestimated how strong the soup base flavor is, had to order tall beer to who it down, great experience, would come back again.

Good soup. Good chashio. 
Fried rice was so so. Yet, nothing that an iced cold beer cannot fix!!

I've got a fever....and the only prescription is more Ramen!  This place is awesome and the food is even better!  Parking is a pain, and the place is small so get there as soon as they open!  The Spicy Ramen Miso is my favorite!

The pork chashu and rice was awesome!!! Tried ramen with miso soup...I think out of all of them I like the spicy version. Always great service and great food. Always the go to spot when we crave ramen

Wherever I go I find myself comparing it to the ramen sold here. This place is my all time favorite and never fails to please. I order the spicy miso and it's perfect. My friends and I love this place for the price too!
Very Good, I like places with small menus cuz usually everything is good and that's true with this place. Super Fire Ramen and nice curry bowl!

Went here with three friends. We each tried the miso, shoyu and shio ramen. Soooo bomb. Came here hungover and dehydrated hahaha felt like a boss leaving the place.

Food was amazing. Great staff and environment. The wait time was a little big longer than usual given that we came in pretty late (around 4ish in the afternoon).

Craving was definitely satisfied although hundred miles away from home!
Good ramen place with super friendly staff. I like the simplicty of the menu with 3 different broths, good portion size and its reasonable priced. Definetly will be going back this establishment.

Ok, I always come here ever trip to Vegas but this time I tried a new ramen house up the road and boy was i disappointed! I came here today for lunch and omg I can't believe how amazing the food tastes! I won't ever try another place in Vegas again!!!!

I've been reading reviews and check ins for Sora for a while now, so we've been itching to try it. Unfortunately our opinions didn't match those of others. The building isn't very inviting, but that's to be expected in Chinatown. The inside was decent but can get quite loud if there are a lot of people with such a confined space.  The ramen itself, I thought, was very bland and lacking flavor. I didn't like not having the option of different noodles as is with many other ramen houses.  I really wish they would offer the garlic and pickled ginger on the table as well. 

As far as service, not too bad.  After we were done eating, no one came to check on us or bring our check so I had to go retrieve it after about 15 minutes. Other than that, they were friendly and had no problems with the order. 

All in all, we tried it but probably won't be going back. There are too many other ramen houses to try.
Absolutely incredible. Best ramen in Vegas hands down and I'm so picky!!! The wait can be extremely long on weekends but that is to be expected, I wish they would relocate to a bigger location!

Solid 5 stars review. It does not need to be expensive to get a high review.
I ordered the miso ramen bowl. It is I believe their signature dish. Came out fast. Tasted so good! I don't eat noodles or pho ever and I will start as of now. I really don't know how this stacks up to other spots.

However while I may not be an expert in ramen, I am an expert at service. My waiter was busy and one his co workers took my check presenter and brought me back my change. Nice to see teamwork.

Price for the miso ramen bowl? $7.50 
Put down that burger and sub and take a chance. Columbus did.

I like this place more than Monta. It has the perfect portion for my liking, and not too expensive. I always get the cahsu ramen with miso soup. The food comes out fast and service is average.
