But the food makes up for it. And I never had to wait for a table, I think only once because it was a big party of 8.

Always really excited to try a new ramen spot and this seems like a nice place, everyone seems very friendly, however it is a total bummer when you go out for dinner with your friends, wait 35 minutes for a table and then come to find that they not only have zero ATLEAST vegetarian items (minus plain sides of rice) on the menu, they don't do anything much to accommodate you at all. So enters the awkward dinner form hell where everyone you're with is eating and you're just sitting there with a glass of water, and then leave annoyed and hungry. I understand that a customer's diet restrictions can be a bit difficult at times, but for no basic veggie option, really?

This place is definitely overrated. Prices and portions are pretty decent here, but if you've had ramen from Japan, this is nothing like it.

I've never had such thick ramen (in soup) before. I would say it was half as thick as udon, 2-3x as thick as ramen from Japan. I don't mind thick noodles, but the thick ramen was kinda like pasta to me. 

The eggs were overcooked. The soft-boiled egg is probably one of the most important parts of authentic ramen and they boiled them for too long! The entire yolk should be liquid, not partially.

The broth was quite salty and filled with MSG. The Miso soup was actually a little spicy, but not mentioned in the menu. To me, the shoyu and shio broth were pretty much the same.

The chashu here was probably better than Japan. In Japan, the chashu were thin, dry pieces of pork but here, the chashu were thick and tender. Probably the only thing I actually liked from this place.

We were seated at a table where one side of the seats was against the wall. THE WALL WAS BURNING HOT! Around 42°C that day and there was barely any AC, only a few fans. Keep in mind the ramen was also hot.

Friday night date and trying to find a different noodle place in town since we only go to Monta ramen honestly makes it very hard to find anything better.... Good food and service but I think we will continue going to Monta.

I really enjoyed the ramen here. My particular favorite was the miso ramen with butter and corn; the corn gives the soup a slight sweetness and an extra bite, while the butter makes the broth creamier. 

But why the 3 stars you may ask? As an establishment, they do well making ramen. But compared to the other 8 ramen places I've been to in town, this place couldn't compare.
I always order the Miso Ramen, and it is consistently great! Friendly staff, reasonable prices, and great service.

Delicious ramen.  I had the house special.  The service is friendly, but there was an inexplicable wait to be seated.  They were busy, but there were open tables.  Anyway, once seated, my order arrived quickly.  The ingredients were very fresh and the flavors were terrific.  I would recommend this place.

This is my favorite ramen place in the country and I love that it's here in Vegas. I try ramen in every city I go to and always compare it to this place. Nobody can match their perfect noodles. It's become a little touristy, but it's worth the wait. I order the spicy miso every time and it's always amazing.

Pro's- Good Price, home made flavor, curry was good. 

Con's- wait time is long, very popular. My miso ramen dish was more "game-ee" or iron-ee than expected.  Some might enjoy the thicker flavored pork broth, it's wasn't bad just unexpected. It added up to something I stoped eating but having a small curry bowl first, I was more than full. 

I'll go back but try something else.  I had Ramen Chashu. So maybe the thick porky flavor is expected.  

Over all a thumbs up.

I love this place. It's definitely top 5 of my favorite restaurants in vegas. They are super speedy and efficient. I order the same thing every time the spicy shoyu ramen. It is actually spicy, which I don't feel like I find a lot. It has tons of flavor, it's to die for. I work close so I order to go a lot and it's ready really quickly. The staff is super nice and cheerful. I love this little place. I just wish there was one in henderson.

Over rated.
No wait when we went there around 11:30.
The waitress looks a little grumpy and inpatient.
The ramen itself is so so with the plain soup base and ok noodle. Their soft heart egg is pretty good tho. 
But when we were still finishing, they started to bring the bill early and feels like rushing us out. meh, not again.
their soup is very rich! a little crowded and needed to wait for 15 mins during lunchtime. Love the ramen. My Japanese said it's the best ramen in town :)

This is one of my favorite places to get ramen in Las Vegas. They have the biggest bowls in town so it's a great value. I suggest the deluxe ramen with the shoyu soup. Also get extra moyashi, egg, and cha-shu. The gyoza and the fried rice are delicious. The noodles are okay. They are a little thicker then I usually like but they are filling and tasty. 

They have quick service and I usually stop in here after a cold day or long day at work. Great place to take your fellow ramen. I think it's better ramen then monta

The seared chashu pork was super charred and fatty. It reminded me of fish for some reason, but still amazing. When combined with the ramen, however, it's all too rich. I wish I had some rice or something cleansing to chase it all down. We actually weren't able to finish all of it, and the last pieces we ate were separated from the fat because it was too much.

Both of us ordered the deluxe ramen. The noodles were perfectly cooked and the pork melted in my mouth. I wish there was a whole egg instead of a half, but that's a small fault.

Mediocre to me. Their ramen noodles were excellent, great texture and fresh. I don't really thick/rich miso broth but if you do you'll like theirs. I got the Ramen Sora which is not good especially with the combination of rich miso and seaweed it definitely clashes with the taste - fishy and salty taste. Maybe try their deluxe it looks like it'd taste better. Won't come back.

Miso Sora Ramen with Corn.  Damn damn good.

Ramen Sora is a small venue located in the plethora of Asian shops and restaurants along Spring Mountain.  It's unassuming from the outside, so GPS it to ensure you don't miss it.  Once inside, the restaurant has an authentic japanese noodle house feel to it.  Ramen Sora isn't that big so expect to wait at least 15 minutes before you'll get seated.  Once you get your food though, be prepared for one of the best bowls of ramen that you've ever had.

In the words of Drake... the miso broth is "the best I've ever had, best I've ever had, best I've ever had."  I don't know what they put in it.  But I clearly finished all of it and had nothing left in my bowl.  The noodles are the cooked perfectly.  The corn added texture with every bite.  The pork was suprisingly tender and the best I've had in comparison to other ramen places.  

Aside for the wait, this place is money.  My sister swears that it is the best place to go for a hangover cure as well.

First time I tried their ramen (really my first time because I cook instant ramen at home) it's was Mmm GOOD! 
I'm new at these ramen restaurants. I didn't know what to order or how. @Sora, Their menu is easy to look at.. I tried the shio with seaweed, pork and egg, it was yummy! Omg the Gyoza u gotta try it's really good too very tasty! Next time I'm gonna try the miso soup. This place is gonna be our regular ramen spot. Ambience is perfect for me, I like the music  they play.. Rock n Roll!
Server did not look pleased to assist our group of 10. She made it seem like it was a burden to get drinks other than water. Ramen was plain I got the spicy bowl, wouldn't go again.
From SoCal, and tried their Nori ramen a few years ago. It is my number one favorite ramen until this day.

The best ramen place I've ever been to. Let's start with their broth, rich and full of favors, it blends in with the meat and ramen noodles very well. Second, their chashu meat portion cut is very generous compared to other places, thick and big pieces of chashu slices. Whenever you're hung over or just want ramen, this place won't let you down
It's very good and I love the option to add spicy meat. But ramen for ramen I have to go with Daikokuya back home in Los Angeles. This place is a close second

We came at 11:45am on a Sunday n the restaurant was already packed...I ordered the spicy miso ramen with corn n seaweed added on n a melon cream soda...It was so good n filling...I'm very impressed with the quality of their pork n their noodle...Yum! :)
Best ramen in town by far! The spicy ramen is one of my all time favorite dishes. The spicy pork fried rice is also a nice compliment to your bowl.

My family had a miscommunication with one of the servers leading to a returned extra bowl of ramen, and from then on I felt like the service got a bit hostile. I'm glad another staff member checked up on us to remedy the situation. Apart from all of that, the ramen was fantastic. I got the spicy ramen, which was spicy enough to make me sweat but the spiciness did not overwhelm my tastebuds. I'm happy I didn't get the spicier version. Broth was a winner in my books, and I enjoyed it more than many offerings in LA and NYC. I would recommend the extra drive out of the strip for everyone.

Only reason why we come to Ramen Sora is because we like the ramen. There's already a bit of a wait and my boyfriend and I never mind waiting at all. We understand the demand during the cold season. However this time around we wait awhile as usual, finally get called to sit. The lady seats us at a four top table because that's all that was available. We sit side by side so we can be close. Another waitress now takes our order. We are now sitting and talking while we wait for our order...we get interrupted by the original waitress who sat us at the table to ask us to move to a two top table. We looked at her confused. She then says she has "3 persons waiting!" And says we can still sit side by side at the two top table....really lady?! Was definitely not good customer service!  she is the one that sat us to begin with than asks us to move because she has 3 people waiting! When we waited patiently like everyone else. And as we were waiting we did noticed there was a single person at a four top table...but they didn't ask that person to budge. Definitely if you are looking for a good customer service restaurant, you won't find it here! Just rude and then thinks two people have enough elbow room to eat at a small table! I don't think so!

Titah cravin for ramen and took us here. Wow really nice soup not to salty but just right! Really Ono and recommend it if you love ramen :) Shiso (salt) flavs is the best, they have the regular Miso and shoyu. Love they have extra sides like my tomago and bamboo shoots. With Gyoza and fried rice

I tried this place when I searched YELP for ramen in Las Vegas.  I wouldn't have tried the butter corn ramen if it wasn't for the reviews, glad I did. very tasty, I drank all the broth.  Ramen cooked to perfection.

Having been a frequent and consistently recurring customer of Monta for the past year I hate to say it, but another Ramen spot has stolen my heart... Ramen Sora! 

Not only do the offer 50% more ramen for ONLY $1 more, but their broth is outstanding! Made from a combination of pork broth and miso it is truly a pork lovers dream, which I am! Rich, salty, thick and hearty... perfect for rainy day or anytime a ramen craving hits. 

Watch out Monta... Ramen Sora is taking over!!!

I came here on a Sunday for lunch and there was a line trailing out the door. However, the wait was tolerable as the food was served quickly so the patrons were in and out pretty fast. Prices were definitely reasonable compared to the cost of ramen back in Chicago. I ordered a regular shio chashu ramen with corn. The chashu was probably what saved the ramen. The broth was underwhelming as it lacked flavor and the egg was a bit overcooked. I usually down most of the soup but I barely made a dent because it was so bland.

Years ago I moved into china town..well actually I moved into an old neighborhood in Las Vegas area that slowly became china town. (I was here first!) I saw the whole transformation, I saw my favorite video store and other favorite places turn into massage parlors. but before all that, when I first moved into the area while exploring the neighborhood I walked from my house to spring mountain and ran into this little place called Mario's hair salon at 4490 spring mountain, decided to give them my business and got a haircut.....and this is where the story begins.
  I had the worst haircut of my life at This place! and I was so upset and pissed off that in a moment of rage I cursed the place!  Mario went out of business and so did all the business that followed him after that. I've seen restaurants in this locale come and go and even though I never tried any of the previous restaurants I think is time for me to finally return to the place of occurrence, besides what's the worst they could do? ruin my lunch? They can't ruin my hair anymore, not even Mario, most of it is gone! so after all this years, I walked into the place again...
   I didn't know how big Ramen is in japan, I always considered Ramen as fast junk food, or something you would eat when broke but with all this ramen places popping up in Chinatown I decided to venture outside my world of instant ramen noodles and try the real thing, so I followed the wave of fellow yelpers to Ramen Sora to see for myself what is the big deal with this place.
 Ramen Sora brings the traditions and recipes of Sapporo Japan, they take their ramen very seriously making the stock by boiling bones for almost a day. ( not the three minute wait that I was used to.) the decor is minimalist but functional since the place is kind of small every square inch is taken advantage of, atmosphere is very relaxing and you feel like you are seating with the rest of the other customers because everyone is so close but do not worry enjoy your ramen and slurp freely! ( my neighbor did) The always smiling waitress Taeko, recommended me the shio ramen which ended up being surprisingly good, it was light and not too fatty, although I wish they had seafood ramen but hopefully in the future they'll expand the menu to more choices. They will also be serving alcohol in the near future, and I can attest to that since I was in the same hearing (for a different matter) when the owner asked for permission in front of the board, and it was approved!
I'm glad Ramen Sora is the new resident of 4490 spring mountain, I was always afraid another massage place would take over like all my other favorite places in the area. I really liked the food and the service and I believe this place will be here for years to come. For my part, the curse has been lifted, good luck Ramen Sora!  and thank you for the happy ending!

This place is amazing.  I go there maybe twice a month with a good friend of mine.  The food is delicious and the service is top notch.   The corn and butter miso with a side of spicy meet is my favorite.  Perfect place to go out to eat if you are on a budget.

I was here over the Thanksgiving Holiday from SoCal.  I stopped by for lunch with my wife right when they opened before we checked into Encore.  The Ramen was very good.  The broth was was excellent.  The noodles were cooked perfectly.  There was also plenty of meat along with the rest of this Japanese Goodness.  I will definitely be back whenever I am in Vegas.  Definitely worth any sort of wait.

My Japanese friend recommended me to eat Sora ramen if I visit to Vegas and I'm glad I listened to him! I would say this is a Legitimate Hokkaido ramen.
Hokkaido ramen is known as miso based soup with butter and personally it is always my favorite ramen style when I was in Japan. The price is very reasonable, which I was happy about. If you look for this quality ramen in CA, you would have to pay $4, 5 more.  I will definitely recommend anyone who loves ramen!
This place is yummy! I always order Miso Ramen and extra Chasu! Service is great and the atmosphere is really nice too.

Their ramen is ok. I think the killer for me was how extremely salty their broth was even though I tend to eat most foods on the salty side. I also think they're overpriced for an average Japanese ramen house.

A friend introduced me to Ramen Sora and I'm glad he did.  The ramen is freshly made, the miso broth is fantastic, and the whole 'vibe' of the place feels like a big family.  I usually get the regular-size Chashu Ramen with miso broth; it is delicious and filling.  My wife, who is not a daring eater, was wowed right away.  

If you are going for lunch, get there shortly before opening because there will be a line to wait otherwise.  It's that good!

I'm a ramen noob but I'm loving me some ramen right now. Big bowl of just-spicy-enough ramen delivered hot and fast. I came in about 3pm on a Tuesday. Busy but I was seated right away. 

Chef vaguely remembered me from a couple years ago when I photographed a new ramen dish right in his working restaurant, for his ad campaign with Las Vegas weekly magazine, a photo he also uses on his menu and that lives on my website  www. stevenjosephphotography .com/food

I asked to try the bowl I'd photographed. He said "very spicy, OK?" My stomach said "not OK" so I tried something mellower from the civilian section.

This place is small, comfortable, cozy, but not crowded. Lots of room between seats.

Again, I'm a noob, but I think this place is the real deal. The fact that I'm one of the few gringos in here suggests it is autentico.

Now that I've found it again I'm bringing my family here!

VEGETARIAN Perspective**

So upon seeing a very cool show called "Recycled Percussion" my friend Alida (shout out) and I decided to get some grub. 
It was her pick; so 'tis ALL her fault! ....haha, kidding.

PROs:

Great parking space
Easy to find directionally
Friendly service
Cheap (I'll take quality over price any day)
Beautiful ambiance
Seat yourself vibe with casual attire
etc...

NEG:

...has to do with showing up with an empty stomach (but open mind) and thinking, "It's Ramen. I LOVE ramen. NOT a vegan so there's bound to be something".... Alida was kind enough to initiate the question of, "What do you have for veg's? Response- "NOTHING! nothing for vegetarian"

I do highly appreciate that the waitress knew her menu and communicated that to me honestly. Upon an awkward "Shall we leave...?" look, she offered to have a dish of fried rice + egg NO pork custom made and it was *delicious*... just sucked being hungry. 


BUT HEY, it was a good meal, reasonably priced, Alida enjoyed her dish AND she is not allowed to choose the next restaurant ;-) HA!

My fiancé loves ramen, so we decided to come here at 2pm on a Friday. There was a 15-20min wait as the restaurant is small. There was a lot of foot traffic coming in the restaurant but when people heard it was a 45min wait they left.

I recommend getting the Miso Broth. There was a lot of flavor. I also loved the noodles they were chewy and slightly thicker.

Overall good experience. I would go again. I like it more than monta ramen.

Really not the best place for ramen. Maybe it's good if you've never had ramen before in your life. But being from California and spoiled by the numerous ramen spots, Shoku did not impress me. The broth was not flavorful. The consistency of the noodles felt overcooked.If I ever come back, which I doubt, I would try something else other than ramen on their menu.

This was good stuff. I must say I am a bigger Pho fan than Ramen but this was excellent. I had the spicy Miso and it was memorable. I love overall flavor and it was perfect for lunch. I will try some others and see hwo they are as well! I will be back!!

Overall this place is awesome. However when I ask to order more noodles I was told I wasn't allowed.  I was offered sizes when ordering. However didn't really think about it nor was it explained. I ask if I could pay for the next size up and just recieve the noodles. The manager told our waitress NO. That to me wasn't good customer service !!

Today in vegas, I decided to try Sora Ramen. This place is a very situational place for me.

The service was great. Waters were refilled in a timely manner. Food came out fairly quickly.

On to the food. We started with the osumami platter, which didn't have any flavors that stood out. Chashu was well made though. Melt in your mouth good combined with a smidgen of char. The Ramen was a situational type of food for me. The broth is very thick, so you're in a bind trying to reach the bottom of the bowl. While the first few bites are good, the next few bites get really heavy. Perfect for a cold winter night or even a sick day, but you'll definitely feel fatigued eating this in the summer. To balance out the heaviness, I added a bit of curry to my broth. DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE the aroma and the balance that the curry provides. It is an excellent pairing.

Overall: Good
Will eat again!

For Ramen, this is THE place for it in Vegas.  There are no better alternatives.  In a small cream color building, they really décor the place quite well, it really had a Japanese ramen cart feel to it.  They are located on Spring Mountain Road within blocks of Chinatown.  

We had some Seared Chashu for starter, they were excellent with a perfect balance in tender and crisp.  They serve Hakata style ramen, even though Tonkotsu was originated from that region, we were in the mood to try something else.

For the daring souls such as myself, you cannot go wrong with the Killer Spicy Shoyu Ramen.  The broth and spices just go so well together, and the level of heat was at the right level for me.  We also had a bowl of Deluxe Miso Ramen, and the miso broth was quite tasty as well.  Their chashu was quite big compare to other ramen joints I visited. 

Ramen Sora, most likely the only place I know for sure that I can get a nice bowl of ramen in Vegas.  The server was excellent, and their tables turn over so fast, there were already a few groups waiting at the door after we were done eating.

very good ramen. Old school spot on Spring Mountain Road in Chinatown. Had the Chashu Ramen: great broth, three bid pieces of chashu literally fell apart. Original ramen recipe. All in all, and great place for ramen. Only downside is that it is a small space. Was there on a sunday afternoon; so it wasn't crowded. But I imagine that dinnertime might involve a wait. But it will be worth it.

This place never disappoints. It's my #1 spot for ramen in Vegas. Their ramen noodles tastes fresh and doesn't feel like instant noodles. Maybe they make the noodles in-house, I'm not sure, but it tastes like it. Their broth are very full bodied and tasty, specially the miso. And their chashu is what really tops it off. Getting extra chashu for only $2.50, gets you 3 extra slices. These are very generous slices. And for an extra $2.00 you can upgrade to a Superbowl. There's more but I'll stop here since it's making me hungry. Just thought I'd contribute to my favorite ramen spot

This is one of our must places whenever we go to Vegas.  The ramen is so tasty regardless which you get.  Get there before 5PM for dinner, though. If you go afterwards, expect to wait at least 30 minutes.  Basic ramen starts at $7 and up to $10.  But you can customize by adding extra meats, noodles and such for extra couple of dollars.  I usually get Deluxe Sora Ramen with miso base and supersize it (double the noodles) for $2 more. Soup is so flavorful and yummy.  I wish I lived closer to this restaurant (or if they would open one in San Francisco area) so I can go more often.

I love this place! This is a hidden gem located off of a busy street in china town. If you blink, you'll miss it. I've eaten in the restaurant once and order take out from them a couple of times a month. I highly recommend the Corn Butter Ramen. I found the service to be great both eat in and for take out. This place is pretty popular so be prepared to wait a little bit for a seat during busy hours. It's a small restaurant so it fills up quick. Definitely worth the wait!!

Maybe my expectations were too high but I was a bit disappointed. Had the miso ramen. It did not have the depth of flavor I expected from a ramen only joint. noodles were OK but not the chewiest. will probably return but def not a fave
This place is good but not anything crazy. I got their best selling house ramen. It was nothing to cheer about. The broth was okay. The noodles were fine. Their credit card machine was broken.

Do you like good ramen? How about affordable ones? Good portions? Is there a long wait time in Jinya? If the answer is yes, you've hit the Ramen Sora bingo. 

I would honestly label it as a budget friendly ramen place. Don't let the great prices fool you, the taste is pretty spot on. Their small size Deluxe Sora Ramen really made me feel full borderline bloated and I'm a big dude. Their chashu pork is a melts in your mouth experience. 

The place looks a little run down but has adequate space. Speedy service and attentive waitresses. 

To be honest, the only reason why I didn't give this place a full 5 is because I prefer a different place. Other than that, there's no reason for you to not visit / like this place. 

Food 4/5
Price 5/5
Venue 4/5
Portions 5/5
Service 5/5

I've been here on a few occasions and have enjoyed the Ramen. 4 stars for the "USUAL" Ramen Choices. 4.5 stars for the "SHIYO" or Salt Ramen. Most places don't do the salt ramen and those that do, usually over salt, to the point of not wanting it anymore. While not as good as I've had in multiple cities in Japan. It was delivered with the greatest enjoyment I've had stateside. Service was great. Line out the door busy. Still having polite service with perfect presentation.

I wasn't blown away by the ramen here. I ordered the butter corn ramen in shoyu and the flavor of the butter and shoyu together was a little weird. I also had a curry bowl and while I am familiar with Japanese curry, the flavor here was too much; it overpowered the chasu and there wasn't a good balance between the rice and the sauce. 

The service here, however, was on point. They will not seat you until your entire party is here and if you're wondering why - it's because the place is small and seating is limited and it gets busy quickly. We went on a Monday at 11:30 am and it was 50% filled. There are sets of tables of 4 and then one large table that I think accommodates 10 people (maybe 12). It is a community table, so be prepared to eat with strangers. By the time we left an hour later, it was 90% filled with 3 groups waiting for tables. 

All in all, it was ok. I recommend the spicy ramen bowl and the miso broth.

Ramen Sora is my "go to" when I'm craving a bowl of hot ramen on a chilly night. 

I really like getting a lot of broth and less noodles and they are accommodating to it for $1 more. They also have the option of getting a larger size for only $1 more. 

I like the broth here A LOT. 
They have three different broth options: Miso, Shoyu, and Shio. 

My favorite broth is the miso because it is savory and full of flavor. The noodles are really good and the soft boiled egg is my favorite! 

The spicy ramen is alright, it tends to get extremely spicy after having eaten more of the broth.

Decent Ramen especially the price. Normally at other Ramen places, it's about $10-$15 for a bowl of Ramen. You can get a bowl of decent Ramen with meat, bamboo shoots for about $8-$10.  I tried the spicy groudnd pork, their special soup, with bamboo shoots, green onions, and bean sprouts. Their special soup was good, not too salty. And their noodles was I think very good. It's not the typical Ramen noodles that looks/taste like packaged ones.
This place has good curry! The staff is very friendly but the restaurant is very small. Everything is very affordable on the menu.

Came here one night with some friends, as I was craving some good Ramen.  Being from Hawaii, I have pretty high expectations of good Ramen. ;)

I had the Miso Ramen, which was pretty good.  The broth was very tasty and the price was pretty decent.  The portion was also pretty big as I remember not being able to finish the whole thing.  Service was great and they seemed pretty child friendly as a friend of mine brought her 1.5 year old and they were fine with him wandering around the place and dancing (it was empty and he wasn't bothering anyone).  

Will definitely be back!

Close comparison to monta Ramen bigger servings and more broth with more selections. The place is definitely bigger than Monta Ramen each has a unique take on Ramen noodles and each are good. We just had Sora Ramen on the weekend although they do need to get more servers for the place since its packed all the time, Packed meaning its really good :). Otherwise what they lack in service they more than make up for it in quality and price. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants Ramen.
Best Sapporo style ramen in vegas! Gyoza is excellent and they have draft Kirin ichiban!

Ramen Sora, I really wanted to like it here, but the Gyoza tastes like it came fresh out of a bag of frozen wontons from Costco. The noodles were great, they had a good chew to them. The shio broth was so so, it didn't seem to have much depth. The egg was great, but the bamboo shoots were cold :(
Was my first time having "real" ramen & I was glad I came here! Really good & the waitress was good about newbie recommendations.

The main reason why i went here, was apparently this is suppose to rival monta. As the #1 & #2 of ramen spots in the vegas valley. Had the miso ramen, the broth was super thick, packed with flavor. They claim to have authentic sapporo noodles. Not sure if they were it. But it was definitely good! My only gripe was i wish they put more pork slices in the ramen. But definitely a good bowl of ramen if you are in the mood for one.

They break your car windows and steal shit out of your car here. It was brought to the owners attention and they did not care. They said their cameras don't even work and they're only there "for show". Stay safe when attending this restaurant.

Well not my favorite ramen place in china town. But I have to say it was nice and not as crowded as some ramen places. So the atmosphere was more Japanese dining with a ethnic flavor to the place. I did enjoy the staff and atmosphere but the ramen did lack something I couldn't put my finger on.  So the ramen is sub par but if you dont mind a little lacking of flavor and no lines this is the place for you.

I've gotten into a habit of always getting ramen whenever I go to Vegas (not on purpose though, friends just love ramen and I'm not a picky eater). I think i've been to about 5 different Ramen joints. But I only remember about 3.

I got the Spicy Miso Ramen, it looked nothing like the picture when it came out lol, but it still tastes good. Wish I had ordered the gyoza, its my usual go-to appetizer. Probably will if I come back to this place again and order the screaming for vengeance ramen (lol). The Spicy Miso Ramen wasn't as spicy as i would've liked it to be. It comparable to like a teaspoon of sriracha mixed into the bowl in terms of spice.

Of the 5 Ramen spots I've been though, of the 3 I remember, this is my 3rd... LOLOL sorry, it was really hot the day I came, maybe it had an effect on my judgement.

Friendly staff. If you're looking for authentic-esque ramen, this is your go to. Off of the overpriced Vegas strip. I got the miso spicy ramen and it was delicious. The noodles are homemade and the broth was amazing.

I finally had to come here after hearing from everyone how this is their favorite ramen place. Thankfully, my party of 7 came here at a good time and was able to get seated fairly quickly. Just be wary that if you do come here with a big party, it is a very small place. 

I liked that their menu was simple and didn't have an overabundance of options. Typically, I have high expectations if a place has a small menu because they should be specializing and perfecting in those dishes. I ordered the Deluxe Sora Ramen. However, I never got to taste it, and here's what happened:

Me and two other people in my party ordered the same thing, but instead we were brought out the Killer Ramen (their spiciest ramen) which was previously called Screaming for Vengeance, I believe. When we brought this to the waitress' attention she said "no, this is what you all ordered" to which then proceeds to show us her notebook of what she wrote and justify the situation...Um, okay there's 7 of us here and we all heard each other order Deluxe Sora. Instead of trying to fix the situation, she kept justifying herself and said, "well, I repeated the order and asked you if you were sure you wanted a large.." First, we didn't hear her. Second, we later found out why she asked if we were sure...because the Killer Ramen is extremely spicy. Be more specific about what you are trying to confirm. We just stared at the mistakes cause it wasn't what we wanted, and she just star
ed at us like she didn't want to try to fix it, so I got frustrated and said we'll just keep the mistakes. Thankfully, I handle spicy food very well (my friends claimed so too) and the ramen tasted yummy, but 2 minutes into it, they were drenched from sweating. Yep, make sure you mean it when you say you can handle spicy. I felt bad for them.

Lastly, we asked the check to be split four ways, and the waitress gave us a dirty look and said "why don't you guys just split it 2 ways". Well, obviouslyyy we're grouped up differently, so it's easier for us to pay that way. I wish this was a biased judgement of how the waitress treated us, but everyone in my party noticed it too.

I'll be back for a second try with an updated review since the ramen was good, but I couldn't fully enjoy it. I hadn't eaten all day and the killer ramen killed my stomach...

This place didn't really appeal to my taste buds. I'm the kind of girl that grew on super strong flavored food, the more salt/sweet/sour/bitter/etc the better. Even though I was not a fan of the shio broth myself, I really feel that others would enjoy the light broth. The floating oil droplets didn't bother me at all and I thought overall it was pretty good. I did enjoy the thick chewy noodles but the broth however was light and actually tasted like chicken soup to me. =x  

The service was excellent! My bf and I had some questions and the server took the time to explain everything to us. Water glasses were also promptly refilled. A+++ for service!

So I guess Sora is the place if you want a lighter brother and with a thicker chewier noodle than Monta.
I love this place even the broth is delicious!!! Would recommend and I can say this is 100% the best ramen I've ever had and best in Vegas. Their prices are cheap too!!!
My friend wanted me to try something new and I must say the ramen here is really good. I had the Spicy Miso ramen with extra pork. I shall return again.
Good Ramen. Next time I need to try the Miso - had a spoonful of someone else in the party & it was so wonderful tasting. They were wonderful in splitting checks for our party as well.

Another good Ramen shop in Vegas!  I love it.

As many have mentioned, Ramen Sora is on a par with Monta Ramen.  The shop is easy to find and is spacious... though part of this spaciousness comes not from the actual square footage of the shop, but because the interrior is designed in such a way that there is considerable open (and wasted space in the middle.

One thing that Monta had going for it is the variety if menu items other than Ramen, like Cha-han (fried rice), etc. But when it comes to Ramen, I think that Ramen Sora rises above Monta.

My wife and I went on a Monday afternoon, around 2 pm. There was no long wait list, though by 2:40 pm, there was 4 or 5 groups waiting for seats. Once seated, and order taken, the food came out quickly. I ordered the signature Deluxe Sora Ramen, Miso flavor, and my wife had the Shoyu Ramen.

What I think sets Sora above Monta for me is the broth.  The broth at Sora is not too salty, gentle, yet complex flavor. My tonkotsu miso broth had very gentle flavors, with almost a peanutty aroma. I was able to finish the whole broth without feeling it being too salty. My wife's Shoyu broth was the same way. You could taste the pork bone broth, hint of shoyu, a bit of sweetness and some herbs.  Very nice.  I find Monta's broth to be too salty at times.

The tonkotsu broth at Sora is on the very light (not thick) kind which is very refreshing.

The noodle is medium thick wavy noodle with sufficient chweyness.  I give it a 10 out of 10.

The cha-shu is melt in your mouth tender, though this is where I felt a bit excess of saltiness. Still very very good.

We also had the gyoza which is very good also. Tender filling, lots of juice, and again, not too salty... in fact you could really taste the sweetness... 

All in all I think that Sora may be my new favorite ramen shop in Vegas.

When we talk about Hokkaido-style ramen, the first thing that comes to mind is miso butter corn ramen. And Sora offers exactly that! A happy regular customer here.

Their spicy miso ramen is the bomb!

Ok. They do not have anything vegetarian. Well, unless you want white rice. So, they were friendly and all, but obviously do your research before coming. I ended up ordering a coke before I realized I couldn't eat anything here and then just leaving. Lame!

Broth: miso
Usually just order the regular miso ramen and add extra bamboo shoots.

We usually order extra charsiu. Sometimes the charsiu bowl with rice is too burnt so we like the premium seared charsiu pieces better. 

Their Melon sofa is very refreshing! 

Love eating ramen because it's so filling. When I eat pho I don't always finish everything but when I eat ramen I do.
I CRAVE this place. This is a great place for 1-3 people max. Homemade noodles, great broth (go miso), and excellent customer service. I highly recommend this place.

The incredible rich flavors served in a bowl here are a must try and repeat!  My new favorite is their butter ramen in shoyu broth.  Their noodles are some of the best I've tasted and their sides like the gyoza and rice bowls are a great addition to any meal. 

This place is definitely happening as it is almost always packed and it didn't help much that about a dozen of us wanted to sit together last time we came here, but they were very accommodating including separating checks for us which is almost always frowned upon everywhere else. 

Great place to get your ramen fix and warm up!

I tried the spicy, soy-based ramen and it was really good! The server was very attentive, always refilling our drinks as needed, and the price was decent for the amount of ramen you get. I'd come back.
The miso ramen was delicious.  The ramen noodles were perfectly chewy and the soup was fantastic (according to my 9 year old foodie). The service was very nice too.

First time at Ramen Sora! This place has waitlist but we were sat immediately. I guess, we were lucky! 

We ordered the deluxe sora ramen, otsumami platter, pork fried rice, gyoza and curry bowl. It is one of the best ramen place in town. Otsumami, pork fried rice and curry bowl were very tasty! Not a big fan of their gyoza. 

We will definitely come back if we are in town.

We were starving and forgot to take pictures of other food.

This place is the most authentic ramen in Vegas. Tried several places and this one is on point. Busy and hard to get seated, be prepared for a wait. Come off hours and make sure everyone is there - they don't hold tables for split parties. You pick the style and base of your ramen, adding what you like. They have several side offerings, but ramen is their specialty. Get the deluxe and call it a day.

This was my favorite place here in Las Vegas for ramen. But its still the top 3 easliy.... I love the atmosphere and the servers. So polite and theie very fast as well. The menu is your basic soups n add ons. But they also have great drinks and desserts as well. I like comin durring lunch when its busy. Has a great feel here. I enjoy seeing other people enjoy great ramen. :)

I personally don't care for the taste of this ramen base.  It has a very different flavor that is in the miso and the shoyu base. The chasu pork does not seem to be as boldly flavored as other ramen places I have had. It also seems somewhat dry.  Of course, I compare ramen to those that I have had in Japan. I'm sure this is a great place if you are new to ramen, or am not as picky as I when it comes to ramen. I'm sure there are many who love this place, as I do see by the reviews. But my personal preference, I would rather go somewhere else. They do have good and fast service.
My new favorite ramen! Shin-Sen-Gumi step aside. If you love thick ramen noodle you will love this place. I love the spicy miso ramen!!! Nom nom nom, flavorful and delicious! Long wait though :(

The wait is usually kind of long unless you come on a school day at a time people rarely eat, like 4pm Tuesday. Unless everyone reads this and decides to come at that time, then I guess the wait will be long then. Anywho, I've made it a ritual when my cousin comes into town, we eat ramen here, and drive to Boca park for our favorite ice cream place. She never gets tired of it, and it usually becomes her motivation for coming into town by herself from Cali. Staff is a little rushed, but they're overall very nice. The food is something I crave once in a while. The noodles are the perfect texture, the atmosphere is cozy, and while there isn't a lot of room, it just makes it part of its charm. I love how the pork melts in my mouth, and how the menus are so simple.

If you want Tonkotsu Ramen, don't expect to find it here.  

The reason for giving them 2 stars wasn't just because they don't make Tonkotsu broth, their ramen was too salty, oily, and they don't give you enough broth.  1 reason to eat ramen is to drink the flavorful broth, but the ramen we ordered barely had enough broth to cover the noodles, and it was way too oily & salty to drink it.  I barely touched the ramen, and for a ramen enthusiast, this rarely happens.  In addition, they wouldn't seat us till our whole party was there, but it wasn't peak hour and the place barely had anyone in it....

I also ordered a side of Japanese pork fried rice, that was good and the portion was quite big. 

With the abundance of good ramen places in Vegas, I will be going elsewhere next time I want good ramen.

Best ramen place in town. At times there is a bit of a wait but it's totally worth it and the line usually goes pretty quick. I don't think I've ever waited more than 20 Minutes. My favorite menu item is the spicy miso ramen. I also like adding butter.

This place is great.

Many people will say that Monta is the best ramen spot in town. Sora is right up there and can argue for supremacy too.

You get three choices in broth, and the noodles are supposedly direct from Sapporo.

I've never been steered wrong here, but just be aware that the Killer Spicy ramen is legit spicy...even with my south Asian palate.

My favorite is the shoyu-miso broth...it's a good middle of the road broth.

The dining room is chill, comfortable and casual.

Parking can be a bit of a pain, but there is a residential neighborhood right behind it, so you can park on the street.

All in all....a solid 4 star review.

I am happy that there is another ramen option other than the more busy Monta Ramen in the Chinatown area.  I've been a couple times and the broth isn't as intense as Monta Ramen.  The noodles seem thicker, which is good for me because I like thick and chewy noodles.  The chashu is just as tasty and fatty-licious.

Would you say I like Sora Ramen more?  I would just say it's different.  Like comparing apples and oranges and like comparing ramen from different areas in Japan.

Conclusion:  Delicious Ramen.  Give it a try.

Ramen Sora stands by itself in a small white building.  It is directly behind a larger restaurant that goes by a similar name (something Sura).

By the exterior appearance, my husband and I would not stop at this place. However, thanks to yelpers' reviews - we find this place a gem in the Chinatown of Vegas.  This is our second time here. We plan to come again the next time we are in town. 

We ate at both Monta and Sora Noodle Houses.  Monta is okay. In our opinions, Sora ramen soup is exceptionally delicious and savory.

Best ramen ive ever had.. i got the miso ramen and added my own spice and it was absolutely delicious, not like any other ramen ive had.. however its a really small place so be prepared to wait up to an hour.. but its worth the wait!! So good!

Waited in line for an hour-after calling before hand to ask how long the wait was told only 10 to 15 minutes on the phone-they refused to reserve a spot for us. The menu was honestly disgusting. Everything came with pork and pork base. I asked them if they could make a soy based soup or if they had tofu they said no all they had was basic rice and basic curry but because I had waited so long in line I decided to order their basic curry and rice anyways. I also ordered Edamame not only was the curry low-quality they did not refill our drinks once during the time we were eating. I never got the edamame that I ordered. The only thing I have good to say about this place is at least the waitress informed me that everything was filled and based in pork that was nice of her to be honest with us. $35 dollars wasted. I will never return here again with my family.

I'm sorry Monta, but Ramen Sora has you beat. Even my husband who felt that Monta was the top of the top in Las Vegas ramen world concurs with me. Our initial intent was to go to Monta, but the line being ridiculous as it generally tends to be, we decided we would not wait. I remember Ramen Sora was right down the street and was also pretty highly reviewed. Although skeptical, my husband decided to go along with my idea. The wait was about ten minutes, and the interior about 3 times as large as Monta's.  There was a constant influx of people. We were seated by a window and it being 110 degrees out, it was a bit warm. That is my only gripe. 

We were promptly served water and the refills kept on coming. We ordered two sides of the seared pork belly which were delicious and I would highly recommend. I went with the Chashu Ramen and added corn with the shoyu (soy sauce) base. My husband ordered the Corn Butter Ramen with the miso (fermented bean paste) base. The portions were great and there was double the pork belly than what I have found at Monta. I generally opt for the tonkotsu (pork) base, so this was new to me but nevertheless extremely flavorful and delicious. The noodles are a bit on the harder side than at Monta, but I quickly grew to like it.

I liked the fact that many of the options came pre made and you did not have to do a billion add ons in order to get a generous serving of ramen and the additions. I would dare say that Ramen Sora beats Monta on every level.
Every time we come here, the place is clean, we're helped promptly and regularly by friendly staff, and the food is great! I always recommend this place to others.

I tried the chasu ramen ... such a big disappointment. One of the worst chasu ramen compare to the ones in LA.
I should have known better to order something else or go to a dif restaurant. 
And the meat was very very salty. The salty after taste is still in my mouth.
Love this place ... Recommend the the huge cashu bowl and butter corn ramen. Big portions you can easily share with someone but most importantly friendly staff. I would come again.

Wow!  I now know what all the rave is about ramen.  I didn't want go, because 1) I don't eat noodles 2) I though it would taste only a notch above those packaged ramen noodles that cost 25 cents a pack, so why would I pay about $10 bucks for the same thing?  I came here because I had a pushy guest from NJ that wanted ramen he had in LA.  So I selected Sora based on Yelp reviews and my husband once got ramen at Monta and it wasn't good beside they were shut down once for health violations.

Service was a little choppy, but all 4 of us were annoying "newbies" with several questions regarding our dietary issues (no red meat, shellfish allergy, low carb). So I understand since she was the waitress and also the cashier and the only one working the front. Anyway, the waitress would stop taking our order to serve other people and come back and continue with our order.  I was very pleased that I was able to order my shio deluxe ramen with the noodles on the side.  

All of us loved our ramen choices.  The shio broth was so rich, simple, and comforting.  The noodles looked good and fresh, my guests ate all my noodles, in addition to theirs. So I I take it, the noodles were good. The sliced pork was tender and with the perfect amount of fat that just melts in your mouth.  I've been craving this, ever since I had it.....MUST. GO. BACK.FOR. SOME. MORE!
My girl and I love trying new styles of food and then trying to find the best.  We have unanimously voted this is the best ramen place in the city.  Check it out!  The broth is absolutely to die for!

First time here, so I enter the restaurant and sign my name even though there was no waiting but ask if high chair or table. I got a table, oh yeah parking was easy too.  The place kinda small but cozy and cute! 

I order the Shio Ramen and I just a bit too salty but not know it taste, it was pretty good. The Noodles were very good and pork was cook to perfection.  The Gyoza were so amazing, chewy dough and filling in was so good,  juicy and spice bended well and dipped sauce was delicious. So next I'm going to try the Shayu broth.. I'll be back soon!

finally got to try out this place last weekend! very good ramen, the noodles are not as thin as monta but still has a good bite, which is good coz there's nothing worse than soggy noodles in your ramen bowl. tried the spicy shio ramen and the broth and the noodles were perfect. the shio broth was not as salty like the usual shoyu broth. the meat slices are also thicker and not like those circular meat slices with a lot of fat. i was just hoping it would be a lot spicier though. the staff was also very friendly and i guess since it's fairly new, there was no wait to get a table. overall, i like it better than monta. :)

Went here for the first time Thursday night around 7pm for an after work dinner with coworkers. I've had some pretty amazing ramen in my lifetime and this is probably the best ramen I've had in Vegas! The only downfall and reason it's not 5 stars is the size of the restaurant. There's maybe 10 tables in the whole place, so the wait can be super long. But the ramen is delicious, especially the spicy ramen! I love the spicy meat they add in, and their pork belly is delicious. Definitely will return.

What does "sora" mean in Japanese? Sky or Heaven! I suppose is a vast array of ramen found in heaven. Whatever it means I'm glad I was able to slurp on the Deluxe Sora Ramen $10. My hunt for Japanese ramen has ended here (for the moment) with a bountiful belly full of ramen noodles, delicious miso broth, thick slices of chashu fatty soft pork belly, minced scallions, Soft boiled egg, seaweed and a bold complimenting nuttiness and mild sweet flavors. 

You can select the type of broth base: miso (fermented bean paste), shoyu (soy sauce) or shio (salt). And you may super size to large or super large for $1/$2 additional respectively. I was happy with the regular size!! 

Wait time was about 10 minutes to be seated for lunch around 1pm. Service was on par. This is a place to visit multiple times a week.

LONG WAIT + DELICIOUS RAMEN = WORTH IT
Ramen Sora is a small ramen restaurant located off Spring Mountain. They have delicious Japanese-style ramen but unfortunately, you do have to wait quite awhile.
I went with a larger party of about 7 people but we had to wait about an hour.
The food is good and the portions are pretty big. I highly recommend the Chashu Pork Rice Bowl and the Spicy Miso Ramen. The noodles are perfectly al dente and delish.
The service is good and fairly fast. They refilled our water as necessary. 
Definitely a good place to cure a hangover or get a good recovery meal. 
If you're willing to wait 30minutes-1hour, this is a decent ramen spot.

Do they need anymore good reviews?? This is the best Ramen I've ever had, the dirty flavorful broth and al dente noodles. When the wait is long on a weekday you know it's going be good, and with two young antsy kids we weren't sure if anything could be worth the wait especially with no seating room.....but it sure was. Craving it right now!  We like the darker broth with bamboo extra pork belly and spicy chicken.

Purpose of visit: had a hankering for ramen and was told this was the place to go. We ordered the miso ramen. It was supposed to be spicy. Didn't find it that spicy at all but still very flavorful. Tomago was decent and the pork slices in the soup were tender. The key was the fresh made ramen which was very good. Definitely come back for a quick lunch. Place is relatively small so could be a wait during peak hours.
By far the best Ramen in town. Good variety - great fried rice that's not too greasy. Rich broth, not too greasy or salty. Gyoza rocks. Tried a number of ramen houses and nothing beats Sora!

Best ramen I have ever had!! The chashu was fall apart tender. I also had the chashu rice bowl and it was great, I highly recommend it. There's no place like this in AZ, the places are strictly ramen. They have 3 sizes; regular, large & deluxe. I recommend the regular, it's more than enough for one person. Can't wait to go back to Vegas since I am now craving the rice bowl. Get there early as the place is small and fills up almost as soon as it opens.

Mmmmm good, chashu miso ramen -- warms a body up so nice when temps are going down in Vegas!  Their slices of chashu are thin, tender, buttery pieces of roasted pork, atop a savory miso flavored broth filled with just the right amount of ramen noodles (actually a little too much for me, but I managed to scarf it all down).  Somebody wanted to know which place I liked better--Sora or Monta.  Well, I like certain things about each, but I think I would head to Sora more often because of a number of things--easy parking, friendly servers, more seating options for 2+ groups so it's faster to get in, love the broth/ramen/chashu a touch more than the other.  And, yes, I'm an actual  reviewer, I don't work at the competition!

Yes, I wanted Ramen instead of Pho! I've been here twice and both times did not disappoint. The last time I wanted to try Monta Ramen but the wait was so long. We decided to come back here since it was just a couple minutes down the street. They have their own parking lot but not too many spaces.  

We came on Sunday for lunch and waited probably 5 minutes and got seated at the bar. The staff was really nice and welcoming. My boyfriend and I both ordered the Chashu Ramen with the miso soup base.  Comes with three HUGE pieces of chashu.  It was so tender that it melted in my mouth. Also comes with half a soft boiled egg, bamboo shoots, and green onions. The last time I came I got the Spicy Miso Ramen which comes with the spicy ground pork, which was pretty good too. I wish that they just had the spicy miso paste though.. 

They do have other items on their menu, just not on their actual menu (or I didn't see it at least). I know they have a chashu bowl and fried rice, because the couple next to us ordered HAHA, but damn that chashu bowl looked soooo good. 

+ Affordable $10-$15/person
+ Yummy chashu
I love this place! Small, intimate area, almost feels like I'm in japan, eating yummy ramen! Gotta have it with cold sake! Delish!

*Update* 

After the incident, the next day my husband, daughter, and myself were sick with stomach issues which I can most likely say the food from this place contributed to it. 

I called and spoke to the manager the very next day and explained how all of us were sick. She immediately referred me to speak to their insurance company and still did not offer me any type of refund. Like really? She can't handle it herself, she has to push it off on someone else in their "insurance company". This sets off a red flag with me, it makes me think how many times this has happened for her to have the insurance company information readily available for me to call...

I just found out from another yelper a couple days ago, Ramen Sora's health grade has been recently been decreased to a C from an A. If you now anything about the food business, you will know that takes ALOT of violations /demerits for that to happen. 

Hmmm I wonder why their grade dropped....maybe because of their UNSANITARY conditions as one of the reasons....??

Came here on a Saturday afternoon after hearing great reviews about this ramen joint. There was a short wait when we arrived but the waiters were quick in assisting us once we sat down. The ramen was average and the broth was a little on the thick/salty side for my liking. Overall just another ramen joint.

This was very different from my limited ramen experience, so I'm not sure how to judge it. I ordered the deluxe shoyu (what's deluxe about it? I have no idea), and was decently contented with it. The noodles were fatter than what I'd experienced before (what a strange thing to feel picky about, but there you have it), and the broth had a very... animal... flavor to it. Maybe I should've gone with miso broth. In any case, it was a bit bland, other than the strange animal taste, though I'm thankful I didn't try any of the spicy flavors as my SO's spicy ramen was too much for me!
I had the mango ice cream blobs afterward, and they were awesome! I'd never experienced ice cream in that format before, where it's encased in some sort of doughy pod... Good stuff.
"I've had my fair shares of so-so ramen. Sora ramen does not only have the best ramen but it gives honor to its origins Sapporo,Japan. Try the miso ramen with corn and butter its to die for!"

I got the spicy ramen bowl, REALLY good and definitely spicy! Atmosphere was simple and a nice change from the glitz and glamour of the Las Vegas strip (I'm a tourist from NY). There were many Asians enjoying the cuisine during my visit so I'm assuming this Ramen house is definitely a good authentic one in the area, my husband and I sure weren't disappointed

My favorite ramen here!! NO.1 in Vegas
Authentic japanese ramen :)

Chashuu was soft and yummy, soup is perfect.
I wanna go 3 times a week!
This ramen noodle is from Hokkaido japan  I really love all this ramen noodle  my favorite ramen is Sio ramen and spicy Miso ramen  it was always amazing !

Okay today they have deluxe ramen now and it's much better haha but I don't know if it's good to be eating hot soup when it's tons hot outside.. Oh well! Anyways the customer service is tons better today as well , the waitress seems to know what she's talking about and she's fast at taking everyone's orders and seating everyone. And the meat today is so much more tasty as well I don't know maybe yesterday was just a bad day for them !

By far, Ramen Sora is the best, most authentic Ramen in town, bar none, which is the reason for the 30 to 45 minute wait during dinner rush. They specialize in one thing: PORK!  It's amazing.  So if you're not a pig eater, this place probably isn't for you.  I'd love it if they had at least one chicken Ramen option for my non-pig-eater friends, but I also understand doing one thing really well & leaving it alone.

Ramen! The best thing about ramen Sora is that you are able to customize your ramen bowls and yet the basic ramen bowls are delicious. So there's no pressure to come up with your own combination amok ingredients BUT YOU STILL GET FREEDOM TO ADD WHATEVER YOU WANT! Toppings include spicy pork, corn, eggs, broth and so much more. The upgrade from regular size to large only costs $1. The difference is that the regular is one pack of noodles and the large has a pack and a half plus more broth but no extra toppings. 
I ordered the regular spicy miso ramen and it was plenty for me. The spice level was perfect for me but forbmy friend who eats spicy food "sometimes"  it was too spicy. It came with one large slice of pork, spicy ground pork, half egg and bamboo shoots. The broth was delicious and the meat was so tender. I love the ground pork because it adds texture and if course protein. 
The only down side to this ramen restaurant is that all their broths and dishes include pork. So keep your non pork eating friends at home!

I usually go for Shio Ramen, spicy meat, extra nori. Deluxe is good if you like extra chashu and all the fixin's. Delicious broth, chewy ramen. I keep coming back! True they are a little salt-heavy but it's all dependent on the broth you like as well. Choose wisely, or experiement.

We are so happy to find a place to Serve gypza in the same fashion as Japan. We no longer have to travel to Honolulu to get gyoza. This place is there a reasonably priced, great service and the food fantastic.

Literally the best ramen I have ever had!! The prices are already awesome but they offer to make it a large bowl for $1 extra and super-sized for $2. My husband, daughter, and I ordered pot-stickers, 2 bowls of ramen (1 being the large portion) and a pork bowl and the bill came out to $25! They have a good variety of choices also, with plenty of choices of toppings and side plates. The place is pretty small but the vibe is nice and the food comes out fast so they turn tables pretty quickly. My ONLY complaints would be they need to pay attention to their refills. On 2 different occasions with 2 different servers they left my water empty. Also, we ordered the pork bowl for my daughter and the flavors were so delicious but the pieces of meat were literally all fat, so all that all that was edible was the rice. All in all, it is a fabulous little place and I will definitely come again!

This is probably my go to ramen place. I've tried other places before but I'm not a big fan of the massive pile of bean sprouts they usually add.

I was so relieved that this place doesn't do that. If ever it's mostly just broth, noodles, egg, and chashu with a tiny amount of veggies. The broth is so flavorful and they don't hold back when it comes to the slices of chashu. 

Even though this place is fairly small it is a great place to eat ramen. It is my go to. Definitely recommend giving this place a try.
Very good ramen shop. Well worth the drive and the wait!

Our fave local ramen spot. The consistently offer delicious pork based broth, decent portions of meat, and reasonable prices.  Also, if NOT busy, you can get in and out in like 35 min.
However, when it is a busy time, there is a cramped little waiting area and it can take FOREVER to get seated.
The prices have gone up about $1 or so per item in the last year and there are no real options for vegetables.  But if you're ok with that, and you get there when it's not crazy busy, you will have a wonderful yummy experience.  Overall, we're fans.

I really enjoyed it. Went at was is usually a slow time, but it was still busy. I really enjoyed the gyoza which were steamed and pan fried on one side. So it had the perfect amount of crisp. The ramen was really good. The broth and noodles were awesome. I've had better pork in at other ramen places. This was more like a roasted pork belly (like a pot roast) and the texture was a little different because of that. Still really good. Great balance of fat and meat on each slice. Price point was good. 

I've had better tasting ramen with more depth in flavor of the broth and more flavor in the pork, but this was still really good. 

Also the Melon creamy soda was super delicious.
Been here probably a dozen times and it never disappoints!  Besides the ramen, the gyoza and the fried rice are great too!!!!

This place freaking rocks. I love the simple decor inside. I was craving spicy food and this definitely hit the spot. I got the killer spicy miso ramen super-sized. It was so rich and spicy, I cannot wait to try all the other sides and soups.
This is my family's go to spot for Ramen!  Never a long wait and always great service and food!

Off the strip in chinatown. Be warned place can get super packed with crazy wait times. But cheap amazing ramen and good service. I got the death spicy miso ramen. It was pretty hot but really good. The mochi ice cream is good as well. Parking lot is a little tight.

Id call ahead to see what the wait is like. Definitely revisiting again next time in vegas.

I've been station in Southern Japan for about 3 years. Didnt really appreciated my duty station nor the host country as much as i should have but Ramen is one thing you could count on when you just squandered your paycheck at the bar and you're tired of eating at the mess hall.

I remember my first time at a Ramen house in Hiroshima...From the outside looking in through a foreigner's eyes what caught me was the wax display bowls of noodles through some glass. It looked good enough and i was hungry as hell so why not. I dont remember the name of the place, most likely because i cant read nor do i understand Japanese but the wax bowls was good enough. Ordering was a bit of a pain as i had to leave my seat, walk with the waitress over to the display and point at what i wanted but when it came out...WOW. The broth was rich i mean REALLY rich, the noodles were firm and chewy and slices of pork were perfect. Perfect both in taste and meat to fat ratio.

Ramen Sora doesnt exactly replicate the same taste or sensations but then again how could i expect them to? The perfect replication of New York style pizza has to go as far as it analyze NY tap water and recreate it to even begin to mimic the crust. Do I expect Ramen Sora to hire a bunch of scientists to cough up an exact mineral analysis of Japanese tap water in order to recreate authentic ramen in Las Vegas? Well yes but when that comes i wont complain about paying over 20 dollars for a bowl.

Long story short, compared to other ramen houses which i will not name (completely dedicated to ramen not 'oh look they have ramen on the menu even though they specialize in Japanese import auto repairs'), Ramen Sora is as close as i'm gonna get without going back to Japan. 

Compared to what i remember of authentic Japanese Ramen, Sora is a bit on the bland side but their menu choices as well as optional sides well make up for it. The pork they use is so damn close it's almost scary to me.

So far i've had the Miso broth and it was damn good if not a little bland due to personal preference, and that didnt stop me from devouring the entire bowl.

I would definitely go back to try out the other broths and HIGHLY recommend this place as well as return to in the winter when it gets colder.

Maaaannn... When my friend told me this place was better than Monta Ramen, I thought "no way that's possible" wow they blew my expectations away for sure!!

Ramen Sora has officially become a go-to ramen joint! I love how they have a large menu with various choices with their ramen bowls as well as their side options. Like many ramen places, it is quite small, so anticipate for a little wait. But once you're seated, service is really quick and they're very attentive!! 

So far my favorite is their Spicy Miso with corn. Ahhhh, so freaking good with the right amount of spice. (Not too spicy!!) I forgot which other ramen bowl I've tried but I've noticed that all of their bowls are so good. I would try whatever my friends get and I'm excited to try more. Their broth is so rich and their noodles are perfectly cooked. Absolutely love the flavor! I definitely recommend to try them out!

Originally we were going to hit up another ramen spot in the area but the line was KRAZY! Then my friend mentioned a new spot they had heard of so we went to check it out. Small place but quality of the food was good. Small selection but hey its ramen you cant expect s crazy selection anyway. Good quality stuff and always hits the spot. I usually get the deluxe miso. Good size bowl for a decent price. The service is always fast and on point. The noodles to me are on the of the best in town that ive found. If our looking for a ramen shop to hit your ramen cravings hit this place up, cant do you wrong. Try to keep the size of the group small is its not a huge place.

These people are seriously mentally challenged if you go there they will tell you last seating is at 10:30 , but website says 11:00 WTF. There is also a neon sign outside that says open NOW after they are closed. The place is very quaint and the food is good and cheap, but if you hate stupid people. Don't go there

4.5/5. very good ramen, super authentic and if this place was in my home town I would eat there every day. Only thing is it's a little more expensive than other ramen places around, and offers a little bit less on its menu. still very good though

Ramen sora is so good!!! This place is popular and has a long wait but I don't care. This is the only ramen place I go to. The miso ramen is addictive. Service is fast. I haven't had any problems with this place.

This place had a little of a wait but it only got longer after we sat.  It was a monday and it was still packed like a weekend. My soup had such good flavor and wasnt too salty which i liked.  I also really liked their chili powder on the table which tasted a little different then other places. I will definitely come back!

Went here twice now. The outside looks funky, but the inside is okay. Servers are friendly, and even recommended a good ramen to soothe my upset stomach. Boyfriend always gets the DELUXE SORA RAMEN and I get the SHIO RAMEN. Got to taste the deluxe one. Both are great!!!

It includes toppings, which are pork chashu, bamboo shoots, and egg. Pork chashu and egg are really good. I recommend ordering extra toppings! 

Monta and Sora are the only ramen places from Vegas featured on Ramen Festival in LA and Vegas. Rightfully so because both are awesome. (Didn't get to go to Ramen Fest though.) Contrary to other reviews here, my boyfriend and I think that Sora beats Monta by a tiny bit due to Sora's broth and toppings. I'd say come taste it yourself and you be the judge. It's very subjective after all.

Last note: I'll be bummed if I move back to San Diego because we don't have awesome ramen places like this. Tajima sucks! Will have to go to LA to get a good one.
WTF is wrong with some ramen places? I hate pork belly and it's the only option here. No bueno.
waiting too too too much time when there are a lot of empty seats.but food is good thought, only reason I gave two stars.My fiancé going to give them one, but food is food.

We decided to come here because it was a four star. The ramen here is VERY VERY basic. If you think that this place is awesome then you haven't really had good ramen. My recommendation if you ever visit oahu Hawaii go to kamitoku ramen and you will you know what I'm talking about.

This is probably my favorite ramen place in town. The place is large which is good, spacious and you can get seated pretty quickly! 

The ramen is delicious! There is something about the broth that is just warm and yummy! Whichever ramen I get I always add the spicy meat which gives the broth such a nice little kick without being crazy spicy! The ramen comes with decent portion of Chasu, the egg and the usual: bamboo, onions... I usually add corn too! The Chasu here is thick cut which is amazing, other places give you the thinnest slice you can imagine!! 

Always quick and good service! The food here is just amazing!!

Ramen places can get a little too gourmet these days and sometimes I can't finish a bowl as it can be too rich in flavor. Sora's ramen was more on the simple side and their broth wasn't too rich or bland. I'm also a fan of thick chewy ramen noodles which they used for my Shoyu ramen. The service is really quick too!
It's a small cozy place. I had the butter corn ramen and pork fries rice and it was very yummy!! Great food and even better service!!

I've been coming to this place for years so this review is way overdue! This is my #1 place to go for ramen. I usually get the nori (seaweed) miso ramen or the spicy miso ramen. I've tried their other broths but miso is my favorite. The ramen comes with 1 slice of pork (it's thicker than some of the other ramen places I've visited), bamboo slices, green onion, and half an egg. You have the options of adding various side items such as corn, butter, etc for an extra fee. Sometimes I'll get the mini chasu bowl as well because what's better than pairing pork than with more pork? The pork pieces in the chasu bowl have that burnt bbq taste that I love so much. Overall, I highly recommend this place and I will continue to come back.

Very classic Japanese Ramen restaurant in Chinatown! The restaurant is not too big but you will smile big when you taste one bite of their foods! 
Honestly it's little bit salty to me but not a problem. cause it's so delicious!! I always order side of red ginger and it goes good with ramen!

After the urgent recommendations of several Yelp Elite, I finally made it here for dinner this evening! After having phenomenal ramen in the Bay area, I was curious about how Vegas would compare. Luckily, at least here at Ramen Sora, it's high quality and delicious and really hits the spot. The broth especially just totally makes it here.

Got the deluxe sora ramen, regular size, miso, for my first visit. BF isn't a fan, so he got the large curry bowl. His came out first, and it was just right- large portion for the price ($6.50), flavors were spot on and it was definitely comfort food. He inhaled the dish. My broth was rich and delish, the chashu pork plentiful and flavorful, and the bamboo, nori, and egg really complemented one another. Noodles were plentiful and nicely chewy, but slightly thinner than expected, given that someone told me they were thick? Guess we have different expectations. I am bummed that I only get half of a (usually overcooked) egg in my ramen here.

EDIT: have returned for both the spicy ramen and the nori ramen. Can't rave enough about the nori one, which is the most unique one I've tried so far. The spicy version will clear out your congestion in no time flat, perfect when you're feeling under the weather.

Had the miso Ramen and pork fried rice.

Nothing special here. I can make better food at home.
2 for friendly service. reasonably clean but the soup was so boring and bland.
Best Roman Hands DOWN!!!  Pretty good service! All though they don't have a fountain drink machine.

I ordered the Butter Corn Ramen and was very tasty. The broth was seasoned perfectly and the butter made the broth even richer.  The pork that came with the ramen was so tender. I only wish they had more selection of noodles on their menu. I recommend getting there early because this place is small and fills up fast.  So far one of the best places for ramen in Las Vegas.

One of my favorite ramen shops. The texture of the noodles and soup are just about perfect. They bring out the ramens quite quickly too. The price is on the cheaper side. If you don't want ramen, I would recommend the pork chashu bowl
The miso ramen was too salty. The fried chasu too salty. Pork fried rice was good. The shoyu ramen was good.  Monta is better.

This has become my new favorite spot in Las Vegas for good eats! The staff here are wonderful and very knowledgeable about the menu and what each dish has in it. The food here is AMAZING! Everyone in my party ordered a different dish so we were all able to sample each other's food. I personally ordered the large curry bowl since: 1) I've been craving curry for a while and have been too lazy to make it myself at home and 2) I was having rice withdrawals (if you grew up eating jasmine rice on a daily basis with every meal then suddenly stopped for a few days, for a vacation for instance, you know exactly what I'm talking about). It honestly was the best curry dish I've ever had in my life! The food was so good that I ended up eating my entire plate, finishing my sister's ramen, and all of the gyoza that we ordered (don't judge me, hahah)! The food is reasonably priced here as well! Definitely check this place out!!!

I don't know what it is with these servers they spend more time talking and re counting money than actually taking care of their guest I got 2 glasses of water empty and already been raising my hands for literally 2 mins and they're not even batting an eye like foreal tho are you guys hiring cz it feels like 2 servers can't handle 3 tables total if 6 guest. Foods ok probably would've tasted better with better service. Oh and someone report these guys to the health department I just literally watched the server bus a table go to the dish pit and back to the register without washing her hands she was wearing a pink hair tie with a smart watch

Counting down the hours to be back at Sora... Favorite Ramen in town for my friends and family to meet up in Vegas and have an amazing meal. Not sure what others are talking about when complaining about price. Prices are great, especially when you consider the quality and taste of the food.

Authentic Hokkaido style ramen.  Chashu isn't as juicy as those other really good places but soup ( I usually chose shio as sora ramen originally from Hokkaido does its best) 

Fried rice and gyoza are pretty good too.
By far the best food in Vegas. Killer spicy extra everything. Pitcher of Kirin. Best staff in town.

Ever since I ate here with some friends I've been craving ramen. I loved the spicy miso I got with the killer spicy meat. It was SOOOOO spicy!! But it was SOOOO good haha. It was one of those things where you could safely say "it hurt so good!!" Our server was great and we made sure he knew with a good tip. Will be back soon! Been craving :)

This is my favourite ramen house in Las Vegas! Everything you could get here will be amazing. The dishes are simple yet delicious. The only complaint I have about this place is it's too small! They need to either find a way to fit more tables in here, or move to a bigger location for all the traffic this place gets.
this is some boooomb ass ramen, its cheap and the vibe is really nice. I went here with my boyfriend and we had to wait for awhile but it was well worth it! it was soooooo good
There may be a wait, but ramen is def worth waiting for. Service was good. Ask and you shall receive. Several different types of ramen/broth to choose from, and options to add extra is a plus.

Hands down the best ramen shop in Vegas!  My fiance and I make it a point to eat at Ramen Sora at least once a week and the quality remains the same every time!! The portions are filling and affordable.

Ramen really isn't my thing typically, but when my girl insisted we check this place out, I obliged. The service was friendly and efficient. The ramen was tasty and perfectly warm and filling. Adding pork and extra noodle is the way to go. This meal actually made my day and I look forward to coming here again soon.

The ramen here was not very memorable. I ordered the deluxe sora ramen with shio broth and my first impression was that it was very bland.
