The food is alway a great find but when you pair it with a staff that feels like family even after one visit it makes it worth the while. Shout out to sunny the floor manager, she always has a smile on her face.

Delicious ramen! Only been here once, but service was great and the food was very good. 

Only complaint was that the AC didn't seem to be working all that well inside, but good enough I suppose.

I tried to go to Monta but there was a 30 minute late. As it was almost 9 pm already I went to Sora. I got the deluxe Sora Ramen with Miso base, Supersized it, added corn and spicy meat. It was the perfect size. The noodles however, we're probably not hand made... had the same wavy look of ramen noodles from a package. They were however well cooked... not overdone.
Bomb! Best broth I've ever had! Go for supersize if you have any sort of appetite. Pork is tender juicy fatty and all around amazing. Top 10 bowls of ramen for me. Yum! Service is also great.

Since they serve Sappora Style noodle, I thought I should get shio ramen.  Big mistake. Pretty terrible. Why I can't find decent ramen places in Vegas? I don't wanna pay 17 bucks for a ramen at Ippudo in New York, but we need quality noodle in Vegas. Well, my rating doesn't do justice because I haven't try other kind. I will rewrite when I get back there. See if I like it better than Monta, tho, Monta isn't that great either.

Service was great. I didn't go when it was busy, so I got seated pretty quick. The food was okay, it didn't really blow me away. I got the miso ramen and chasu fried rice. The miso was a bit too salty for my taste, but the chasu fried rice was good. The decor was a little out dated, but it wasn't like gross or anything. I will definitely try this place again and order something else, to see if there is something I do like
Closest thing to little Tokyo ramen for me here in LV! Hits the spot every time! I've tried monta ramen a few times but this place is so much better in my opinion.

Great ramen place in vegas Chinatown.  I have not been to too many ramen places but this was a nice small place.

They had a page of different options and portions.  There were 3 broth selections I believe.

Worthy experience but small.  People were waiting and we felt rushed because there was a limited amount of seating.

Full disclosure: this was my first time at a ramen restaurant and I am by no means a ramen expert.  

I might just not have a 'sophisticated' enough palate, but I found my ramen dish to be so, so gross. I took one bite and would not eat any more. I got the corn butter ramen with the shio base, and the main note in the aroma was reminiscent of just straight hot cat pee. I was gagging before I took one bite of noodle, but in the interest of being, you know, brave and well rounded and all that, I was committed to trying at least one bite of noodle. I found the noodles to be gummy/tacky and almost stale tasting. 

My husband, on the other hand, hand the shoyu base and he thought his was excellent. 

Other reviewers commented that the service was rude - we didn't find that at all. It's a very, very small restaurant and the turn tables quickly so don't go here expecting to have a nice leisurely meal. They put menus and instructions right up front, and the idea is that you should be ready to order immediate upon being seated. They ask you three rapid-fire questions and then they're gone so read the menu and instructions up front and be prepared. 

I am going with 3 stars to split the difference between my 1 and my husband's 5 star opinions.
Rude service drove us out before we ordered anything. Asked if any vegetarian options and was told with annoyance all broth is pork only. Server was not accommodating and very off putting.
Best ramen in town. I normally get the spicy shoyu that is excellent! You all need to try the pork chashu bowl. You won't regret it.

I have lived in Japan for a year, and I honestly prefer this little gem in Nevada to half of the ramen houses I went to in Japan itself.

This is a small place, so make sure you have some time to wait, especially if you have a big party. The staff is delightful. When I gave a decent tip (~25%) for excellent service, the waitress tried to return it as she thought it was "too much." Their food was delivered quickly, everyone was friendly, and the quality of the food was stunning.

The broth--there is no better tonkatsu broth. They use a slow process to make the broth from black boar bones over days, and it really shows in the flavor. 

Even thinking about this place is enough to make my mouth water. I wish I lived closer to Vegas, a town that I loathe, just so I could eat at Ramen Sora a ridiculous amount of the time. As it is, every place I've been to since has been dreadfully, dismally disappointing.

This is the most necessary food stop in Las Vegas for me and my friends.  This is hands-down the best Ramen that I've eaten in the US.  The pork is done perfectly, and everything works so well together.  I've come here once where it was 100 degrees plus in Vegas, and people were waiting outside for hours to get in to eat hot ramen.

After reading the reviews, I was excited to try this place.  It would be nice to know that a great ramen restaurant was in LV.

I got their deluxe sora ramen, regular size.  The presentation of the ramen was excellent.  However, the cha siu pork was really tough.  The noodle and broth were alright, but nothing spectacular.  

The service was good though.  Maybe I got a bad bowl or the chef had a bad day and overcooked the pork.  Either way, I wasn't impressed.
Always the best Ramen. Food was hot and fresh and the service was fast. I'm a big fan of the spicy shoyu.
Not the best ramen I've had, but pretty good for the cost. Soup base was decent, was hoping for a rich tonkotsu.

Same old Vegas, same old story of recovery. Needless to say we came here on a Sunday to enjoy a soupy dish to cure our hangovers. Unfortunately, there is a point of hungover-ness that cannot be cured, no matter the cure you end up choosing. This was one of those days. 

I ordered the deluxe ramen, which came loaded with half an egg, chasu, and seaweed. I was able to eat maybe 25% of it tops, but that was enough for me to make a worthwhile evaluation. The broth is excellent, extremely fatty and much more flavorful than other ramen establishments that I have tried. The chasu was fatty as well but the meat was not as lean as some places that I have had in LA. The soft boiled egg was indeed soft boiled which is good, but it was was still cold and not heated up yet from the soup so that could be improved.

Overall I would definitely come to try this place again when I am capable of finishing an entire bowl.

One of the best noodle spots in town, I go there often with friends, our fav is the spicey Ramen, they also have great service. Only down side is that it's small, so it's always packed and takes time to find seating, but everything else is amazing
Too salty. Not bad, but given how many other great places there are in Las Vegas, probably won't be going often.

Authentic Japanese Ramen ... yes ...

I stop by for a Melon Soda and a bowl when I'm hungover. 
Works wonders every time. 
My secret is out.

Enough said!

Been to this place multiple times. Always been satisfied. I ALWAYS get the spicy miso ramen. It's amazing, the soup is flavorful with a kick of spice, the chasu soaks in the broth, the bamboo shoots are crunchy and flavorful, and the onions are just icing on the cake. (Sometimes I get a small Chasu Bowl or Gyoza with my order)

Place was super good! We had the gyoza and spicy ramen with the soy based broth. It smelled not that good (we think it may have been the bamboo shoots) but it tasty absolutely wonderful! We asked for the spicy meat on the side since it was out first time, that way we could gauge the spicy level. Over all super good. The only thing was the place was VERY small, would love to see them expand. Also, get the melon creamy soda!!! We will be back!

Its hard to beat a nice big bowl of real good ramen :-) The noodles at this place are slightly different, a little fatter and chewy. I got the miso broth and it was super flavorful....but to people that don't like slightly greasy broth be aware because this soup is. I enjoyed the pork chasu but not soo much the curry one. The mini curry just was a little thicker for my personal liking. 
The staff here is wonderful :-) very kind and attentive....over all I will be back and I highly suggest people to give this place a try!

When it comes to having out of town guests visit, we usually try to introduce them to Vegas' Ramen options because, at least in SF, good ramen means a long drive and headache finding parking for not-out-of-this-world ramen. I still don't know which ramen I prefer, Ramen Sora or Monta Ramen, but I think I have come to the conclusion that both are delicious in their own right, Ramen Sora is just easier to get a table at, which means we end up eating their more often, which means I get tired of it faster. BUTTTT.. I'm still a fan. It's really hard not to compare the two locations and I thought it was really sad during the Aki Matsuri festival that neither restaurant's booths got much love/patronage during the event.

Some pros for Ramen Sora:
-Broth is really, really rich
-I prefer their Chasu rice bowls over Monta Ramen (they even come in mini sizes)
-Gyoza are always cooked well
-Tables are easily moved for large or small parties
-A couple of TVs if you really want to catch a game
-Wait is definitely a lot shorter than Monta Ramen
-They don't charge for hot tea, which Monta Ramen does

When it comes down to it, Las Vegas is lucky to have so many solid ramen options nearby and you can't go wrong with coming here.

Butter corn ramen??? WHAT?! YES! It was the most creamiest ramen I've ever had. I'm not a big fan of ramen but that one was amazing. I still dream about it, lol! The restaurant is a bit small but it does what it needs to: feeds your appetite! If I'm in Vegas, I definitely will be back.

Every time I come to Vegas, I try to make a trip to Ramen Sora. Try to come early, it gets packed really fast. I come right when it opens or during off times so that my wait is 10 minutes or less. 

The ramen is very flavorful with the egg cooked to perfect (because that is VERY important haha). There is a lot of ramen choices to choose from; my to-go is the Deluxe Sora with  shoyu soup. Miso soup is popular among my friends. However, one of my friends got food poisoning from her ramen. Besides that incident, we enjoy our time and food here.

The wait was an hour when we got there on a December evening. But it was a little worth the wait. 

I got the miso ramen and it was good but sill, nothing compares to the authentic ramen from Ichiran in Japan. But it was already good and the flavors were not too overpowering so I liked it. My brother enjoyed his extra large bowl of ramen. He still hasn't tried ramen from Japan so he loved the ramen so much. Same goes to my dad. :)

Treated to this delightful place by Linda S.  She didn't pay me for this 4 star rating.  This place is pretty doggone good.  I had the Sora ramen with shoyu.  It's pretty much kitchen sink ramen.  It's hard to find a sink that tastes good, but this place has it.  The noodles are done right.  The chashu is really good.  It's a thicker cut which I'm not a fan off, but I liked it a lot.  My friend had the butter corn with spicy meat.  I know that I'll be ordering that next time.  It had a slab of butter on top when it was served.  There's no way that can taste bad.  I can't wait to go back.

This ramen restaurant is so good I hate going anywhere else because I'll always end up disappointed and wishing I just went to ramen sora instead. All the flavors are great, my personal favorite is miso with corn! Know that regardless of the time of day you go that you will have to wait for a table but it is WORTH IT! Worth the calories!

Honestly this is not that great. The staff is nice and the actual building is cool (parking is awkward though) but this ramen is not great. I ordered the house special ramen and my mom and i both agreed it wasn't worth the admittedly inexpensive price. Theres better ramen places literally 3 minutes away, for the same price. Go there instead.

This is probably the only restaurant that does a spicy ramen (which according to my friend, it's nontraditional) and I live for this bitch!! They should expand their location but the food is A1 amazinggggg.

One of the best tasting ramen I've ever had! I ordered the Nori Ramen with the miso broth and I finished the whole thing. I  tasted one of the other broths that my friend had and it was also very good. I'm not a local, so the next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely consider coming here again if I'm in the mood for ramen.

Best Ramen place in town! 
Be aware there might be a waiting time, it's a small restaurant with limited parking but so worth the wait!

One word. YUM!!! This place is awesome! Awesome noodles, awesome soup base, and awesome customer service...ordered the miso ramen and it was the best I ever had!!! I will definitely will be back here again!

This is my favorite ramen place in Vegas. Friends I bring here are usually quite pleased with the selection. I've dined in and ordered for pick up. The price is a bargain compared to jinya and Monta. The dining area is roomier than Monta and less so than jinya. The ramen is rich, fatty, flavorful, and filling. The chashu in the rice bowls make the rice bowls well worth it and the pork fried rice is pretty good too. Enjoy!

I recently feel in love with Screaming Vengeance. If you consider scoff when your friends say something is spicy this is the bowl for you. I recently went to a newer ramen place on Jones that was pretty proud of their habanero bowl and Vengeance runs circles around it. Unlike a lot of dishes that only seem to care about lighting your mouth on fire, this one is actually as flavorful as it is spicy. Although I got through it with no regrets, I burped while on the way home and nearly had am accident. It's as if the bowl didn't want me to be cocky. I'm going to have a hard time ever going anywhere else for ramen after this visit.
Best ramen and service in town ! Don't be intimidated by the wait they're so fast. Fresh and to order, don't know why I'd ever try another.

When I see that a restaurant is notorious for longer wait times, I view that as a good sign! I was right. I bet if they put one or two more tables in this establishment (there is room), that would speed things up a bit more. The waiting area is too small to accommodate the dinner or lunch rush, so guests have to strategically stand in places as to not be in the way. This is the only reason I took away a star. 
On to the food! Hearty portions and delicious! I recommend the nori ramen bowl with a bottle of the melon cream soda.

Really solid ramen! I had the miso base, which was recommend to us as the house "specialty," (and better here than at Monta, where the shoyu is more of a staple) and it did not disappoint! The broth had a great consistency and flavor, and the pork was so tender too. I also recommend the chashu bowl - the curry tasted great and the meat was fantastic, really hit the spot!
Monta is pack on that night I craving for Ramen. I stop by Sora, menu is simple but ramen is delicious and sides are also tasty. I will be back again next time in Vegas

I have tried to come for dinner one evening with my family and we didn't have the patience to wait to get seated (there were about 7 other parties ahead of us), so we went somewhere else. Today, my husband and I happened to be in the immediate area and we really wanted soup. We took our chances and decided to go back to Ramen Sora. 

I'm sure glad we did! We both ordered the Deluxe Sora miso ramen. This has everything in it: pork, seaweed, bamboo shoots, and an egg.  All I can say is wow. The miso pork broth is absolutely delicious! I can see why this place is so crowded. Then again this is a very small establishment and only has but maybe 10 tables. 

I would highly recommend this place. Just get there early when they first open, not unless you don't mind the wait. Not a great place to come with a big party of people.

I absolutely LOVE this ramen restaurant!!!! Hands down the BEST ramen I have ever eaten! We discovered Ramen Sora a couple of years ago, using YELP and have been going there at least once every time we're in Vegas.  There is always a line here from the moment they open their doors in the morning, so don't expect great service.  The servers are always busy and it's hard to get their attention, but the food makes it all worth it!!!
We have tried several types of ramen, but my favorite has to be the Spicy Ramen with no bamboo.  I can honestly say that the only thing I didn't do is lick the bowl clean (although I am always very tempted).  From the first bite, the broth, the ramen, the egg, the butter and the pork were excellent!! The gyozas were also very tasty.
I like that the restaurant is off the strip and it's easy to find parking.  I really wish I could find ramen this good in San Diego!

Can a bowl of soup be life changing?

Yes it can.

I am an absolute sucker for a bowl of legit ramen. Unfortunately it's impossible to find in the part of the country where I currently live. More than that, most people around here don't even realize ramen is a thing beyond the cheap instant noodles. But I digress...

Much like most of the places I ate on a recent work trip to Vegas, I picked Ramen Sora based on reading reviews on Yelp. I'm so very glad I did.

The restaurant is incredible. The soup is superb. The pork broth, all thick and marrowy, is beyond compare. The slices of pork in the soup melt in your mouth, and I don't mean in that in the figurative sense. I mean that if you were to live in some culinary fantasy land where you could cross breed a pig and a stick of butter, this is the texture its meat would be. They aren't stingy with the portions at all... unless you're downright starving or sharing with someone, ordering a large is completely unnecessary.

You people who are local to this restaurant need to thank your lucky stars; I'd honestly pay $50 for a bowl of their ramen if I could have it here.

We went to Ramen Sora after a late night at UNLV looking to satisfy our ramen craving.

Parking in Chinatown is usually a little crazy so we came expecting the worst, but the parking lot was actually fairly easy to get in and out of. 

The restaurant is a little small so we had to wait about fifteen minutes to be seated at around 10pm on a weekday night. That was no problem though because the food came out very fast. 

We ordered one basic miso ramen and a deluxe miso ramen. 

The broth was a perfect balance between thin and thick and had an awesome flavor. The deluxe ramen was pretty much the same as the basic with just a few extra toppings. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the chashu pork was nice and tender. 

This is one of the first restaurants we've been to that has nice quality, reusable chopsticks available. (Instead of the usual wooden ones wrapped in paper) 
This made my boyfriend very happy; however, the first one I pulled out of the container was all gross and dirty. 

We were able to get in and out very quickly with decent service. The ramen was delicious and very affordable. Definitely going to come back!

This is the real deal - absolutely authentic Japanese Ramen in a very traditional atmosphere.

There is little i can add to the discussion except to say that having enjoyed Ramen throughout Japan, at Ramen Sora the experience is delightful and you will not be disappointed.

This place is packed even at weird hours. I recommend coming here right when they open or at an off hour, or you will end up waiting. Wait time at 2:30 on a Saturday was still 20 minutes.

I do think this place is hands-down better than Monta and highly recommend eating here. The noodles are toothsome and good. Portions are big, so those 80-pound Asian girls that eat twice their body weight can still walk away with a full belly.

The meat in the bowls is flavorful and has a little more texture than Monta's.

If you had to pick one of the two famous ramen shops in Vegas, I highly recommend this one. Has more room, more flavor in the food, and bigger portions. Also, there is a really big table that can accommodate a party of eight or more.

The only weird comment I have is if you sit along the wall. It's right against the exterior, and I don't think it's insulated well- it's like sitting on a slab of rock in a Japanese hot spa since it's really warm on your butt and back. While consuming hot soup during the summer, this leads to a toasty experience, but the food is great, so I would make sure you get a glass of ice water with it and wear a tank top, and you'll be fine. ;)

I live near the Spring Mountain area, so yes I have tried almost all the ramen bars around and this is the best spot in my opinion. There will be a wait if it's a weekend night but I assure you it is well worth it.

5 BIG STARS! Thanks to the reviewerS who mentioned this place, Food is ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!  We shared Gyoza, Edamame,  Spicy Fried Rice,  Spicy Miso Ramen and and the Chashu Bowl Pork Belly on steamed rice is simply...DA BOMB!

One of the best ramen spots that I have eaten at. The killer spicy ramen is super flavorful, and has a nice kick. Small shop but service is fast and attentive. I would recommend this place to any ramen lover, as it taste authentic just like if I was in Japan.

I come very often , my boyfriend loves this place and so do I! I love getting the miso soup, and add corn, make sure to look at what you can add, there's a good variety! My boyfriend loves the spicy meat soups, there's so many options and its by far the best place we've been to. It gets a little packed but you can also order to go ! Absolutely delicious Saki and rice too! Also you can't not laugh at their lovely shirts ! They're very funny ! Make sure you read what they say, I won't spoil it for you all!
This ramen spot is the best I've had in town, the prices are great, the portions are awesome. The taste is DELICIOUS, the wait times are not bad the turn over times are quick! Best place gotta try!

Love, love this place. I come here for the spicy miso ramen which Monta Ramen does not have. So, I would go to both places for different selections.Ramen Sora is alot more roomy and bigger than Monta. I feel more comfortable and at ease at this atomosphere.

The food comes out fast, so if you're hungry and do not want to wait, I would go here. 

I have to say, Monta and Sora has their own specialty and tastes. But Sora's broth seems a lot less salty than Monta Ramen.

Review #249 - 2016

After our multiple returns to Ramen Sora, my little family still haven't been disappointed with the food nor their service.  I've also noticed that my family from Hawaii always sends me a picture whenever they come here as well so that's always a good sign.

I usually order the large spicy miso ramen when it's my first meal, but sometimes I'll just order the regular if this is our second meal while my son goes for the extra large killer spicy miso ramen.  This was my nephew's first time here so he went all out and ordered the extra large killer deluxe miso ramen.  I actually felt kind of bad watching him suffer, but he wouldn't admit that he was having a hard time finishing his order.  

I wasn't sure whether it was because he ordered too much noodles or if it was too spicy for him, but I wasn't going to ask the kid anything that would make him break down and cry.  After he finally finished his ramen, he said he really liked it.

So we tried this new spot. & I can't complain. It was pretty good. Their ramen soup is rich and flavorful. We waited about 25-30 minutes before being seated but once we ordered we got our food within 10 minutes. Maybe even less. Really good ramen. I would come back.

Had a such a wonderful experienced with my friends. One of the best ramen places I've ever been to. I think what was great about their place is that it was authentic and the food was amazing. My girlfriend is actually a usual customer here and told me about this place. There are great varieties of ramen to choose from and you can choose from mild to killer spicy.
waited about an hour for lunch but SOOO worth the wait. . .ramen was hot and delicious. the charsiu just melts in your mouth and i normally dont eat it!!! friendly service and excellent food!

Small parking lot but ample street parking. I came with 2 gfs on a Saturday evening at 5 PM and there was no wait but when we left around 6 PM, there was a wait.

We all got their number 1 which came with 3 pieces of chasu (pork), 3 pieces of seaweed, some bamboo shoots and half an egg. We all got different broths. They have salt, soy sauce and a miso broth. What I like about this place is that you can ask for light broth, which makes it less salty. I don't usually eat ramen because I don't like salty things but their salt broth (less flavor/salt) was perfect! I thought the noodles were perfectly cooked. However, while they gave us enough meat, the pork I felt was a bit tough. It wasn't as soft as I'd like.

Our server was friendly but she got too busy to check up on us after we got our food and didn't stop by until after we finished everything. My friend went to the cashier to put in an order to go. For 2 regular number 1s & 2 large number 1s, the total came out to be $45 before tip. 

 I prefer this place over monta ramen! The broth here is definitely better and the meat to noodle ratio is perfect IMO.

My favorite ramen place. The only cons are that the restaurant is too small, so when it gets busy sometimes people are waiting outside, and the parking lot is pretty odd and there are definitely not enough spaces.

Favorite ramen spot in Vegas! I always get their spicy pork ramen with an extra egg and it's sooo delish. Their noodle texture is so nice and chewy and the chashu slice is super tender and thick. I think their portions have gotten smaller but it's still completely satisfying and worth it!

Okay, so I like the atmosphere, but they still have a long ways to go with their noodle.  I find the noodles to be too chunky, and sometimes raw.  

One factor that I appreciate about Ramen Sora is that they offer spicy ramen.  The broth in the spicy ramen is delicious!  I'm mainly just disappointed in the noodle.  The atmosphere is quieter than your average ramen house, which was refreshing. : ) They use plastic chopsticks here, so if you aren't a pro-chopstick guru, ask for a fork.  

I might go here again if I don't feel like sitting in the cramped space at Monta.

I just had their pork fried rice, which is not what they're known for, but it was still really good and pretty cheap. The person I was with said their ramen was some of the best they've had. The restaurant is small in China town and was packed pretty much the whole time we were there. We waited maybe 30 minutes before being seated. I really wished they had a gluten free ramen option because it looked really good. Another thing to keep in mind, their only meat option at this location is pork. It's flavorful and well prepared in my opinion but not everyone likes pork. The staff was super friendly and helpful.

Been here once before, but it was awhile ago and I don't know why I did not leave a review. This place is amazing!!! Was craving noodles for awhile now since the weather has been a little nippy. This place had definitely satisfied my craving plus more! The ramen was perfectly cooked and the meat was so flavorful and tender. I got the miso soup to go with my noodles and I am totally happy I did. The miso was not too overpowering. I definitely recommend this place to get your ramen fix!
Monta Ramen was scarily packed, so we came here instead.   Delicious cheap ramen.  What's not to like?  My only complaint is the wait and cash-only policy.  It's a good away- from- the- strip option.

The best  ramen place in Las Vegas. The place is usually  packed with  people when I get there. Food is very good  and staff service is wonderful. Coming  here  will never be a regret. Come early but watch out for the waiting line.

It's so hot in here-- (-_-), But I love the Miso Ramen. They often have a wait, but if you can beat the rush it's a great place to grab a bowl! 
I like that the size portion is a good size, I feel that it's gotten smaller over the year, but it might just be my Stomach! lol, it's always super hungry, and by the time we get a table, it's ON like Donkey Kong!

Best Ramen I've ever had. I always get the spicy miso ramen, and a curry chashu bowl! They have other options when it comes to what you want in your ramen and three types of broth. The employees are always friendly to greet you and when you leave they thank you.

P.s. I always stick to miso :) in my opinion it's the best of all three and try the curry it's delicious!!!
Cool little ramen spot on spring mountain! Appetizers were good, ramen looked good but was not very hungry and just joining friends for fun. I need to come back soon!

The ramen here is amazing. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is always friendly. It's a small place so it does fill up quickly during the normal rush times for lunch and dinner. They have Kirin on draft and sake if you like it. Don't ask for lemon in your water, they don't have any. The water is filtered so it's fine without it. If you want your ramen extra spicy order a side of the killer spicy meat.

Heard about this place from a friend saying it was the best ramen in Vegas. Since we were visiting we decided to try it out. They only have the three basic soup bases of shio, shoyu, and miso. I got the special and my girl got the chasu ramen both in miso.

Wow! It did not disappoint. I got a regular size but I could have easily finished a large. The broth was rich and flavorful. The noodles were nicely cooked. The chasu melted in my mouth. Lots of fatty content on the chasu. Very delicious and well worth a try. I usually don't drink all my broth but I almost finished all of this one.

The only downside is that the place is tiny. If you have a big crowd you will have to wait. You could see a lot of oil floating on the broth too. Just FYI for people afraid of oil. Next time in Vegas I'll be back for sure
This is by far the best miso ramen place in my opinion. I was hooked and cannot wait till I am in vegas again. A must visit place. I like it a lot better than Monta.

As I pulled into the parking lot 5 mins after opening, I saw 4 other Asian cars parking so I quickly parked without paying attention to if I was anywhere within the lines (holding true for my  bad Asian drivers) and bum rushed quickly inside.

Within minutes the place was packed with several parties waiting. We may have been the only non Jap party there.

The ramen offers miso or shio soup - no tonkatsu but they do offer a spicy option. We ordered the Delux Shio Ramen which came with 3 pieces of chashu, egg, manma, nori, and chives. In addition we ordered the Spicy Miso.  The noodles were perfectly cooked al dente and had the perfect bite.  The noodles are similar to the texture of the Miso Ramen at Monta, not the thinner noodles from their Tonkatsu. I ordered both broths to see if they offered more noodle selections but it seems they offer one. Nevertheless I prefer thick cut.  Both of the broths were super rich and full of flavor. 

The kurogoma dango dessert was decent - u could tell it was made at least a day in advance. With the consistent flow of business, maybe they can make it fresh daily and it would def be better. 

So is it better than Monta? I would say no but I always order the Tonkatsu and enjoy the intimacy and atmosphere. But it's definitely a competitor and I'm all for more ramen offerings!

Best Ramen place in Vegas in my opinion. They get super busy though and it's really small, but the servers are still very pleasant and amazing. The flavors are pretty consistent even when I ordered take out. The prices are fair and the servings are good. Seriously Ramen Sora...you guys rock!

Ramen Sora has something that other ramen places don't... hot broth. I don't know how others feel about the temperature of their soup, but I like mine hot. I also prefer a spicy soup but I don't care for the spicy option at Sora. The broth and noodles are consistently delicious.
The parking sucks. The seating is limited but the folks are friendly...well, at least I assume they are because they shout out greetings when we walk in. What they shout out is not in a language that I understand but I like to think they are saying something like Hello, welcome to our restaurant...could be - Oh man, more Yelpers, we gotta step up our game.

Sora is one of my favorite ramen places, I would go more often if I lived closer and if others in my dining crew had my love of that hot broth.

The most delicious ramen! And nothing beats a great environment on top of that. I had the miso ramen, meat was delicious, noodles were flavorful. Our waitress was very attentive, never left our glasses empty and made sure all our questions about the menu were answered. Will be coming back every time I travel to Vegas!

I love Monta, but lately I've been kind of bored with it. It always feels so heavy. I tried out Ramen Sora and I was so excited to see a SPICY ramen. I got this with the miso broth and it was amazing. I like that they have both regular and large size bowls. I ordered the regular and a size of mini curry rice. Their beers are also gigantic for the large size and I love that they offer pitchers also. Basically more options wins in the battle of Sora vs Monta

Wow! This place never ceases to amaze me. The pork broth with miso is so rich and smooth it is heavenly. The gyoza was pan fried goodness served by a knowledgeable and friendly waitress.  Will definitely be back.

My husband and I came in for lunch, hungry after traveling back to LV from grand canyon

Sitting was prompt

I ordered the Miso Ramen $7.50 and my husband ordered the spicy Miso Ramen $8.50

the noodle is on a chewier side but with constant texture
the broth was rich and flavorful but very salty
the char su pork was very lean, which i liked...but I husband insists that great char su has a good balance of meat and fat
the half soft-yolk egg was delicious
sparing amount of bamboo shoots and scallions can be found in the soup as well

Ramen Sora is good ramen at a very low price point
slurp up a bowl today

(This review was written by my husband)

This place is in a small building on it's own off the strip, in China town. They have their own parking as wel, but it get's filled up when the rush comes in. We got lucky, we came right before noon, so we got a table quick.

The service is great, when I asked,  "no onions", the waitres had asked if I was allergic because the broth was made with onions. I had never been asked that, I thought it was very nice that she was willing to actually tell me the truth.

The ramen, was pretty yummy. I had got the Miso ramen, which was very flavorful. The cha siu, was thick but so tender like fall off the bone tender, which so much flavor. You can see the edges of it that it was either chared on the outside so you know they slow coked that meat to the point of tastey goodness.

I will def come back when I visit Las Vegas.

On our last trip to Vegas after a bad hangover me and the girls wanted some good dim sum and a resident friend of ours suggested Chang's in Chinatown but that place blew so we then wanted ramen and the same person who suggested Chang's also suggest Ramen Sora which is also located in Chinatown. Parking is right in the back with a huge lot! 

Thankfully when we came in the place wasn't to crowded, we waited only a few minutes for a table. The workers greeted us upon walking in. As much as I love ramen I just couldn't eat a lot so I shared a bowl with a girlfriend. We got the spicy miso ramen but extra spicy. The noodles are on the thicker side which is what I like, and the broth was so delicious and nothing to oily for my recovering stomach. It came with ground meat and boiled egg. The prices here are reasonable and they do give a good amount of serving. I'm definitely coming back here again the next time I'm in Vegas.
Best broth!! Small hole in the wall are the best spots. Portions are good and noodles are good!! Been coming here for a while now and it's always good!!

Might possibly be the worst meal I have ever  ate and I have had to eat military MRE's. I am no scientist but I am pretty positive the soup broth is made from old boots.  I am also not sure if it is possible for bamboo shoots to go bad but these bamboo shoots seems as though they were fermented in dog urine. Always end on a positive note the edamame wasn't half bad.
Now this place knows Ramen hands-down never lets me down. I would give this place 10 stars if I could. I've been let down at other ramen spots NEVER THIS place it's amazing yum soup

I was really excited to try this place. People recommended me to try Ramen Sora. After reading it's reviews, I decided to give it a go. To be honest, I wasn't all that impressed. Maybe I am biased because I tried Monta Chaya first. I'm not sure. I ordered the miso Ramen with extra chashu pork. I asked if they can sear the pork, but she said no and that it would be an extra $4.00 to do so. At Monta, they will do it if you wanted it seared. Also, we asked for soy sauce because my friend ordered the chashu pork bowl, and the waitress said they didn't have soy sauce. That's unusual for an Asian venue. On a good note, I got my meal fairly quickly so that was good. I'm not sure if it's common or not, but my chashu was partially cold as if it had just come out of the fridge. Eventually it got warmed because of the broth. The bamboo shoots tasted weird to me...What I did like was the broth. Miso broth was good, but by my tastes, it didn't taste better than the tonkatsu-shoyu broth at Monta Chaya. Overall, it was a decent meal.

After spending all morning at the pool drinking, I was starving! The boys and I met up some friends for lunch at Ramen Sora on Thursday, May 11th around 12:30pm. Luckily, they were already seated at the communal table, so we joined them and made a party of five. (I saw some people waiting outside, so I'm glad we didn't have to wait.)

We started with a couple orders of Gyoza ($3.85) which I enjoyed. So much so that I ate more than half of one order! For my bowl, I got the Spicy Ramen ($8.50) with Shio Base (Salt) and added Corn (+$1). I was actually debating getting the Killer Spicy Ramen since I love heat, but we drank so much in the morning, I didn't think my stomach could handle it. I was kinda bummed after I got my bowl as I didn't think it was spicy at all. The broth did have good flavor and the noodles a nice chew. If you're a big meat eater, I'd suggest adding 2 Pcs Pork Belly Chashu ($2.35), Spicy Meat (+$1), or the Killer Spicy Meat (+$1.50). Or all three if you're super hungry. We also got a couple pitchers of Kirin Draft at $11.50 each. If you have multiple people drinking, it's best to get a pitcher as a large glass is $5. Way better deal. I believe a friend of mine got the Deluxe Sora Ramen ($10.25) with Miso Base (Soy Bean Paste), add Corn (+$1) and made it a Large (+$1) or Super Size (+$2). Not sure how much bigger he made it, but he seemed to enjoy it as he finished the whole thing.

Good place to grab a bowl of ramen. Only next time, I'll do the Killer Spicy. And of course, add extra meat!

Not bad, but not amazing. Broth is flavorful, but a bit on the greasy side. Def better than anything I can find back home in Dallas, but it doesn't even come close to all the ramen I had in Tokyo. 

Ordered the deluxe miso ramen. Portions are large, and the broth is soo thick that it was plenty of food.

My roots have ramen (or saimin) listed as my Number 1 comfort food. On cold wintry days, on days when you're not feeling well, on days when your night turned into day, on simply any day! I can enjoy a great bowl of ramen.

So here is my story. Enjoying Las Vegas waiting for the imfamous Super Bowl Sunday, I somehow forgot that word "rest" or "sleep"... and my night turned into day.... Not wanting to wait in line for any restaurant in the casino, I get in my car and head OUT....  

Onto Spring Mountain Blvd I head into the Las Vegas Chinatown.  HUGE GIGANTIC sign! RAMEN SORA  RED AND BLUE NEON SIGN  "open"  open OPEN.

All I want is a regular bowl of ramen please, miso broth, extra nori, no egg, green onions please.... OH WAIT. and I'd like a Kirin please!  Oh! A small order of gyoza (small order = 6 pieces)

Broth tasty! HOT! Steamy Hot! The way all ramen bowls should be served. And the noodles? OMG... if there is such a thing as al dente chewy! (exactly as I like it) is what I got.  

Of all the ramen shops on Spring Mountain  Blvd.? This is a definite must try. 

Note: depending on the time and day you try to dine - you might have a wait period... I assume that because of the sign in sheet as well as the chairs in the waiting area....

We meant to go to Monta but the wait was too long for some people in our party so we ended up down the street here at Ramen Sora. We waited about 30 mins for a party of 8, but the place is pretty speedy so it wasn't too bad. 

I had the miso ramen, but I felt like it was a bit lacking. Overall, it was a decent meal and not overpriced.

Oh gosh what can I say about Ramen Sora. Hands down my favorite Ramen Bar ever! I live in Chinatown and Vegas has a lot of ramen spots but you have never tasted good ramen until you come to Ramen Sora! So authenticly good! Service is always great but my favorite server is SANI! She remembered after only my first visit and always makes sure to say hi even if she's not my server. 

The deluxe Ramen is the way to go with miso based soup and you can ask for it to be made with low salt! The portion sizes are the largest in town and the flavor is a blast of delicious goodness. The ramen noodles are the perfect thickness and crinkly curly. The chashu slices are large and juicy never dry or too fatty. You get way more ingredients in your soup than other places and they don't charge much for add ons.
Expect to wait at least 20mins because  there is always a line but this place is well worth it and Foodie approved! You won't ever leave hungry and it's not too pricey.

Normally, I would be completely against waiting nearly an hour for ramen, but we were lazy and it was cold outside and fortunately, the hanger hadn't kicked in yet, so we waited. Ramen Sora was insane. I can't remember what time we arrived, but I'm thinking it was around 6:30 and there were already a million people waiting in their tiny lobby area. By the time we were seated nearly an hour later, I was ready to eat the table!

I had the shio ramen and a mini chashu bowl (see, I told you I was starving!). I think the serving size of ramen here is a little on the small side (possibly because I was starving). I think they have three sizes - regular, large and extra large. Unless you are a light eater or you're going to get something else, I would probably go with the large next time. Their ramen was pretty good and I really like the chashu. Actually, I think they were rationing their chashu because my dad tried to order the chashu ramen and was told they don't have it today. 

There are actually several decent ramen places in Vegas now and apparently they're all crazy packed. So yummy on a cold day!

Ramen? You mean, ramen noodles...the stuff you buy at the grocery store for like $.10 a packet? No, absolutely not, it's nothing like that. I quickly found that out after having dinner here with some fellow Yelpers. This was my first time having ramen that didn't come out of a wrapper with a little packet of seasoning...and yes, I'm a fan. A huge fan!

So, we came in here for dinner on a Friday night. From what I read in reviews, I was surprised to see that we got seated so quickly. It's actually a good thing that we did because by the time we were done, there was a line out the door. This is a really small restaurant with limited seating, so if you plan to come here, get there early and give yourself a better chance of avoiding the rush

Since this was my first time eating ramen, I felt like a kid asking all our more experienced Yeeps what everything was. What's a miso? Corn and butter? Hard boiled eggs? I had no idea what was going on and while that menu is only a single two-sided sheet, there's no shortage of options. If you've never been to ramen, I definitely suggest going with someone who has for your first time. 

After much thought and questioning, I found out the Miso is kind of like the "safe" option and decided on Spicy Miso. Wow, this stuff is delicious! The noodles are plentiful and cooked perfectly, the pork is tender and having that egg in there is so good. But the best part of it all is that broth. It's rich and is so, so flavorful. I literally wanted to pick the bowl up and drink it cereal style...it really is that good!

Let me just say, if you were questioning yourself on trying a ramen spot, stop and come straight to Ramen Sora. I may not have much experience in ramen but I can tell you this place is worth the visit and I can't wait to come back!

Such good ramen! The service was excellent, and Sora has a couple of advantages over Monta: 1) A larger dining room, which results in not having to wait around outside for a table 2) a wider variety of available add ins. Don't get me wrong, Monta is great, but in my opinion Ramen Sora is better.

Ramen Sora is my favorite Ramen spot in Vegas.  They have the style broth I like and one of the best deals on Ramen.  The location is nice as they have their own parking lot which makes it easy to find a spot to park most times.  On don't go on the weekends as it can be crazy busy and the wait times can be atrocious.  
   I usually order the Deluxe Ramen Sora with the Miso broth.  The broth has a good depth to it and you can tell it took them some time to get it to be so tasty.  The Chasu is very tasty and plentiful.  It is so tender and not as fatty as other spots in Vegas.  I like the fact the Deluxe Ramen incudes an egg.  The egg to me is an integral part of Ramen and theirs is perfect and a great addition to the Ramen.
   I have ate in and ordered to go.  On the weekends I order to go to avoid the wait times.  The inside is simple and the tables are eating are nothing special.  The point is to get in and get out as there is always someone waiting to get some delicious Ramen.  The service is always good and they are always friendly.  Even when they are busy once you sit down and order your Ramen and side orders are quick to arrive.  I am already craving Ramen while writing this so I will be eating at Ramen Sora soon as the cold weather makes me crave good Ramen.

Even though there's a wait, it won't take very long to get through with it. This is definitely a place that specializes in ramen and you can tell. The noodles are just chewy enough, just ripe enough, and just long enough to leave your mouth watering for more. 

Went with the deluxe ramen and did not leave disappointed. The pork inside the broth was amazing. For the people that enjoy the runny yolk with the egg white, this is the place to go.

And with that, can someone please explain why they advertise serving sprite....like 3 times around the restaurant?!?

I will say this, my cohorts loved this place, I however though Meh, I'm not a hug fan of pork and it seems that's the only option, I would much prefer chicken, and there was no option for chicken. I personally am no fan of seafood and every dish has a fishy smell or taste, most likely due to the seaweed they put it in. I would come here again with my friends because they love it but I would leave hungry. The service was excellent.

I used to go eat ramen here a lot...came back for my favorite menma bamboo shoot ramen. This has an extra topping menma, but guess what... it was cold. It's not supposed to be like that. I was shocked. Also noodle was uncooked. What happened to this place?????? 
Their AC was totally broken. Maybe that's why I got cold menma? Lol No way. A server didn't come for the refill at all. I understand they are busy. Yes they have been obviously busy, but they need to keep their style they used to have before and fix their AC right away. I won't be coming back for a while. I'd rather go to fukumimi.

This location had several restaurants already in the past few years which closed down, hopefully, Ramen Sora is here to stay. 

I tried the Killer Spicy Miso Noodle, it was so good and really spicy! I think I drank 2 glasses of water coz of this but it's worth it.   My only con was it had a lot of raw green onion since I am not a fan of it. My bf had the regular shoyu noodles and it was also very tasty. 

We will be back!

This is by far best ramen I have had in Vegas! My favorite on the menu would have to be the Chashu Ramen with corn in Miso base soup. The texture of the noodle is just right, not to soft or hard. The slices of pork do not have a huge chunk of fat on them which is more appetizing to the eye. As for the soup, it isn't oily or have some fat floating (due to the slices of the pork) in it like some other places have it in town.
The menu isn't that big, but they have different items to fulfill everyone's craving. If you want normal favored miso to extreme spicy, they got it!  The pricing for the items on the menu are also pretty reasonable.
I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a great bowl of ramen!

This place is a small Ramen shop that reminds me of a small Ramen shop I went to back in Japan in 2001. You walk in and there's a great atmosphere, the host and servers greet me in Japanese and it just makes me feel like I'm in Japan. I get seated in less than 3 minutes even though it was a busy day and the menus have several different types of Ramen flavors. I picked the Shoyu Ramen with seaweed, egg, some bamboo shoots, a piece of meat and scallions. It was delicious!!! I ordered the iced green tea and this was a great experience for lunch break. Thanks to such a delicious experience!!!
It was ok i mean its ramen, its kind of Japanese fast food. I ordered spicy ramen it was good my husband ordered no 1. I think its good to have at lunch time

Everything here is good. Like literally, EVERYTHING! 

Came here last summer for recovery late lunch/early dinner after night raging during EDC. Being that we woke up super late, we expected await... surprisingly enough? No wait time at all? PLUS! My favorite thing about this place? They don't close midday! This was one of the few ramen spots in Vegas that was a decently priced and open! 

We also found this place through Yelp, thanks!

Going back to what I said earlier, YES. EVERYTHING IS GOOD! My BF and I were so hungry, we ordered a number of things: the Mini Chasu bowl, the Mini Curry Bowl, the Nori Ramen, and my BF being a huge spice lover, he got the Screaming for Vengeance Ramen.

The pork in the mini Chasu was soooo tender. Each bite literally fell apart and it was sooooo good. It almost felt like it was melting in my mouth, super duper good! Also, my most FAVORITE dish here had to be the mini curry bowl. I'm a sucker for Japanese curry. If I knew how delicious this was gonna be I should have just ordered than instead! 

As far as the ramen goes, the portions are super huge and the broth was really flavorful! I also remember it being a little bit on the saltier side for me, but other than that, this place was really great! With just one visit, I'm a super huge fan and will be coming back!

My girl friend and I we're going there because a friend told us it was delicious. We both work in the industry and work late usually because of the weather we had a chance to go out together. We walked in at 10:20 and the guy very rudely turned us away and said they're last guest seating is at 10:30. Very disappointed we won't return. If you don't want us we don't want you.

Service was great and good came out extremely quickly. I had miso ramen and the miso base was solid. It was not overly salty and the noodles were my favorite type. I didn't care much for the meat or egg, and there could have been more bamboo. The pork chashu bowl was good size (the mini was perfect for what I wanted),  but the meat had a lot of undesirable char on it for me. In Vegas, it was one of the better ramen meals I have had.

my fisrt time and it was delicious!!! i wish there was something like this in san jose, cali! overall wait was about 10-15 mins. customer service was great! some of us was hangover from the night before! lol! i would go back again!

Delicious Ramen, what else can I say??? Well for one expect to wait a while when trying to snag lunch here even during the week. I was in line to be seated foe 20 minutes on. Tuesday. This place was a secret a few years back but now your gonna wait in line to get your mitts on a nice big bowl of spicy ramen. The extra spicy will wreck your day later, trust me lol. But all the ingredients are fresh and the miso base is my favorite Ramen go to here. Give this place a try if your not in a pinch for time, for a nice hot bowl of a college favorite done the right way!

If you like msg in your food, they have that as part of the ingredients of there ramen. I ordered memna miso for my daughter a shoi Ramen and yosa dumpings. service could be better our waiter only took our order and gave us the check, she didn't bother to ask if we needed anything else. she more busy about seating new customers instead of taking care of her already seated ones. there is enough waiters there to tend to the incoming customers.

SO DELICIOUS!!! This was the first time I really enjoyed a Ramenl! We went New Year's Day and got there just in time, it's a super small place and had a line out the door! We got Chashu and Gyoza appetizer, and the Miso Ramen. Recommend all of these! We almost ordered a second round of everything:D Again, another place in Vegas with delicious food and ridiculously low prices! So awesome. My server was adorable as well, so made the experience that much better! We'll be back!

I could keep coming here for ramen, but what would happen is... when I die, I would make a well preserved corpse cuz the salt content in the soup is high.  I didn't finish my soup, I couldn't - neither did Ness.  

We had the butter corn and deluxe miso.  I thought it was just my order of miso that was salty.  Not true.  But people love this stuff.  The family next do us even ordered for to go.  I know growing up my family always salted their food.  But shoot that's why health problems run in the family; high blood pressure peoples...

However, the ramen NOODLES seemed a lot more chunkier and the texture was nice.  So I like the noodles and the soft egg.  Everything else was too salty, like it left a burn feeling - maybe my lips were already mummifying.

Customer service is quick.  They're all nice!  But also busy its difficult to make eye contact to get their attention.  When the crowd slowed a bit, they offered water when we finished our green teas.  Much needed water!

Cannot say I'll have ramen here again.  I think we already have a winning restaurant for our ramen preference.  They gain enough business for people to love eating here so I don't doubt their continued success.  I may try their grand opening restaurant though - Hachi!

Best ramen in town! I like how their menu shows pictures. It makes easy to order especially for my kids. I usually order the Nori Ramen and No.1. Staff are always friendly. The wait is a bit long at times but I'd say very well worth it!

My husband and I came here for a quick bite and loved it. We were seated right away and I had actually never had REAL ramen before so I was looking forward to it. I ordered the corn butter ramen and my husband ordered the spicy ramen. Absolutely loved both and especially loved the oolong tea in the can. Cannot wait to visit again.

I've been to Monta, Jinya, Fukumimi, and Tatsu here in Vegas, but I gotta say that Sora is the king of ramen in this city of sin. No wonder this place is always busy regardless of the time of day. 

I've tried their spicy miso ramen and recently had their spicy ramen with the shio broth. The shio broth was amazing, very clean and simple yet really flavorful, and it really brought out the spiciness. I don't remember enjoying a bowl of ramen as much as I did this time. I also didn't expect it to be that spicy, but I actually broke a sweat. And from what I remember the spicy miso wasn't that spicy, maybe because the heaviness of the miso broth absorbs the spiciness idk. I'm gonna have to try the Screaming Vengeance, one of these days...

The fried rice and gyoza are pretty good as well, and service has always been on point. This will definitely be my go to spot for ramen.

I had never been to Japan.... therefore I can't compare how they do it in Japan.  However, compare to what I had in LA area, I have to say.... This is the best ramen I had so far! 

I order shio soup base and it is just right, not salty or greasy.  The ramen is great, not over cooked.  The best is their chashu..... OMG, it is just PERFECT! (Yeah, I went there two days in the roll!). Even their curry is better then the curry house in LA (curry house is a little salty for my taste.) 

Only bad part about this place..... Service is a little slow.

Their spicy miso ramen is unbelievably good!!!  Wow!!!

Servers are friendly.  Food comes out super quick.  This place is a gem!!

This place was so delicious! I wish they had vegetarian options though- as I'm not looking to eat pork. I just opted for meat free. The seaweed was nice and crispy! Service was great, the waitress kept coming back to refill our drinks and check on us. The place is really small so keep that in mind.

This place left me SPEECHLESS. I am a huge Ramen fan, and this hands down one of the best places I've ever tried. I do not know if this place can be found in Southern California, but when I went to Vegas for the first time last week, I was blessed by this place. I recommend those who go to Vegas for fun to stop here. The ramen fixed my hangover!! 

Parking: A small parking lot, but we were lucky to find a spot right away! Not sure how it is usually since it was my first time here. 

Appearance: When my friends and I first drove up to the place, my initial reaction was: the outside looks like a shack. I had high expectations of this place because my friends kept saying this ramen place was really good. I took a deep breath and walked inside....and it was pretty cool. The feel felt...welcoming? It.is a very small ramen shop, but it didn't really bother me. People aren't elbow to elbow or anything and the place was perfectly clean, roomy (for a small space), and air conditioned. The wait can get long since it's so small; our wait was about 15 minutes. 

Food: I knew I wanted to order their corn butter ramen. I've never heard of putting butter before, although I have heard of cheese! The waitress recommended the miso broth so I got the regular miso broth corn butter ramen, and omg....the everything just melts in your mouth. The butter made it rich and creamy and since miso is also creamy, it was just a melting heaven in your mouth. Even the chashu melted in your mouth because it was on the fattier side. I can't even describe how good it was, but as I am writing this, I am drooling. My friend had the same thing, but she got the shoyu broth instead, and she said it was a bit bland.  My recommendation is to use HALF of your butter since they give you a hearty amount. Or you can take out the butter and add it little by little on how creamy you want it. I was sorta watching my intake of butter, so I decided with half. I would also get the miso broth since it is more creamier, which was a golden combo with the corn butter ramen.  If it's your first time, I  would also get add-ons on the side since adding anything to the original will change the entire flavor, and you should definitely try the original flavor first; it is to die for!

Service: I just noticed that the waitress never forgot to give us water. She was also nice and clear at explaining the broths to us. Nothing to complain about.

Overall, amazing. I want to come here again if I lived closer

Excellent ramen joint! 

Miso ramen soup base was delicious and the pork meat was plentiful, lean with very little fat. So if u like a lot of fat, then this won't be good for u, but it was great for me!

Gyoza was very fresh and tasty!

Rather small place so expect a wait. 

Prices are low and affordable.

This was my second visit to this ramen place.  I love the Hokkaido style of ramen (the northern part of Japan) as its the most flavorful.  

I've had the deluxe ramen which came loaded with flavor and meat!!  I requested hot sauce on the side so I can spice it up. Being Korean, I have to add spice to most everything :). 

I've also had the buttered corn ramen too.  It smells and tastes amazing!!!   

The broth at this restaurant was very decadent. If you're looking for a low-fat meal, this may not be ideal.  The broth is made from not only bone broth but some fatty bone broth!  It's not too much where it comes you heart burn or anything, so just welcome all the decadent flavors from each part of the ramen bowl!  

The service is also pretty good. If we needed a water refill or more napkins, we just asked any server and they happily brought something over. Good team atmosphere from the staff, which I appreciate.  They also sell cool t-shirts too. 

Just make sure you get there before typical meal times if you want to avoid a line. 

Definitely worth the wait though!  They are open until 2:30am too!!!!

My husband and I were on a ramen high after yesterday's visit. Just tasted so damn good!

Absolutely best ramen I've ever had! The Spicy Miso Ramen is what my husband and I always get and it is full of flavor and the quality is so amazon! I recommend Ramen Sora to everyone I know and no other ramen place in vegas can compare!

This place is in my top 2 ramen spots in Vegas. their is always a wait everytime I come here. I'm crazy for the pork belly items! plain, bowl, curried or in ramen. i LOVE the broths here but I must say I like montas noodles better. I totally get they both represent different parts of japan/noodles. anyways, highly recommend ! all that sodium goodness ! Lol
Seriously legit. Maybe the best ramen I've ever had and I've lived in California for many years. Pork belly appetizer and in the soup is perfect.

Not bad, we went on a Thursday afternoon at 2PM, and only had about 10 minute wait.  Service is good and fast, staff is nice.  Ramen itself is ok - wouldn't say anything impressive. The last time we were in Vegas, we tried ramen at Monta Ramen, so this paled in comparison. The broth was decent, but not as flavorful.  We also ordered a side of mini chashu curry to share. The meat in the curry was extremely salty, and the curry itself was bleh - would not order it again. Nice place to stop at and try the ramen, but compared to couple other places on Spring Mountain we've tried, this isn't the best for the most flavor-packed rich ramen.
So. much. food. I got Ramen sora with corn and butter. Butter was a mistake. I couldn't finish the darn thing with its three slabs of pork. Ugh I hate myself for leaving some in the bowl.

Sister's been telling me about this ramen spot and decided to try it last night. I ordered the Butter Corn Ramen and shared a Chashu Pork Rice bowl and Gyoza with the sis and beau. Food was delicious, very tasty broth for ramen (half a stick of butter yo!) and the chashu wss very tender and tasty as well. Service was great as well woth our server checking up on is frequently, refilling our drinks if needed. I would come back here to try the other broths and dishes.

Ramen Sora has some of the best ramen in town, better than anyone else in my opinion. However, it is coupled with the worst service of all our ramen restaurants. Once your ramen is on the table, they couldn't care less about you. If you're lucky you might get a refill of your drink, IF it's a soda or a beer. If you have water, just forget about about it. They can't be bothered to bring a check, or even give you a to go container for an unfinished meal. When I brought this up to the waitress, who's been there for several years, she just gave me a condescending smile and repeatedly said, "Oh so sorry." Couldn't have cared less. Well, I guess I couldn't care less about that tip I was going to give her. Anyways, The ramen is 5 star, definitely, but the service is 1. We have too many ramen restaurants with great service in town these days to accept crappy service from Sora.

This new ramen joint has thicker, chewy noodles just like the way they have it in Japan, a rich Miso broth made from pork bones the traditional way and flavorful pieces of chasiu. The place is spacy and casual and there was no wait when I went at 6pm on a weekend.

If you're a big eater, you can upgrade to a larger size for a $1. They even offer a super size for $2 if I remember correctly.

If you're looking for an authentic ramen, come here instead.
My go to spot especially after I watch documentaries on ramen! Oh don't forget the gyoza!

There are a few ramen joints in Vegas.  Most locations are small and crowded with at least 1 hour for the good places.  Parking is located in their small private parking lot or on the street.  Ramen Sora is a great place to go with less wait and super yummy ramen.  The pork bone miso soup is very rich but it's not too salty. It was by far the best pork bone soup I have ever had.   The ramen noodles was cooked perfectly and chewy too.   We also ordered the fried rice with shredded chasu pork.  The fried rice had the right amount of flavor and not over cooked where the rice had a soggy texture.  Service was attentive and nice.   Overall, we had a wonderful experience and plan to come back here again.
We walked in at 1032, they told us the kitchen closed. They clearly need to change their hours and post that on the door. Boo!!!!!
Perfect ramen spot, wish I had one back home.

favorite ramen spot in las vegas.  i always order the spicy miso with chasu.  the chasu is really tender and the ramen noodle fresh and broth very flavorful.  even in the hot vegas summers i'll come here at least once a week.  definitely try this place if you like ramen.
Food was delicious ! very small place need to expand. Seating place was too closed in. Friendly staff

I know this place has been here for some time, but it took me a while before I actually paid this place a visit, and as a New Years meal, I didn't regret it. 

I don't go out to eat ramen too often and I only have had Monta up to this point, and I need to familiarize myself with different restaurants around the valley and I know Ramen Sora is another popular choice, so I decided to pay it a visit. 

It is a small place and the parking can get a little hectic since they have a small lot and you might have to park in the adjacent street. When you go in, don't forget to write down your name, or you're gonna be stuck looking like an idiot waiting for someone to help you out, like I did. 

I was promptly seated with my party and it didn't take long before they came to take our order. I got the ramen deluxe with corn, and I feel like that was a good value for its price. They have larger bowls, but the only thing you get more of is soup and noodles. That's up to you if you believe it's worth the extra price, but I stuck with the normal sized bowl. 

I enjoyed everything in my bowl from the noodles, to the broth, to the egg. I have no complaints with Ramen Sora and I will be making another visit to this place in the nearby future. I recommend this place if you just want to eat at another ramen place in Las Vegas, or just somewhere to get some hot soup, especially during winter!
The food is so yummy! However, the cramped space and wait time are a let down. If your patient and want good ramen this is definitely the place to be.

First time here. Heard about this place by word of mouth and overall experience was great. Waited no longer than 15 minutes, great service throughout and food was outstanding. Ordered the spicy shoyu ramen and hit the spot! Definitely recommend stopping by :)

I didn't find anything special in here. My spicy miso ramen was good, but one of my friend asked for hot soup, and turned out to be a lukewarm soup in a super-hot bowl......

My friends were complaining on how bad their water tastes. They were totally turned off by that.

Most of the servers were not friendly at all and service was not so good. It's not worth coming here and wait for 20 mins.

I love this place. It's an old house that has been made into a restaurant. The place is small but cozy. The food is always amazing and hot. I have been here about 8 times now. It is always great. It is hip and fun.

Great miso flavor, but a little too oily for my liking.  My ramen was extra spicy, just how I like it, but overall the meat and noodles were not as spectacular as the reviews I've been seeing.  The staff is awesome and very helpful with my order and the restaurant seems like a good place to meet up and have a cheap meal with friends, but I think I will try other ramen places around town.

#53 for 2016 Yelp 100 Challenge


11am sharp on a Saturday, ofcourse I expected a line.  But a line out the door?!  Hhmm...  Some things are worth waiting for, riiight? Wait! Who said that? All I was saying in my head was, this ramen better be good or else a special someone will definitely get an ear full from me!  

This ramen house was highly recommended by my Vegas connection.  He has yet to disappoint me on his foodie suggestions may be because he has known me for like forever.  Anyway, I am certain he is probably rolling his eyes as he reads this review thinking he knows better ramen than I do.  Hahaha!

Ok.  Like most ramen house, it was a cozy place so most people were waiting outside.  It was definitely a cold and windy November day.  We waited about 25 minutes so not too bad for a popular ramen spot.

Once we got seated, I ordered right away since I didn't want to waste my time and theirs for any further delay ;)

Corn butter miso amazingly delicious.  Packed heavily with deliciousness, al dente ramen, and believe me, I slurped every bit of that broth!  I don't even think I took a sip of water during my meal.  Yessss, it was that good.  Definitely one of the best I have ever had.

Tonkotsu ramen was just as flavorful and yummy! Great savory broth, cant help but finish everything to the last drop.  It would be wise to go in a group so everyone can taste the best of both worlds.  Which in our case we did and glad we did.  I'd love to have them both again on my next visit to sin city!

Gyoza was for extra credit.  Get it.  Its worth it!

As I have mentioned in the past,  there are only certain things I would ever wait in line for.  Amazing and delicious ramen I definitely would.  

Hint:  Daikokuya in Little Tokyo is not even worth waiting for.  Ramen Sora is!

I've been on a search for a really good ramen house that would be closer to my house.  My favorite by far is fukumimi, however, its so far!  I decided to check out Ramen Sora, and let me tell you, it did not disappoint.

I got the Deluxe Sora Ramen, with the shio broth. AMAZING. I loved the tonkotsu in my ramen... it was tender, thick and very flavorful!  The noodles were perfect... just the right firmness, thick and chewy! 

I also got to try the mini curry bowl and mini chasu bowl.... DIVINE!  I highly recommend this place.  I will definitely be returning back for more!

Hand made ramen noodles in a spicy miso broth with thick slices of chashu is amazing after a long night out in Vegas!

I'm from the Bay Area where there are lots of amazing ramen restaurants, and Ramen Sora was definitely competitive in terms of flavor and taste.

My only complaint is that the chashu was not as tender as some other cuts of pork I've had with ramen. However, the portions of meat that Ramen Sora gives are insanely large and makes up for it!

I am a ramen fanatic and I have to say that this is place is AWESOME. It's about 15 minutes from the Las Vegas strip and it's the perfect place to eat regardless if you are hungover or not. I would recommend the miso ramen base. I don't have any other ramen places to compare to in Vegas but I can compare to places in Southern California and Oahu and I must say the ramen is pretty damn good for a fair price. It's not the very best I've had but it is still very good.

We came in on a Saturday night and our group of ten (yes TEN!) were quickly seated. Our waiter was very kind and brought us all waters and at the very end, split our checks without us even asking! I was surprised and amazed. Great service and great food. I would come here again next time I visit Las Vegas.

122 Degrees outside in the desert and I still want hot steaming ramen.

Came to Las Vegas a couple times to visit a friend, and after having Ramen Sora the first time, I made it a point to have it 3 more.   So much awesomeness.  Best ramen I've ever had, and it's 4 hours away from me!  Booo.

They have all 4 types of soup base, although shoyu is my favorite.  They describe, in detail, the cooking process to the perfect base.  Time honored traditions and 10 minutes later, the best ramen EVER.

I can't wait to hit Vegas again, hopefully in the winter though!

This fine establishment does not serve alcohol, unfortunately.

Absolutely Delicious. I found this place via Yelp (Thanks Yelpers!) and it did not disappoint.

Situated in a little Chinatown among a plethora  of Asian restaurants, there are so many other options to choose from if you are driving down the street passing every other Asian restaurant in an attempt to find Ramen Sora but don't give up. It is worth it. 

The price is perfect, about $10 or less for a bowl of Ramen depending on what you choose. There are not that many tables inside so depending on how many people there are, do expect a wait but it's worth it. We waited about 15 minutes, not too bad. Any longer and I probably would've tried another Ramen place bookmarked on my iPhone.  

There is bench seating along the wall which is good for children or large people. I hate being cramped while eating or not having enough space on the table for all our food but this place was fine. We ordered the Spicy Miso Ramen, Deluxe Sora Shio Ramen #1 and Corn Butter Ramen. They were all delicious! So flavorful, rich, and creamy, tastes like it's been cooking for days which is the way traditional old school Ramen should be. i read the "tips" and they give you some type of thinning broth or hot water to thin it out if you don't like your broth so ultimately rich and creamy, although I do.Toppings seemed fresh. Ramen was not overcooked or undercooked, just the perfect amount of body/bite while still soft. I always compare every Ramen place to my hometown "Ramen Parlor" which has the best Ramen or to Ramen I've had in Hawaii and this place is delicious. We each ordered our own bowl but were still hungry so we added on another bowl at the end which we split among us just to top us off and completely satisfy. 

The place is clean. The waiters check on your frequently. It is not hard to flag em down since the place is small. Will definitely be back.
Very good place and good service !! Don't try anything over killer hot if you want to enjoy your meal lol

I've been trying to find a great ramen spot for a long time and this is it people.  It's located on spring mtn and has a little parking lot in the back.  It's not hard to find with its own building and sign. The first time I went here I had to wait 45 mins.  It was packed crazy inside and out and it was 115 degrees.  If people are in this Vegas heat and still waiting to eat hot soup... That says a lot. People ordered a melon soda drink while they waited. (they serve alcohol as well )
I ordered the miso ramen and my fiance had the spicy shoyu. Both were amazing!!!  The noodles were cooked perfectly but still chewy.  The broth was rich but not over powering. 
Customer service was amazing.  Those women were on top of it.  They all helped each other and everything was insync as they sat us down, someone did the ordering,  the other women helped serve other tables.  Im glad I didn't have to wait for our specific server to bring it cause she had help.  Overall.... Great ramen shop. And now my only ramen stop.
Best place ramen place in Vegas. The meat is perfectly tender every time. Broth is made with real pork bones every day. It's the business.

Hmmm! I love the atmosphere and decoration. We ordered shio ramen. The broth was bland and oily. I want my broth rich and flavorful not with a layer of fat on top. :( the gyoza was regular, those in packages, u can find them everywhere. It is pricey, around 9 dollars for a bowl but it has only 1 slice of charsiu meat. The egg wasn't flavorful enough. However 5 stars for the service!!!!!! They were super polite and friendly.

If I go a week without Ramen Sora I begin to have painful and longing withdrawals. This has become my favorite little place with the best and most delicious ramen l've ever tasted.

If you come down to this little hut in Chinatown, prepare yourself for at least a 20-30 minute wait. Of all the times I've been to Ramen Sora I've had to wait (especially during the lunch and dinner rush) except for the time I came at 10:00pm. (By the way last seating is 10:30) BUT DONT LET THAT STOP YOU!!! This ramen is WELL worth the wait.

To my fellow vegetarians, there is no true "vegetarian" ramen available here. Although, if you don't mind having pork broth, you will still enjoy it. If you're picky then order yourself some fried rice no pork (still yummy, but you're missing out). If you don't mind the pork broth, make sure to ask for no chashu, the little pork bits.

Now on to the food. I always get the same thing. And no, it is not repetitive nor is it boring. I get the corn butter ramen, miso broth, no meat no chashu. Hands down, the best, most amazing, most decadent ramen you'll ever taste. Im so happy with my choice that I've never ventured off to the shoyu broth. If you want spicy, the lovely waitresses will bring you chile oil and sriracha.

UPDATE: I have now ventured and tried both the shoyu and the shio broth. The miso is the strongest flavor in my opinion and the texture is creamy and delightful. Still my favorite but now o go without the butter. :)

If you are in Vegas and you don't mind waiting a bit for excellent food and great service, stop by Ramen Sora and get yourself some awesomeness in the form of miso ramen.

As they say at Ramen Sora, "No Ramen, No life!"

With all the of the ramen joins popping up all over Vegas, I've got to say, I'm always going to be a fan of Ramen Sora. Their spicy Miso Ramen is just really good. That's my usual staple when I go here, but damn.... today I decided to be more adventurous and got the Killer Spicy -- WOW! My lips are burning, lol.. but it's really really good. This place only has a few tables -- so during lunch hour, prepare to wait to be seated. It's always packed. Their waitresses are pretty attentive, and ordering Take Out is always super fast too. 15 mins tops to get your food.. Noodles are cooked perfectly.. so far, I'm a fan.
