When you need a delicious bowl of ramen and have the patience to wait, this place is where you want to go. The only reason I mention patience is because this place is usually packed and you may expect at least an hour wait to get a table. As soon as you get seated though, you'll be guaranteed some great ramen. 
The miso broth is just the right amount of saltiness and serving of noodles is decent. My only complaint is that due to a shortage of chashu pork I was unable to try their popular ramen bowl so it's a good idea to be their as soon as they open. Nonetheless I enjoyed a nori ramen and received great service from the servers.

Ramen Sora is a solid ramen store, but with Monta right down the street, there is no comparison.  

I came to Ramen Sora starving one night with my roommate and fellow ramen connoisseur Andrew N.  We were in search of some filling ramen.  We both got the Deluxe Sora Ramen with Shio broth.  We both found the broth to be a little bland and not as flavorful as we expected it to.  To be fair there is a note at the bottom of the menu that clearly states to ask for the Shio concentrate if you want more flavor.  But why shouldn't the original broth have enough flavor to begin with?  The toppings were plentiful, there were three pieces of pork a soft boiled egg and plenty of veggies.  

I wish that there were more soup broths to choose from like a Tonkatsu or pork flavor or even a Shoyu flavor.  I also wish I could add in some corn without having to order the corn butter ramen.  One more thing, $10 for a deluxe bowl of ramen that wasn't that big?  I killed that bowl... imagine what damage a big dude could do.  Over priced for the amount and quality.

Overall a good meal but if you want ramen go to Monta for the real deal.  Sorry Ramen Sora.

this place sucks
some. chinese guys pretending to be authentic Japanese ramen, soup bland, store bought gyoza, and they don't even know what onsen tamago is and they have on their menu as a new item, and the guy brought it out with his thumb in the bowl! yuck
feel sorry for peeps who don't know what good ramen tastes like, definitely not this stuff

Awesome customer service, delicious ramen.

I love how every server/cashier greets you the moment you walk through the door. Literally....they all shout out a greeting in Japanese! :) There aren't very many tables, so luckily we went during an off time, but even so, they were still at half capacity by the time we left.

I enjoyed their Delux Miso Ramen, and the bf had the Butter Corn ramen. I normally just order the tonkotsu, or super pork ramen at most other places. This place uses tonkotsu as a base, but you have a choice of Miso, Shoyu (soy sauce), or Shio (salt) flavored broth. The pork flavor still comes through, but with delicate miso overtones. I think I will try Shio next time, just because I really enjoy pork flavor, but this was delicious. The pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender. The butter corn ramen was very good too. It really tastes like sweet buttered corn! :)The portion size is generous as well. Its not the biggest bowl of ramen I've ever had, but hey.....sometimes bigger really isn't always better! The broth is rich and decadent, so it was the perfect amount. (And I'm a BIG eater!)

I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. :)
Miso Ramen was amazing! The fried rice and chashu-don were super delicious as well!
Great service. Huge portions. The broth was very flavorful and the pork was extremely tender.

I have to admit that this place has always been consistent with their ramen. I have always had a good experience here and am always satisfied after each meal.  

Today was the first time we ordered food to go from there...ramen to go? Yes, ramen to go. They way that they packaged the food was perfect for us.  The noodles and soup were separated and neatly packed. The lady even doubled checked our order to make sure everything was in place.
Average shio broth. Ramen was too thick and not al dente enough. A bit like ramen packets.

Short review: When it comes to ramen, this is almost as good as it gets.  A detailed review is below.

I was in Vegas for the holiday and on the hunt for a good food-spot.  I thought first of Lotus of Siam, my by-far favorite restauraunt in Vegas.  But it was closed.  So I decided to see what kind of ramen Vegas had to offer.

I did what I always do when I want to figure out where I should eat: Yelp it.  I checked a few places out.  But I settled on Ramen Sora, as it had several reviews that praised its spicy ramen.

When I showed up, I was surprised by how small it was.  I was even more surprised by how many people were waiting outside.  And when I went inside, there were even more people waiting.  Also, I was right, it's a small place.  There's probably only room for forty or so people (max) to be eating at any one time.

To get a seat, you have to write your name on "the list."  When I did that, there were already 15 people (which can mean ay number of people in the actual party) ahead of me.  It took about 45 minutes to get a seat.  But that's not because the staff or kitches is subpar.  This place is one of the most efficient restauturants I've ever seen, especially considering the never-ending demand.

I ordered the Gyoza, as an appetitizer, and the "Killer Spicy" miso-ramen.  My company ordered the regular spicy miso-ramen.  The food came out in no more than 10 minutes.

It's the best Gyoza I've had.  The filling was bursting with flavor.  It was crispy yet soft, the perfect combination.  My only complaint is that one order is only five pieces.  First, that's not enough.  Second, that makes for a fight when you have company and have to figure out what to do with the fifth piece.

Now to the ramen.  I could tell once I got my bowl that it wouldn't be the best ramen I've had.  But it looked promising.  The noodles were firm, not chewy.  But they were a bit skinny for my liking.  The chashu pork was flawless.  It's the most flavorable chashu pork I've had.  It also, was extremely lean, which is important to me.  The ramen comes with bamboo, which adds much needed texture.  Now to the most important element of ramen, the broth.  It was as spicy as promised, which made me happy, but it was too thick.  I like finishing off my broth, and this turned into a watery gravy.  (The broth of the regular spicy had a much better consistency--I stole a spoon full to taste.)

I haven't been to any other Vegas ramen joints, but if a friend asked where to go, I'd strongly recommend this spot.

The service and food was excellent. I would definitely come back here. 

I ordered the chasu ramen XL to share with my girl. I'm glad they don't charge extra for sharing. The broth was great but of course I added my ginger, garlic and pepper. The broth was great but of course here I go again in comparing my Santouka to Ramen Sora. OK stop that! 

Now for Ramen Sora it's not bad for Vegas but I actually like Monta better than Ramen Sora. Sorry Sora but their broth is better. You will be the place when Monta is packed or closed.
Easily the best ramen I have had. The price is incredible for the quality of the food. The broth was flavorful and compliments each ingredient. Beware, the large size is HUGE. This is worth the trip.
Ramen Sora is our favorite ramen spot in Las Vegas. Their noodles are legit, and cold green tea super refreshing! Great service and price points, too.

I'm picky with my ramen but this place checks almost all of my list of what a good ramen should taste like.  

I'm not quite sure why it's 4 instead 5 stars but it's just missing that final piece that will make this ramen great. I'm comparing to my japan ramen experience of course.  Maybe it's just the ingredients or something. Can't quite say what it is but I'm still going to keep coming here.  It's my little get away in Vegas. ;)

This review is long overdue. Ramen Sora is by far, my favorite place to go in town for some delicious Japanese history in a bowl. Other than Fukumimi, this is my default ramen place. The Miso broth has a special place in my heart. I pretty much order it every time. It is thicker, cloudy, and a little bit hardier than the other varieties. I also always order the Deluxe "Sora" ramen when here. You get so much tastiness packed into that bowl! There is seaweed (nori), half of a hard boiled marinated egg, green onion, chashu (the softest pork ever), menma (fermented bamboo shoot), and of course, noodles. I always add a pad of butter to it, just to make it extra rich and creamy. With the butter added (extra $1), you get all that for just $11. 

The decor is intimate and cozy, and you are always greeted as soon as you walk in the door. About half the time you visit, there will be a 10-15 minute wait. The environment being as "intimate" as it is, you have to deal with limited dining space. Often times, the wait is only about 5 minutes, so just be patient! You will be rewarded for that resolve with some of the best ramen around.

Everyone always raves about Monta, which is not too far from where Sora is located. But I urge you to continue down Spring Mountain and give Ramen Sora a chance, at least once. I'm not saying Monta is bad, but I personally think Sora just has that extra something special. Who knows? Maybe you will stick to your favorite, or maybe you will realize the awesomeness that is Sora and be converted. I know I was!
The ramen was good, but the worth it winner for me would have to be the chashu bowl. Wow, loved every bite from the crispy rice, to the moist pork.

Decent thickness and nice roast of chashu. Spicy misco doesn't go over the good taste of soup but I would still prefer the original. I will not order Gyoza next time because I am  going to save space for the ramen.

The ramen here is delicious, my kids enjoyed it as well. The place was packed with people but we were able to get in pretty quick and with a large group as well. I had the Miso ramen with SPICY meat, so good!!!!

Okay.. I've tried this place twice. Once last year when I was in Vegas and second time this year when I was in Vegas again.

First time I was drunk so I didn't remember my first time. HA! Second time I came here right when they opened their doors at 11:30am. Once I got seated it got busy really fast. Lines started to form because this is a small restaurant. When I got my ramen it was very salty. Our appetizers was very salty as well. My friends all agreed that our ramen was too salty and we all ordered something different.

I wouldn't say this is the best ramen I've ever had but when in Vegas, I guess this is the spot.

First time here and I ordered the spicy miso ramen with an extra egg no bamboo shoots. The beef with the noodles was DELICIOUS! I'm sad I didn't order nori but I will next time. I also ordered a large sake. 

The broth was delicious the noodles were perfect. Wasn't a fan of the chasu it was too much fat for me ( that's my preference though) I loved the light spice to the spicy miso. It was very satisfying..

The reason why it's 4 stars instead of 5 is my BF went to go to the restroom and while he was gone the waitress snatched our bowls up without asking and we still had a lot of broth left! We wanted to finish the broth together and by the time I could say something she was already walking away!! Ask first! I know there's a line of people waiting, I get it but give my BF enough time to come back so we can quickly finish our broth. He came back with his bowl gone and was upset. 

So if we come back I guess we have to chug the whole thing down quickly before she takes our bowl? Idk I may choose another restaurant for that reason next time.

Food was great but taking our unfinished bowls without asking was a big NO NO.

Great ramen in my opinion , they provide very little seasonings and hot sauce so you can really taste their own broth which you can choose from, I chose the salt broth and it was delicious, a generous portion of pork was given too and noodles and broth ratio was great. Only down fall is that it is a very small inside so a wait is almost a requirement

My Mr. and I were in Vegas over Superbowl weekend. Came in with 3 others around 10 pm after the game.  Got seated immediately.  Very attentive and nice staff.  Had the Screaming for Vengeance ramen. It's the spiciest ramen they offer and boy was it spicy!  The ramen was perfectly cooked with that slight chewiness, ramen broth was thick and savory. The char shiu pork was so tender.  The different broths are pretty high in sodium but what ramen isn't? I recall this place also offered a low sodium broth for those with dietary restrictions or for those not wanting to be swoll like a stuffed sausage trying to fit in that LBD for the club. I'll definitely be back if I'm not getting my pho fix down the street.
Good ramen in Las Vegas. Nice broth and toppings. Very hot! In it's own building away from the chinatown strip malls. Not huge inside, but not really a wait either.

Maybe I'm not a ramen expert but this place does it for me. Good prices, nice casual atmosphere, friendly staff, great T-shirts, great bowl of soup with many options. The standard bowl, $7.50, is a fine meal anytime. Just make sure you get there by 10:30 p.m. -- even though they are open until 11, they stop taking orders at 10:30.

Ramen Sora's, "Screaming for Vengeance" ramen bowl is for people whose stomachs (and egos) love feeling the burn. 

It's like their spicy ramen, except two large pieces of dried seaweed are included, and the broth is red from all the mouth burning spices -- that should be a good indication of what to expect. The broth is incredibly spicy, and I have to agree with our waiter that it's as intense as an 8 or 9 in regards to Thai spiciness levels.  As you continue eating, the heat from the spices does intensify. I didn't "scream,"  but I was sweating like I was in a sauna. If you like the burn, then I say accept the challenge and order "Screaming for Vengeance." If ya can't take the heat, I was told you can send it back to have the broth diluted.

Bumping my 4-Star rating up to 5. Not because of the fiery ramen, but because the food I've ordered on each of my visits has always remained consistently good. Plus, unlike other ramen places that I love, which I've only given 4-Stars to, I don't have to wait for an hour for a seat to open up.

Favorite ramen place in Vegas!!! Miso corn butter ramen, gyoza, and beer! My kind of Friday night dinner.. It gets pretty busy but we have never waited longer than 10-15mins! I've never been a soup,pho,ramen to-go person, but that has since changed since eating here! Waiting for the chilly weather so I can pick it and have it for lunch:)

Damn this place was delicious!!! Great service we made it in before rush hour and when we left there was a line out the door. It is small and everyone that's dines there seems local and of Asian descent so we knew it had to be good. The best miso ramen I've ever eaten!
The ramen is good. The wait is crazy. The owner is slightly rude and seems to have an attitude.
Wow! The ramen here is phenomenal. I'd have to say probably the best I've ever had. Don't hesitate, give this place a try I promise you will be a regular.
Great Ramen! Portions are good.. dishes come out hot.. and not as salty as Jinya! I will be back!

I don't understand why people would like this place..... this place is horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the broth!!!! gosh!!!!! it was disgusting. it has that weird smell..... and that roast pork!!! gosh is that roast pork!!!!??? do they know what roast pork is!!!??? now it makes me feel like yelp is unauthentic!!!!!

I was in the mood for ramen, so we came here to get my ramen fix.  This is our second time here and it was good as usual.  I had the Deluxe Ramen.... and my wife had their special Tonkotsu ramen.  She enjoyed it although there wasn't very much ramen in the bowl.  I ordered extra ramen (large) and although the bowl was quite big, there wasn't all that much ramen inside. The flavour of the ramen soup was quite good.  Will return again whenever I have the urge for some authentic Japanese ramen.

If you want some amazing ramen, then this is the place for you! It's less crowded than Monta Ramen, but man this place is exploding with flavors.

They serve thick noodles and a rich broth, but the best and most irreplaceable item at this Ramen joint is their chashu. No other ramen spot will beat this place on chashu and I've tried countless Ramen joints in Vegas, LA, OC, SD, and in Asia.

They got 3 types of broth base miso, shio, and shoyu. The  appetizers are great here as well and I would recommend the mini pork chashu bowl.

Parking is kind of small, but definitely worth it. Come check this place out.

It is located in a bad neighborhood, hence the 5 printed signs inside saying they are not responsible for break ins or stolen stuff. Felt uneasy leaving my vehicle back there. The meat was very fatty and lesser quality than most places, but the killer spicy flavour was great. The noodles were cooked good but something was off about them. The gyoza was the best part, but wouldn't return for it.
Our first time to try this Ramen place and my family is very pleased... is very good and the meat is very tender. Highly recommended.

I finally tried this place. Recommended by all the yelpers. Let me just say it's my second time this week it's so delicious I usually get the spicy miso ramen. I also had the gyoza which didn't disappoint and the pork belly was pretty good too. Only thing I would recommend is sharing the pork belly because this is a lot of belly fat but oh so delicious. The wait isn't very long, people are in and out pretty fast. Can't wait for my next visit.

Hell yes best ramen I've ever had.... and that's a BOLD statement. To put this in perspective I waited 20 min in uncomfortable heels in unbelievable pain... and all of that was eradicated the minute I tasted my ramen!

I like thicker noodles so this was already a win for me. Thick chewy noodles is the best kind of noodle! Bf is meh about thick noodles so for him this was probably just another good bowl of ramen

Broth - flavorful, just the right amount of froth and oil and flavor... and served extra hot! This is key people.... nothing spoils of a bowl of ramen for me like tepid/warm broth. I need my broth scalding hot

Pork - thick cut pork slices that melt in your mouth .... they only give a few slices but that was more than enough for me

....and the icing on the cake? A perfectly cooked soft boiled egg

If you can get past the wait and mediocre service, this place is totally worth it

Awesome ramen! This is one of my favorite ramen places of all time. Too bad it's in Vegas, or else I will be visiting all the time! If you are a fan of spicy ramen, this is the place to try.  It's so spicy that I couldn't go out for a few hours afterwards.... worth the pain though! :)

The menma is awesome - order a side of it and it goes really well with the ramen.. :)

Not bad ramen but I wouldn't go as far as to say it's a 5. I've had plenty of ramen after living in NYC and the Bay Area and this was not the best I've ever had, but tbh, maybe this is as good as it gets out here. 

Got takeout from here and it was a zoo in here on a Thursday night -- glad we ordered over the phone in advance (but I could barely hear a thing during the call, not surprising though). 

The menu is sort of confusing and redundant -- 
We got the chashu ramen, spicy ramen, and the miso ramen (everything between 7.50 to 9.25, which is pretty reasonable for a decent quality ramen), but each one has the choice of miso, shoyu or shio soup. I don't know why there's a different choice of soup for the miso ramen or why I was even being asked to pick a soup (what else would it be?), but in any case, I just picked miso soup for all of them. 

Pros: 
Chashu was indeed good and melt-in-mouth tender
Price point
Soup had good rich flavor

Cons: 
Servings aren't the largest but I guess that's reflective of the price. 
Pretty salty and greasy (while that's expected with a ramen soup, more than so than most)

Overall, fairly good ramen and glad to have this option on our trip to Vegas for family.

This ramen hot spot was quiet when I walked in  soon after it opened for the day. It was so quiet that all I heard was the sound of happy customer slurping the soups. After trying their miso ramen it was evident why this place is so loved. The broth had plenty of depth, just enough salt to pique my tastebuds, well seasoned and tender slices of pork, and thin wavy noodles with plenty of chew to them. An order of gyoza comes with four dumplings. Beautifully crispy on the bottom but leaving an oily aftertaste.

Credit cards are usually accepted, but this day their connection was down and couldn't process and cards. I wasn't informed of that until after my lunch. Luckily, I had some cash on me.

Just went here for lunch and my experience was just as good as the first time! This is definitely one of the better ramen places in Vegas and I would recommend checking it out if you haven't done so yet.

I have tried the Deluxe Sora Ramen ($10.00) and the Chashu ramen (for $9.25). The only difference between the two is that the deluxe one has 3 square pieces of seaweed which probably isn't worth the extra $0.75, but if you don't really care about cost then go for it! The pork is really flavorful and tender and not really fatty. I normally don't like eating pork, but this is one of the few exceptions because it is just that good! Also, most places just give you 1-2 pieces (i.e. Monta), but this place actually gives you a good amount. I actually had to finish my pork at the end by itself since I ate most of the noodles (which normally doesn't happen!). The broth is also really good and my personal favorite is the Shoyu (soy sauce) one. They also have miso which has a creamier texture and shio which is just lightly salted. 

The restaurant itself is pretty clean and the staff is very nice. They are always smiling, enthusiastic, and willing to help if you have any questions. They also play the the of music you would hear in clubs lol. This place does have a wait time during peak lunch and dinner hours since it is popular and the restaurant itself it pretty small. It is worth the wait unless its over an hour.

My favorite ramen joint in town! I always switch it up and get the spicy miso ramen or screaming for vengeance with miso broth. If you get the latter I highly recommend getting the spicy meat on the side! Service is always quick and friendly and everything on the menu is under $10. Can't go wrong here!
This place gives a lot of food for a good price! My family always come here! One of the best ramen in Vegas!

On a chilly snowy day in Vegas, (yes, we do have more seasons than 100 degree summers!), nothing is more prefect than a warm bowl of ramen.

It's difficult to avoid comparing this place to Monta but Ramen Sora stole first place as my favorite ramen joint. Ramen Sora is bigger than Monta which means more seating and less wait times. We went on a Saturday evening around 6 and barely beat the rush. 

The menu is pretty basic - when it comes to ramen they had items I've never heard of like Corn Butter Ramen so I was too scared to try it. I ordered the Shoyu Ramen and upgraded to a large for $1 more. My husband got the regular sized Miso Ramen. (Tip: You will definitely want to upgrade to a large!)

My husband and I argued over whose broth was better. I loved my Shoyu and he loved the Miso. I can't pretend to be a ramen connoisseur but I know the broth wasn't too salty and was full of flavor. The ramen was perfectly cooked. I enjoyed all the accompaniments like bamboo shoots, seaweed and especially the egg.

Service was good and friendly. After the dinner rush though, we had to flag someone to get our bill. I saw a "now hiring" sign so its good to know they're going to resolve that issue. This place is only going to get even busier now that its sweater weather!

I had the spicy Ramen and it was okay.  I've gone to Ramen places in Seattle and compared to the flavourful broth I experienced there, this place fell short of my expectations based on the reviews.  It's busy though and there aren't many tables so get there early.  I had the miso broth and again only okay at best.

This is my spot. I've tried several Ramen places in Las Vegas and the bay area and non compare for me to Ramen Sora. They have the best noodles, the best additional items you can add, the best broth, great prices and the coziest space. I wouldn't say there staff is the most friendly, it's a quick service thing. They get you what you need and move on, I personally appreciate that. Actually, I love it. I don't know of another place in Vegas that beats this quick Ramen stop. MY FAVORITE PLACE!!!

Finally we tried Sora...and I haven't decided on whether I will be returning, when I seem to have much happier memories of enjoying the bowl of miso ramen at Monta.  I got the Miso ramen and I did enjoy the nice braised pork belly and the perfectly cooked half of an egg.  The noodle was a bit chewy for my taste, but my bf seem to enjoy it.  We  both didn't enjoy the bamboo shoots in the broth.  It kind of killed the flavor of the broth for us.  

I still don't know if I will return so it's an A-OK for now.

It's such a cute little ramen shop in Chinatown! My friend finally took me here and it easily became my FAVORITE ramen place in vegas! I've been to all the spots, you name it! But sora has the BEST noodles and BESTTTT, MOST FLAVORFUL BROTH in my opinion! They even have the best fried rice I've had in a ramen shop!!! I'm so inlove and I can't wait to come back! They get really busy though so be prepared to wait especially on the weekends! :)

I found this place through a little Japanese magazine specializing in Las Vegas, you can pick it up at most Japanese supermarkets in Southern California for free.

Went in with my mom one evening while in Vegas, I had miso and Mom had shouyu ramen. They were delicious. I'm really grateful to be able to eat good ramen in Vegas.. Service was OK, nothing more than taking your order and bringing your food.. But that's all we need anyway..

After a long weekend at Vegas, me and my friends wanted to eat a Ramen place nearby before going home.

Since I love spicy food, I ordered the killer spicy ramen.  To me, it was bearable, however the spiciness took over the flavor of the broth.  Next time I come back, I would just get the spicy miso and maybe with killer spicy meat to get that extra heat without taking over the flavor of the miso.  My girlfriend had the corn butter ramen and she really enjoyed it with her melon soda. 

Overall, it is a really good ramen spot near Vegas!

Not too many choices of ramen out in city of sin.  But this one is definitely a good one.  I got the miso ramen.  Chashu was delicious and the base wasn't too salty.  One of my favorite things about this place is that serve Suntory High Balls.  What's a Suntory High Ball?  It's a whiskey mixed drink in a can.  I drank this non stop in Japan during my last visit.  Refreshing yet inebriating at the same time.  I have not seen this drink anywhere else in LA or in Vegas.  

The service was good.  The servers were really nice and might I add... very pretty

I'm a fan.  The chashu pork slices are thicker and leaner than Monta.  What wins my heart is their Ultimate Spicy Vengence Ramen.  Spicy, garlicky, spicy ground pork all in the mix...however your stomach will be on fire afterwards...

After a couple of drinks at the Golden Tiki i decided to take my brother and niece that had never had proper ramen to Ramen Sora since they are just down the street.  Even though it was 9pm on a Tuesday night they were packed and we had about a 45 minute wait.  Once we were seated however they were quick to get our orders and the food came out fast, hot, and delicious!  I can see why they are so popular. 

Definitely a place I want to return.
Excelent food, taste delicious, the best in Las Vegas, authentic Japanese, friendly staff

I typically feel hesitant to give a restaurant 5 stars but for this place it's a hands down no brainier. I lived in Vegas for two years and my husband introduced me ramen because he lived in Japan. The thing is, Ramen Sora ruined me. I've been to a lot of ramen places all over the US since and this is by far the best!

We always get a pitcher of Kirin beer (It's only $11.50, gotta love that) and the spicy ramen with the miso sauce. The noodles are the perfect consistency for this warm soupy dish, the pork is high quality and melts like butter in your mouth, the spicy flavors make you crave more! After 3 years away from Vegas we drove into town last night and came straight here! Enjoy it while you can! And don't be scared off by a little line. It goes fast and again, this place is well worth a 15 minute wait!!

Maybe I'm not a ramen kind of girl but the wait...oh man that wait was rough. Mind you it's a hole in the wall kind of establishment with minimal seating so you should definitely expect a wait. I believe my friends and I waited roughly 45 minutes for a table for 6. This was our first time here so we didn't really expect to wait THAT long. Our waitress didn't really stand out as friendly or rude, she answered our questions, gave recommendations and brought our food out promptly. This is probably my second time eating ramen so I am not familiar with the serving sizes but I felt there could have been more noodles. Their broth is good though! Overall, I may have to try a few more ramen places to really get a feel for portions, service etc but try it and judge for yourself.

Easily one of the best ramen spots in LV...their noodles, broth and pork are on point!


A cpl weeks later...


On my follow up visit I tried the Chasu Ramen with Miso broth! It was phenomenal! Great broth, great noodles and top shelf pork...

My girl got the KILLER SPICY RAMEN and loved it....although she did say she would order my Chasu Ramen on her next visit.

All I can say is, WOW! SOOOOO good!! I had the Miso Ramen and it was phenomenal! I will be back, again and again and again! 

Side note, if my coworker had not raved about this place, I would NEVER have gone in based on the looks of the outside. Inside... it's small inside, but it's nice, clean and modern.

P.S. It's about a 5 min cab ride from Wynn.

We ordered a regular and large shio chashu ramen.  The noodles were a bit chewier than we preferred, but we both liked the shio broth and the generous portions of chashu.  Service was fast and efficient.

When it comes to food, I never pretend to know something about cuisines that I was only introduced to a few years ago - or at least I let people know that up front when I write a review about it.

That being said, Ramen Sora has good ramen - at least I think it is good. The noodles definitely have a unique flavor that I have not run across before. I ate the whole bowl, so I must have liked it.

However, maybe I was spoiled by Monta down the street, because I was bummed to find they had so few choices of add-ins like chili oil or pickled ginger. 

While I will admit that I really liked the food, I don't expect that his will be where I find myself when I drive down to Chinatown for ramen.

This place is amazing. To many of you who compare this to Monta, I believe this place is great in its own way. Monta and Sora are two completely different kinds of ramen. So understand that before comparing them. I prefer Ramen Sora because of the selection.  And honestly, the ramen here is tastier flavor wise.

Finally made it here after the "Flies on S@#t" effect wore off (When there's a new hot spot in town, people get drawn to it like flies on S@#t) This was our first visit and most definitely not our last...

(S)apporo style ramen is their speciality
(O)nly Monta was the go to spot before Sora
(R)amen noodles are OFF THE HOOK!!!
(R)ice bowls are available as well
(Y)ou gotta get the Gyoza too!

(M)iso is one of their popular broths
(O)pen until 11pm
(N)o reservations needed
(T)amago with your ramen is a MUST!
(A)lready getting hungry as I'm typing this review

(!)...........ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(342/365) "Slurpin' @ Sora"

If my review was based on the food alone I would give it a five. However this place seems like it's a little short staffed. The two girls working are really doing their best but could use help. The two times I came into get meals to go I waited more than 30 minutes. the only reason i didn't call it in was bc no answered the phone each time i tried to call.  Aside from that the food is worth the wait and the people working there are very friendly.

Hands down the best ramen place in Vegas! I go here almost every week to get my ramen fixed. My favorite is the spicy miso ramen - broth is flavorful (a bit on the fatty side if you don't mind) and the noodle is at the right crunch/chewy texture. 

The place is located in China Town, off the strip (which is a plus because I would hate all the traffic on the strip).

Currently as the Duke (as of 2/8/2012 7:37PM) of this fine establishment, I would like to welcome Ramen Sora to my wallet.

The Short: Get the Miso ramen, upgrade it to a large, order a Sapporo (when they have their license), and go into a food coma.

The Food:

Shio: Reminds me of Chinese noodle broths, slightly clear and savory, includes 2 pieces of pork with strong flavor (soy?), seaweed, half an egg, and some fermented bamboo shoots. Everything seems to go well with each other and came out at the perfect temperature somewhere between hot and really warm. The saltiness of the broth was not overwhelming or made from someone with a salty palette. I think even my parents who dislike every other non-Chinese broth will probably enjoy this. 

Miso: The toppings are the same as Shio and I feel like this broth is the winner and the prize here. Supposedly  their style of made for the colder weathers, therefore it is rich, thick, bursting with umami or savoriness. I fully agree, except that I'll most likely be here during the summer's triple digit weather devouring a bowl of the Miso ramen. What I enjoy most is that black pig fat floating on top adding to the deliciousness. A Spicy Miso is also available with the spice equivalence to a big red pepper. 

Of course additional toppings can be added such as more bamboo shoots, onions, pork, egg, and noodles. Noodle upgrades however don't come in a separate bowl (kaedama) for you to add later like Monta. 

Curry Bowl: Unfortunately only comes in a mini size, but anyways it is a thick brown curry with carrots, chashu, and pickled red ginger (mhmm). A great snack if you're really hungry and waiting for your ramen, or.. if you're not that hungry, but don't want to feel weird with your dining companions. 

Fried Rice: If you're considering this, I would say stick with the ramen. There are two options for the fried rice, one with the house gravy sauce and one without it. I think this is the one item that is a bit overpriced, and towards the end was somewhat greasy. The house gravy (looked like egg drop soup) came in a bowl which you're suppose to add to your fried rice, wasn't my thing though. 

Drinks are pretty standard can tea, soda, Ramune, water, and Sapporo in the future when the elusive alcohol license comes in. Perhaps the wizards in the kitchen can create a "real" Sapparo beer ramen when that comes haha. 

The Service:

I can't bag on them too much for service since it has been mostly good, and they are not even a week old yet. For what it is worth I did experience a bit of a hiccup from the manager whom forgot to process our order and quirky service, but it may have to do with them running out of broth by 2PM causing her to accumulate stress whenever she had to turn away customers. I'm sure once they get things sorted out everything will be dandy. 

The Location: 

Ramen Sora is located "behind" Sura Korean BBQ (hard to miss, but if you're coming from the strip its going to be the building right after Macy's Home Furniture). Parking is entrance specific, but quite adequate for the amount of seats they have available (more than Monta if you're wondering). Air conditioning seems to be working strongly too. 

Lastly if it matters for whatever reason I have always seen "nationals" in here, so I assume it must have their approval in authenticity.

I came to Ramen Sora on their grand opening day and both food and services were pretty good. Everyone from host to server was super friendly. Even though it was grand opening day, all the food we ordered came out quickly when this place was full house. I like shio ramen a little bit better than miso one. Ramen noodle tasted a little firm just in the way I like it to serve. Chef was pretty generous when serving ramen with chasu. (each bowl came with 3 pieces of chasu) I personally like their soup base a lot better than Monta. (Monta's soup base is too salty to me) I also tried their Gyoza. It was really good and worth the money. 

I will be back soon after they have alcohol license. I always like to eat ramen noodles with some Sapporo.

Place is very tiny but it is worth the wait. They had many varieties of ramen that is in a reasonable. They serve really fresh ramen. They serve the ramen how it looks like on the menu, very presentable.
The ramen tasted so good and it was like I was being taken to a new place I never knew existed
Highly recommend! First time in Vegas and wanted to go off the beaten tourist path for restaurants. Best ramen full of flavor!

my fav place, being from japan I find it pretty hard to find ramen to my standards. this place blew me away first time around. from the ramen to the rice. I felt like I was back home in Japan. I come here like once a week and everyone in my office loves it now too. addicted!

I knew this place must be good since I arrived 10min before opening and there were already 12-15 people waiting to get in (mostly Japanese) like myself haha. I ordered the chashu miso ramen and split the gyoza and pork rice. This ramen was amazing and the chashu literally melted in my mouth. I live in Torrance area so I've tried them all and this place would beat Hakata, Yamadaya, or Asa. I will be coming here every time I visit Vegas. Next time I will try to Shio or Shoyu flavor. Service is quick and I was in and out in less than 40 min.
The killer spicy ramen is the best in Las Vegas.  The restaurant is always crowded around lunch but food is worth the wait and service is quick. Limited seating available for parties over 4 people

Delicious!

Simple menu selection, great flavors, good price, good location, and parking available.  

I was craving ramen in Vegas, so we decided to look it up on Yelp.  I'm glad that we found this place.  It'll be one of the restaurants I'd return to when I visit Vegas.  I had to come back a second time before I had to go back to Hawaii.

I tried this place out with my family. The ramen was absolutely delicious, it's even better than some of the places I've tried in LA. The pork was amazing, it literally melts in your mouth. We were all thought the food was great. I recommend getting the large size if you love eating ramen. I am disappointed by the fact their green tea comes in a can though. The staff here were really great when I went, very friendly.

I ordered the Deluxe Ramen w/ miso soup: $10

Pros:
* The soup is very filling! 
* They have hot green tea that's free
* Staff are very friendly. They greet you when you enter & when you exit
 
Cons:
* The soup was a little too thick for my liking, but I'll try to get it adjusted to taste the next time I come here (per mentioned on the menu)
* They don't have much options for dessert
* They don't do anything for birthdays (which was the reason why my party went here)

Despite the cons mentioned above, these are very minor & more on personal preference. 

I've actually been wanting to eat here for a while now & have attempted to try it. However, their wait time was very long which caused me to leave. Fortunately, this last time my family & I wanted to give it a shot, there was no wait time & we were seated right away!
Hopefully this'll happen again the next time I go here
Ramen here is delightfully delish.  All broths are good.  Pork belly and gyoza on the side,  even more  yummy for my tummy:)
So yummy! Love the miso broth and also the three taste platter with the chasu and flavored eggs. Corn butter soup was also delicious!!

Ramen here was pretty good compared to others. Soup base and pork was a bit salty for me. Gyoza was on the opposite side, it was bland. Would be back just cause it's different from the usual daily buffet and steak houses.

Soup : excellent

Topping : good

Noodle : MEEEHH!! I am a ramen lover, but this is the 1st time i felt the noodle so different then the regular ramen i ussualy get..

Price : not too bad..

Size : from regular, large, and super size. Watch out its really big..

Nice place with good ramen dishes. Place opens at 11:30 am and closes at 11:00 pm. I showed up at 11:15 am and there was already a line to get in. Within minutes the restaurant was filling up with the available tables.

Kon'nichiwa, mouth watering ramen! I came here with three other people around 530pm and as we were walking from the car to the front entrance the smell of the food made my mouth water.

Food (4 stars): 

There are three different type of broths here: 1) shio (light clear salty) 2) shoyu (soy sauce) 3) miso (creamy salty) There are also three different sizes 1) regular 2) large (1/2 size added to reg) 3) super size (1/2 size added to large) --- The regular size is perfect for me but the fiancee ordered a large size and he was content. There is an extra $1 added to each size up. 

I can vouch that the spicy miso ramen is the best ramen here, especially for those who love spicy food! The creamy spicy broth melts in your mouth along with the soft wet noodles. The spicy miso ramen comes with a huge piece of chasu, bamboo shoots and chopped green onion, 1/2 an egg, and spicy ground meat. I tried the shio and shoyu ramen and it was alright. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ramen-sora-las-vegas?select=0vjKNr87LblVN2JuatKoTg#Nb98rm37EeqWqQEKGmsh2A

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ramen-sora-las-vegas?select=0vjKNr87LblVN2JuatKoTg#4gO-6jvqmarA2wYn8mgKTw

The gyoza also smelled delicious. 

Service (4 stars): The waiters were quick and attentive. 

Ambiance (3 stars):  Its located on the corner of S Eldon St and Spring Mountain. If you make a right on S Eldon St, the parking lot on the right side in the back of the building. We went at the end of May and it was 90 degrees in Las Vegas and the restaurant felt like an oven. I was sweating as I was eating the ramen. I think they should turn the A.C. on higher. Theres about 8-10 tables of 2-4 seats and I can imagine how pack it would get during rush hours. I would recommend coming before dinner rush hour around 6pm or earlier to avoid the wait. The restaurant is very dimly light so I opt to sit closer to the window. 

Overall, if I am ever in town, I would definitely come back if I am craving spicy ramen!

I'm a total ramen snob. Actually, not snob but, GomaTei (in Hawaii) Elitest. 
My friends and I always joke about that cuz GT is our favorite and everything else sucks in comparison.

I tried Monta cuz I followed the crowd and wasn't pleased with their salty broth...so, when I came here, I was set on not liking it. 

Waiter was really nice and patient with my "are you sure this isn't salty" comments. lol
He recommended the shio (least salty) broth; and since I like spicy, I added that to the mix. My BF had spicy broth with spicy meat. 

First taste was a true pleasant one =)
Broth was spicy enough to my liking and NOT SALTY ----- YAYYYYYYYYY!!!!!!!!!!
Noodles were soft but, not too soft. Which is, also, to my liking.
Needless to say, I drank up alot of the broth...and had the BF kill the rest of my noodles.

Waiter asked if the broth was good and I just smiled and thanked him with a fat tip.
It aint GomaTei but, I'm still beyond excited to have a ramen spot in Vegas to call my own.
Best ramen I've had in vegas. The only thing that sucks is how small the restaurant is and the wait time. Sometimes it's worth the wait but i try to time it where it's not as busy

THE BEST GRILLED PORK BELLY EVER! GET IT, GET TWO ORDERS OF IT OR MORE!   It is on the appetizer menu, forget the name of it it was like chasu something. but man it was like melt in your mouth good. Like foodie heaven! The ramen is delicious too. The seating inside is small and it is a popular place.  They have you sign your name in when you arrive.

My favorite ramen place in Las Vegas!! Their miso broth is not as thick as Monta or watery like other places. I tried handful of ramen places but always end up coming to this place even with the line. You know it's good food when people wait for it.

Me and my bf come here every month or every other month. I've always get Screaming for Vengeance, spiciest ramen in town. Used to give me runny nose from the spiciness but now I can barely feel a thing. It's spicy but not like you can't taste your food kind of spicy. They need to step it up and make it more spicy for me. Lol.

My boyfriend's favorite is corn butter ramen. It is quite delicious. I guess most things with butter taste good.

You should definitely try this place when you are in Vegas. Better than Monta Ramen

The worst customer service in the world !!  Waited outside before it opened and was the third in line ... Waiter sat two tables in front of me ... Then since the other person in the party was parking asked me to stand against the wall while he sat the entire place !!!!  I was just in awe !!!  What a jerkoff !!!

I have never made  review on yelp or any other site before. I had to make it a point to do this because of the huge disappointment I had with the service at Ramen Sora. I'll start with the wait... which we got skipped over once for another group that came later. Ordered food and drinks the same time... got the food, and half way through eating the food... tried to wave down the server 2 times... the server clearly seen us and ignored us. Finally spoke up louder and got said servers attention. Never got refills. etc etc. Ask for the bill and waved the server down to pay, and server never came back. Walked to the front and payed for the meal as doing so, I spoke to the person upfront and they seemed like they didn't care. Wont come back 0/5.

My boyfriend and I eat here all the time we introduced our friend and now he is always craving it. Seriously our favorite ramen joint in Vegas. Soooo good every time we bring new people here they get hooked on it, my boyfriend and I have been coming here for a little over 3 years, the staff is always so nice and inviting. And the food is always spectacular

So I tried the Shoyu Screaming for Vengeance and it became my favorite. I ate it 3 times and it was spicy but I ate the entire bowl. The next two times, within the past month, I couldn't eat it. It was so spicy that it made me cry and I had to commandeer my friends leftover broth in order to have something to rinse my noodles off with. It was so painfully bad. My face and lips hurt afterwards. The last time I went I was told that the meat gets hotter the longer it sits in the oil that makes it "killer." I was told it wasn't too bad today and it wasn't as bad as the last time but the amount of chili oil in my bowl was ridiculous. I may just switch to the spicy ramen so I can go back to enjoying my meals  still highly recommend this place over any other ramen restaurant though.

When you need a "Ramen Fix"  Ramen Sora is very consistent with their Sapporo style Ramen dishes. 

This shop is the place to visit instead of the haphazard abundance of other Ramen location in the Vegas Valley, some shops are not serving Japanese style dishes.  

I also enjoy the Curry Rice, wonderful as an alternative for guests that did not need a Ramen fix, the Spicy Fried Rice is great, it is certainly not the flaming heat that can become not eatable in other Japanese food locations.

Good ramen here! I got the miso ramen with extra spicy meat. It also came with a slice of pork. It's very filling and the noodles are nice and soft. The broth is amazing. Too bad though they don't offer side plates of kimchee fried rice like Monta, but it still satisfies the ramen craving! The service is excellent as well! They are very attentive, friendly, and casual with you.
Very good ramen ... definitely will come back for more! =D

One of my favorite ramen places to eat at. I think this is also the first places I had dinner at my first rime in Vegas years ago. This place is always packed but thats understandable considering how good the ramen is here. Even with my fair share of ramen in Los Angeles...somehow this place tops it off. 

I ordered a buttered corn miso ramen since I was sharing with my oldest daughter. Nothing too complicated since we were having a late dinner upon arriving in Vegas from LA. Even though it was a late dinner, theres still a line to get into this place. 

I love how flavorful my bowl of ramen was. It was like heaven in every bite. And the best part is.. my daughter loves it. She devoured everything in her bowl leaving it empty. Service was a bit slow though but again it was busy for a friday night so no complaints here. And its great for a cold night to warm up with a hot steaming bowl of ramen.

It was okay place to eat i had the firey hot Raman it wasn't at all what I expected but I know it was decent by Standard let's just say I enjoyed the price point, the food,my full stomach and the idea of having options other than my go to but it wasn't great and there is better eateries in Chinatown

Pros: Insanely delicious ramen, chashu that just melts in your mouth, friendly and quick service, inexpensive
Cons: Tiny restaurant gets crowded on peak times, parking lot is odd, not a lot of side dishes/appetizers if that's what you're into before you eat ramen

I recommend: Deluxe Sora ramen (miso broth is my favorite) upgraded to large size for more broth

This has become my favorite ramen place in Vegas so far! The chashu is just so tender and delicious and the broth is savory, but not too heavy. It definitely hits the spot when you have a ramen craving. The waiters are very friendly, attentive, and helpful. 

Like others said, the restaurant is quite small so if you're going for dinner (on any day, from my experience so far), you'll probably encounter a wait. The parking lot is kind of odd; if you're entering the parking lot from the back of the restaurant on Eldon and drive around to the side, the parking spots are diagonal in the wrong way (but the correct way if you're entering from Spring Mountain) so it will be difficult/impossible to park in those and you'll have to exit onto Spring Mountain and loop around. Not a big deal, but on more crowded days it can get a little hectic when everyone is fighting for spots. 

All in all, a really great, authentic, delicious ramen restaurant that will definitely hit the spot. On busy days or days that I just want to sit at home in my pajamas and eat ramen, I like to call in my order. They're pretty accurate with the wait time they estimate for you and I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes to pick up my order :).

I was sick and congested and wanted my cure-all for any illness: pho.  But my husband suggested ramen. What? No, I don't want a 30 cent cup of salt from Albertsons! I'm sick; take care of me!  Little did I know he was talking about real ramen, of which I had no knowledge.

We arrived around 8 and surprisingly there was a wait, but it wasn't too long. When we were seated, the waitress immediately asked what we wanted. I hadn't even looked at the menu yet!  I guess most people here are regulars and know what they want.

I decided on the deluxe ramen so I could try a little bit of everything. I got the miso base and my husband got the shio base.  One bite and it was like fireworks went off and angels starting singing! Ramen may be taking over pho as my favorite soup da loop.

The miso base is slightly creamy with such a flavorful burst.  It's everything I want pho to be after I add fish sauce, hoisin sauce, and soy....but I didn't have to add anything.  The pork in it fell apart like butter, the noodles were chewy, and the egg was a nice surprise that I was slightly wary of but ended up loving.  The shio base that my husband got reminded me of egg drop soup.  Less flavorful if you wanted to taste the meat more.  But what I really loved (and this is so stupid!) were the utensils! No cheap break apart chop sticks, no, there is a container of real chopsticks that are so pointy that they were the easiest chopsticks I've ever used.  The spoons have a lip so that the spoon doesn't fall in your soup and it has a notch near the spoon for resting on the bowl so you dont have to put it on the table.  Don't ask me why that impressed me so much.

I took off one star because of the service. Along with the immediate wanting to order, we had to hunt someone down for a water refill and our check after waiting a long time.

Great atmosphere, seating arrangements, good food and excellent service! If you like seaweed in your ramen, you will love nori ramen. ;) If you are starving, there are Large and XLarge to choose. If ramen isn't your thang, they also serve curry or chashu rice bowls, fried rice and goyza. Parking lot is behind the restaurant, street parking is also available. Last but not least, remember to put down your name as soon as you walk in to the restaurant, so you can get seated accordingly!

Arriving at 10:30pm, it's the 1st of a few visits with the line not out the door and actually being seated. Casual, true Japanese-style, sitting at a common table - you can sneak a look at your neighbor's order. Satisfying broth flavors, ample serving, post-performance satisfying. Closed at 11pm.

Don't let the funny looking box building sign fool you, this place is worth stopping for. It s small, but packed with a line outside the door. It s clean and the service is fast. This is only the second time I've been to a place where the ramen is made here. We had the shoyu ramen with pork belly , bamboo shoots , seaweed and egg. Plus the screaming vengeance ramen with assorted ground chilis,  pork belly, egg, bamboo shoots, and special sauce- pls tell us! This made my husband sweat more than any other ramen or pho'  he has ever tried. This place is affordable and delicious. Go for it!  It's right in the heart of Chinatown...

Excellent place!!  Prior reviews were spot on. It's a quaint little place in Chinatown. There was a wait list when we got there and one when we left. Waited 25-30 Min for a table. Seats about 35 people. Service was great and fast. 

Very reasonable, the broth is amazing!!  It is al pork based so if you have any dietary restrictions theme not for gut. Tried the miso and shiyo ( shoyu  base).

Very good ramen but poor customer service. Very poor. No one smiles at you and when you ask for stuff they give you a big attitude. Four stars because the ramen was fantastic and one off for poor customer service. I might come back again because of the food. But my sister said she will not come back again.
Food was great!! The prices are also great! Must try the gyoza and the ramen of course lol they have three different ramen flavor bases. I recommend the miss base

Ramen Sora has really good ramen!  There really isn't all much more to say that hasn't been said by other yelpers.  I came in to visit on a late Wednesday afternoon and it was packed!  But I really wasn't surprised since I've heard a lot of great things about Sora.

It really wasn't a hard decision for me to decide which Ramen Bowl to order.  The Deluxe Sora Ramen had everything I needed.  The only tough decision that I had was deciding which broth to pick since they had 3.   I went with their Shoyu Broth.

Deluxe Sora Ramen with Shoyu Broth --  http://bit.ly/1v0IrNi
Good broth, nicely roasted pieces of Chasu Pork, and good noodles.  It's a real solid bowl of ramen.  Is it the best ramen I've ever had?  Maybe not, but it's definitely a lot better than most ramen joints I've been to.  I'd order this again!

My favorite ramen spot in Vegas still goes to Jinya.  But Sora is pretty close.  I love the simplicity of their menu and would love to come back here again in the future to try their other Ramen Bowls since they all look delicious.

We came in for a late lunch and I must say this place is very clean, great service and definitely great ramen!  It's our first time so we don't really know what we're ordering and definitely don't understand the menu...(a small description on the menu would be nice for first timers like us) but the waitress was very patient and nice explaining the menu to us - i was goin to give this place a 4 star because i cant understand the menu  but because of the nice waitress - that put the 5th star on the rating!  We ate every noodle and slurped our bowls clean!  We are pleasantly full and cannot wait to come back!  Wow Ramen Sora - I'm impressed!!!

Went on a Saturday afternoon with a party of 11, and we had to wait 20 mins or so. We didn't call ahead of time to reserve ahead, and the wait wasn't that long. 

I ordered the nori ramen with miso base broth and did not add any other toppings on the side. However I was content with what I got in my ramen bowl! Noodles was just the right texture and had the right bounce when you bit into it. Egg was delicious, and the chashu!  I also ordered the melon creamy soda. Super yummy!! I also tried their curry bowl, fried rice and gyoza. All tasted really delicious!!!

If you love ramen, I'd say give this place a try!

First time eating ramen!!! The line was kinda long,  you gotta write down your name and party when you enter,  the wait with 5 of us was about 30-45 mins. They are busy busy and small inside!!! I got the pork belly with 1 egg and bamboo appetizer which tasted good. My ramen bowl was the $10 Delux Sora ramen in Shio base was fantastic; my fiance added extra spicy meat to his bowl which in my opinion made it taste better since I love spicy but we were going to EDC later so I didn't follow in his footsteps lol !! Water refills were okay. We also got the 8oz cold Sake, passed around the 5 of us. The hit was pretty good lol but im pretty weaksauce. Oh, and also parking area is small so we parked along the side of the road :)

Hands down, my go to ramen place every damn time that I head to Vegas. I will not be satisfied until I have my miso ramen. Their broth is seasoned to perfection and the noodles are cooked al dente just the way I like. 

DEFINITELY stop here if you want a happy belly.

#justmytwocents

We felt like eating ramen after a long and eventful night in Vegas. This restaurant is a typical Japanese ramen restaurant. We had a party of 14 people but they were able to accommodate us. I prdered the chasu ramen with miso base. It was okay, I've had better. The thing I like about this place is that they give a lot of meat- several slices of chasu. Service was mediocre. Overall, it was just A-OK.

The ramen was just ok. 

We came here for lunch one afternoon to get my ramen fix. I ordered the Number 1, and my buddy ordered the Spicy ramen. Mine was not good at all. The broth was overly salty and I couldn't taste anything else. The noodle was decent but the ingredients were very lacking, the meat wasn't very good, and there was too much green onion. Supposedly there should be bean sprouts in my soup, but there was none. And my soup was lukewarm when I got it. My buddy's bowl tasted alot better. 

Very disappointing.

On my last visit here, I came on a Tuesday at around noon and it was packed! Definitely a popular lunch spot in the Chinatown area. Our group of three had to wait about 30 minutes for a table, so keep that in mind if you're in a rush. 

Other than the wait, I have no complaints really. In my opinion, this is the best spot for some delicious Miso Ramen. I tried their Shoyu Ramen once and thought it was just okay. Everyone in my group ordered Miso Ramen (with some extra toppings here and there). I personally like adding corn and/or chashu depending on how hungry I am. Their chashu has an amazing, rich flavor. Service is good and the orders come out blazing fast. I only wish they had Tonkotsu Ramen because that's my favorite order everywhere else. 

They have a small parking lot directly behind their little building, but if you can't find any spots there's a lot of street parking in the residential area behind the restaurant as well. All said, if you like Miso Ramen, you should give this place a try.

I think I might like this place better than Monta.. But I still like Monta's noodle better. It's a decent size ramen house, however it gets busy really fast which makes the wait time ridiculous. I ordered the miso ramen with extra egg and nori and I thought it was delicious. They are very generous with that nori. I do like the size of the place better rather than being squished next to people at Monta. They are a little more expensive but if you think about it, at Monta all of the extras add up to the equivalent or even more than the price of these pre-set ramen choices.
By far, my favorite ramen place. It's always busy from open to close. Small little joint. I always order the spicy miso ramen with extra chasu

The most recent Vegas trip was the first time I got to eat in China town and I was excited to find out they had a ramen place. We arrived just in to time to beat the crowd. I went with a group of five and we got seated within 15 minutes. I ordered the "screaming for vengeance" with corn because I love spicy ramen but was disappointed it wasn't spicy enough. I am still in search to find the most spiciest ramen. The broth was on the saltier side, I am not sure if its because I've been drinking and my taste were off. The broth was ok but I was disappointed that the food was not piping hot. However, the really like the pork belly, talk about fatty goodness. The noodles were cooked al dente and had a really nice texture. This place is a solid 3.5 stars in my books.

My boyfriend and I love Ramen Sora! We come here frequently because the food is so good. It's great to share a super-sized bowl and the prices are very reasonable. Everything that we've tried on the menu is absolutely delicious and very filling. The service is also very fast so you don't have to wait and the portions are very big. The Chashu Miso Ramen is my favorite with extra menma. Awesome place, definitely one of my favorites!

Rating: 3.5/5.  Satisfied my craving for ramen for a pretty nice price but I have had better. I'm picky about my noodles!

I ate at this restaurant coming back from a day trip coming back from Zion National Park to Las Vegas where I was staying since I didn't want to eat another $50 dinner on the strip. 

The first impression: the restaurant is small, very busy, and service a bit slow. I got there starving and was seated within 15 minutes after signing in on a clipboard. The food took a bit to come out since I ordered miso base soup and they had run out since it was popular. I noticed that there a quite a few locals/repeat customers who come to this area so I was feeling good about my impromptu choice. 

The food: I ordered the regular deluxe combo bowl (the one blown up on the menu with all the fixings) and a mini curry char siu bowl. Compared to NY ramen bowls, this place is not bad, but not the best either. The (miso) base of the deluxe #1 ramen is creamy and rich but a bit salty for me. The noodles were kind of soft for me (I prefer them chewy) but maybe my noodles were slightly overcooked. And the char siu was very tough and overcooked on the lean portion, although I appreciated how much meat I got for a $10 bowl. I also really like the small tapas-style "mini bowls" you can order - around $4 for a mini char siu curry bowl and rice was not bad in my opinion.

Overall my craving for Asian was satisfied eating here.

Amazing ramen for good price! Service was great & ramen came very quick. We don't have any good ramen places back home so I was super excited to try this place out. I got the simple shoyu ramen which was perfect for me because I don't like a lot of stuff in my ramen anyway. The broth was very tasty & the noodles were cooked perfectly.  Also tried the gyoza & pork fried rice which were both good too. A sort of hole in wall place with limited seating, so get there early or you will have to wait. We got there before it opened & within minutes there were others waiting with us. Although, even though you have to wait, the  turn around time is very quick.

They are always busy so if you plan on eating alone, they don't prioritize per space, only 1st come first serve. I would recommend for them to add in extra tables where there is some space to add more and possibly build in a bar for people who do come in singles. I didn't want to waste my time waiting for the available amount of seating they have nor did I want to take up a whole table when it fits a party of 2-4+ per table. The wait was long. I see people finished with their meals just conversations or on their phones possibly waiting to be checked out when the service should pick up on cues like that. I never really the time or experience to where I could give feedback on the food but I hope to do it soon.
Food is great and comes out fast. My favorite is the #1. Customer service is pretty good for the most part. I just didn't like how they didn't let me drink my drink that I got from Kung Fu Tea.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday around 9:40pm. Our waiting time was about 15 minutes. There was a lot of people waiting to be seated but customers left very quickly after they had finished their meal. 

As quickly as we were seated the waitress gave us the menus and asked what we liked to drink. I ordered miso ramen and my boyfriend ordered spicy miso ramen. Both dishes came out quickly and I dug in as soon as it came. 

It was very delicious. I've been craving ramen for days! I've always just had top ramen and any packaged noodles from the grocery store but never had this type of ramen in a restaurant. But knew that the noodles would be a bit harder and chewy here. The pork literally melts in your mouth! Everything about the dish was delicious. I can't help but say that I felt something was missing. It was probably the fact that I was still hungry after. I'll definitely try one of the chashu bowls next or eat it along with my ramen. Great place to eat. Highly recommend on a cold and windy night!

I've always managed to dodge this place on my way up to Monta. I've seen it before and always wondered, but always just went to my safe place.

This time around I figured we venture out to somewhere new and remembered that Sora was just around the corner from us. 

Nice and quaint, probably reminiscent of a low key Japanese pub (at least of what i've seen in televised visits by Anthony Bourdain) and maybe a tad bit bigger than Monta. 

The menu was short and simple, you can start off with the basics and add a la carte, or just pick from a bunch of named bowls. The 'Screaming for Vengeance' had my eye, but (sorry for this) having 'firebutt' later on in the night in 100 degree plus weather didn't seem like a great time. The spicy ramen with the miso would suffice. 

The ramen was nicely textured, had a great bite and picked up the flavors of the ramen nicely. The broth had a nice spice to it. While the waitress kindly nodded as to how spicy the Vengeance might have been, I'd definitely try it next time. Otherwise, perfect balance and wasn't overpowering. It was great, cause it was super warm inside, slurping along side the many other ramen enthusiasts. This place was among the best we've had anywhere. 

Maybe the only thing I regret was not ordering the large. The regular was definitely smaller than I've seen for that size, but that's probs because they want you to order two, or get out so they can usher in the next crowd. Either way, can't miss!
Nail tech recommended and glad I came! Simple and delicious, I didn't want to stop. Loud and lively, fun place to dine.

Favorite ramen place in the city. Always good service though you may have to wait for a seat if it's a busy time of the day. The miso chasu ramen is my favorite. The mini chasu bowl and their appetizers are also delicious. I wasn't a huge fan of the screaming for vengeance. Overall this place is inexpensive with large portions and a good atmosphere.

This is the best ramen place I've been to since moving from Hawaii. Staff super friendly and attentive. I ordered their "very spicy" ramen with miso based broth and it was perfect for my taste. Definitely will come back again to try their wide variety of ramen.

This is my favorite and go to place for Ramen noodles! The place does get packed from time to time due to small venue but it's well worth the wait! Great price and great service! They will constantly make sure you get the meal you want and as quickly as they can! A must go to if you haven't already and it too can be your regular.
Best. Ramen. In. Town. So authentic! Amazing atmosphere! Love it!

Soooo --ooooooo--ooooooo good! Their broth is to die for, cashu is cooked perfectly, little extras like bean sprouts and buttered corn and just the right amount of spice make my meal perfect. Their broth is so good, I usually order an additional small bowl of broth to fill my bowl once I am down to noodles.Reasonable prices, friendly service, delicious food:  Ramen Sora has made me a ramen lover!

This place was recommended by a friend and it did not dissapoint. I ordered their regular size size  ramen and it was enough to get me full. I added the spicy meat and it made it even better. There were plenty of meat and the miso thick broth was very flavorful. The place gets really packed i was glad we got there early enough to beat the line. I'm coming back here when I'm in town.

Most people remember their first crush...  Ramen Sora was my first ramen shop in Las Vegas last month.   Since then I had tried 2 others in Vegas and have decided to return here to dine again with my new Yelp buddy! She's just as exited and happy to dine here as I am!

Ramen Sora's location on Spring Mountain Road is convenient and easy to find.  The free parking is close, safe, and clean. The ambiance is still authentic, comfortable,  and fun!  The food remains yummy,  memorable and beautiful. ..just like a first crush!

During my last visit,  I had the Nori Ramen and the 5 piece side order of gyoza for $3.75 - yum!  This time, I ate the Butter Corn Ramen.  Both times,  I enjoyed the cha siu that just dissolved in the mouth with an edge of salty spice and melty, soft fat in between the tender meat! The noodles were firm and slurp worthy.  The broth was tasty with a just right goodness!

Re: the Butter Corn Ramen this visit...
I really like corn: corn flakes,  corn chips, popcorn,  etc., so BUTTERED corn for me is a double treat! Yummy!  The half of a hard boiled egg was like a cherry on top of an ice cream sundae! Mmm!

Maybe I'm a bit of a romantic because I can remember my first crush.  It was 4th grade. ..a time when life was simple. ..like corn, butter,  and noodles! The basic food groups!

Yum! I came with my sister who was in town visiting and recently came back with a friend and she loved it!  We both did the corn butter ramen I believe is the name-- prolly slaughtered the title(: I added seaweed to the bowl and I've cleaned the entire bowl out each time! Parking is tight, but I've been able to snag a spot each time I've come, but yes great ramen and I will continue to recommend this place and bring others as well!(:

The broth at Ramen Sora definitely has a kick. You would either like for its intensity or you don't. It is so rich it will slam in your face! Personally, I do not like broth that intense so It is not my preferred choice but I am sure somebody would appreciate it. 
_Sora Delux - $10 - Thick cut of meat. I like. I got the Miso flavor and found it to be too salty for my taste. Egg was cold. I wish it was a little less done. 
-Screaming for Vengeance - This was VERY SPICY!!! I warned you. My bf had this and he was in and out of the bathroom for a day!!! He did enjoy it though. I liked it too but did not have the courage to eat more than couple spoon. 
I prefer Monta over Sora for its simplicity and balance. Sora was too rich and salty.
If you like lighter version of Monta ... This is the place... A little bigger space also... I tried the miso ramen soup. Not bad...

This was my second time trying ramen, my first time at Monta left me not desiring to try ramen again, but my friends Liza B & Julie T told me they preferred this place to Monta, so I gave it a shot. It was pretty busy when we arrived, we waited about 20 minutes, but it gave us time to look over the menu. We were seated and our waiter promptly took our drink orders, they have my favorite oolong tea in a can. My friend got the killer spicy and I had the miso. We shared so we could try each one, I couldn't decide which one I liked better. Their gyoza is really good too.

Horrible customer servuce, very cold and lifeless.
Sure, while everything runs smoothly, they are borderline decent they.....But have one problem with the food or service and all of that goes out the door.
 My girlfriend is Vegetarian and I had been wanting to go to this place for years. We ordered her fried rice and asked for them to make it vegetarian, without any meat, when the food arrived, to my girlfriends surprise she bit into a big piece of meat!  She almost threw up aince she hadn't eaten meat in 16 years , we asked to have it redone and the manager, female Japanese said she couldn't guarantee there would be no meat in it. At this point my girlfriend asked to cancel the dish and the manager said no that she would have to pay for it or replace it for something else of equal value... we then asked if they could make a vegetarian dish for her then and they said no, only what's on the menu!??is this real life??? 
We ordered her mochi and a soda and left.. literally the only thing vegetarian on the menu.
 Today I tried to eat there again, I brought my girlfriend take out and went inside and asked the manager if it was possible for us to bring in her vegetarian dish and explained the story that  I had been wanting to eat there for a while but couldn't since they don't have one single vegetarian dish.. They said no, and that they wouldn't have anything vegetarian, I then asked if they could possibly think about making a vegetarian Ramen or dish in the future and the tall male server who had been listening in an noticed I was frustrated even though I was explaining how much I wanted to be able to eat there,  stated in a sarcastic voice, "probably not" with a smirk.  I was planning on taking out but after that I just wanted to leave.. 
I can't stand small/close minded business owners.
 Can't have egg after 11am.. can't substitute items on diahes. Etc..

Great alternative to Monta. I still like Monta better but Sora is different and good in its own way. I ordered the miso ramen which has a great piece of pork but the noodles were a little bit chewy for my taste. Others might like it though. All in all a great a place.

This place is like a hole in a the wall goodness. It was cheap and very affordable. 
My first trip to Vegas and on the 3rd day, a few if us went off the strip for dinner. Decided to go here since the other Japanese restaurant was closed. As we walked in, they shout out a big welcome chant and take us to our seat. I think our timing was very lucky, we came in around 6ish pm and there was no line. This place is pretty small cant really have a big group here if you're planning to have a party of 8+ or 10+ during dinner. 

So they have so many choices to pick from. I went with Deluxe Miso Ramen and for an extra $1 -$2  for super size was worth it, if you're really hungry. The miso broth was very good and full of flavor. I was be ware of their "Killer Spicy Meat."  Thank god i order it on the side in a separate plate. Barely nip a tiny piece of meat and i was breaking into  sweat and i could really feel the heat in my mouth.

Anytime someone talks about ramen in Vegas, it's either in reference to either Sora or Monta. I finally tried one of the two rivals last week. For me, ramen is graded on three components: the noodles, the broth, and the ingredients (usually the pork and the soft-boiled egg). How does Ramen Sora measure up?

There were a number of different broths to choose from, but I decided on the basic shoyu. Right off the bat, the broth was pretty thin in terms of both flavor and depth. I was shocked to later read that you could add a slice of butter to your ramen. That's not something that you want to see at a ramen joint. The noodles were average at best. My favorite part of the ramen was actually the barbecued pork and perfectly soft-boiled egg. 

How does the competition down the street compare? Stay tuned for the review on Monta.

Best Ramen in Las Vegas! I'm addicted now! My friend introduced me to the screaming for vengeance Ramen, which was a little too spicy for my own personal taste, but I settled on the regular spicy ramen with a miso base, which was absolutely perfect. I would go here every day if I could. Love it. So delicious.

Great ramen.

Cheap for Vegas! The chashu was really tender and the miso broth was super tasty. I'd definitely go back.

The place itself is really small, I went there myself I a weds night at 9:45pm and I had to wait!! But, I suppose that speaks to the ramen. Small menu as well. But, if you're going for ramen, I suppose you shouldn't care about the rest of the menu.

We were tired of the buffets and food on the strip, so we decided to find some good asian food. With Yelp's recommendations, we headed to Chinatown!

Like other reviewers mentioned, this is a small, hole-in-the-wall type of ramen place. We arrived late at 9:45pm though, and the wait was not too bad... a little over 20 minutes for our party of 5. They have several tables for twos and fours, but for groups larger than 6, they offer to split your party up. We ended up sitting in the big middle table with bar stools. Even with all the people waiting, the servers had a really fast turnaround with cleaning the tables and getting people seated.

At first I was worried about eating hot soup for dinner since the vegas temps were really high (111 in the afternoon and 105 still later in the evening), but after waiting for a table we all got acclimated to the light air conditioning, and we weren't sweating trying to eat our soup. Problem solved!

Food: There were three main types of broth here- soy sauce, miso, and salt (shino). Four of us opted for the salt ramen and my dad tried out the sora deluxe ramen. We also got a side order of fried rice, which was really flavorful! The salt ramen was very good; not quite up to par (and a little watery) in comparison to the excellent ramen available in the West LA and Irvine area (Sankutora, Tatsu, etc.) but for Las Vegas, it's pretty good. The rest of my family, who only eats ramen occasionally, loved it and my dad enjoyed the deluxe with miso broth. My soup did not come with mushrooms like ramen sometimes does, but it did come with a half egg at no extra charge, which was nice. The noodles were chewy and cooked perfectly.

Everything came out to around $40- an excellent deal considering the quality and location. Four stars!
