My favorite part was that the chasu wasn't all fat. I know I'm probably the only one who doesn't like the fat, call me strange. I just prefer more meat. I think next time I'll opt for the $1 charge and upgrade to the larger size. All in all, solid ramen spot and for sure I'll be back in the future. 

P.S. Only reason why I didn't give a 5 star ration was due to the fact that we felt rushed to pay.

This ramen joint has become one of the go-to places for my friends and me whenever we're hangover in Vegas. The facade gives off a janky, run-down and small little restaurant, but everything else once you enter inside truly delivers. The employers are natives and very friendly as they provided us with water and took our orders. I usually go for a Spicy Miso Ramen, but decided for a change and got the Corn Butter Miso Ramen ($9). I enjoyed the variety of ingredients that came with the ramen topped with slices of chashu, bamboo shoots, green onions, corn, butter and a perfectly runny egg! In entirety, the bowl of ramen had great flavor. Make sure to melt your butter under your noodles while it's hot. I added a lot of their spicy seasoning on top, which gave it the spice I was looking for if I had got the spicy miso, so I still had the best of both worlds. The food came out quick and our drinks were constantly refilled. You can also get hot green tea for free, which was nice. This is a great spot even if you're not hungover.

Quaint hole in the wall ramen restaurant located in china town. Considered one of the top three contenders for ramen in Vegas. 
They offer a standard menu. You won't find a large list of options or happy hour and trendy music here like its competitor JINYA. 
Just solid classic ramen. 

I will preface my review with I am not familiar with the authentic ramen restaurants of Asia. 

Be prepared for a wait as the restaurant is tiny and always packed. 

Their menu offers three bases for soup: 
Miso - all the way get this base 
Shoyu - need to try
Shio -salty and bland. I don't recommend. 

I will start by saying I initially tried shio base and was thoroughly disappointed. Salty, bland and quite frankly did absolutely nothing for me. After trying a spoonful of my friends spicy miso base soup I was "that" person and returned mine to the kitchen and asked for miso base instead. Feel free to roll your eyeballs at me here. 

After my initial setback the amazingly delicious spicy miso ramen hits the table. Noodles perfectly al dente. Switching out my soup  was the best decision I made.  the soup was spicy and had a kick but not too hot to take away from the complex flavors - perfectly executed. I see a lot of complaints of the hard boiled egg being over cooked in other reviews but it was perfect for me today. 

I took one star away for service - the waiter got pissy with me. Also for ambiance the interior of this restaurant didn't really have much to it.

Definitely give this place a shot for a solid bowl of ramen.

Considering how small the seating area is here, and how few parking spots they have directly available (you can park on the street nearby but it's difficult if it's busy), they sure can churn through the peak hours. 

I arrived at around 740pm and was seated at 8pm, despite at least 8 parties having been listed (that hadn't been seated yet) before my arrival. 

The options are plentiful, and the customizations look great. I considered getting the 5pc gyoza appetizer but realized I'd probably be full from the Large Deluxe SORA Ramen I'd just ordered. 

I am seriously considering buying one of the displayed t-shirts that says "no ramen no life"...

The ramen arrived 15 minutes after ordering. It was quite good - the quality of the noodles, broth, and chashu (pork) were excellent. Further, they don't use peanuts at all, so no worries on my allergy. 

I was recommended this place by Eugene H.; quite the worthy recommendation - I'll definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants quality ramen at a great price. Everything (large ramen with tshirt) was only $27 after tax and tip - no complaints for the vacationing Yelper in the city of sin.

Daughter ordered the miso ramen, I had the negi ramen while my beau ordered the spicy miso ramen.

This was the first time the beau had authentic ramen and he really enjoyed it. He also ordered the Gyoza and I ordered a side of fried rice. To be honest, the food was amazing. Coming from LA I was scared I might have picked the wrong one but after reading Monta and Sora, I chose Sora. We, as a family, were not disappointed!

Thank you Sora crew! You introduced my beau to true authentic ramen and rocked it!!!
Food was very good. Service was very nice. Always refill my drink. Overall much better than monta and anime ramen

I need to come back to this place! It made me feel like I was back on vacation in Japan, in one of those tiny and cozy ramen restaurants over there. Poppin' spot by China town, had to order "to go" since my boyfriend wasn't feeling well. I ordered and had my food in less than 5 minutes. Staff was super busy, however they were very efficient, friendly and great customer service. Our ramen had the perfect amount of flavor.

My sister has been talking about this place forever now...so before we left to go back home, we decided to make our way in for ramen. We were a party of 7 and we came by around 1ish in the afternoon. There wasn't a wait. It's a pretty small establishment, so big parties are going to have a hard time. I ended up ordering the Miso Corn Butter Ramen with extra chashu and extra seaweed flakes. The food came out pretty quick and the broth is very flavorful and rich. I added the chili flakes in my bowl and it wasn't too spicy. I will definitely be coming back when visiting Vegas. DELICIOUSNESS!

On our last trip to Vegas, my wife and I were craving ramen on a chilly night and we were thankful for Ramen Sora. This small restaurant serves excellent ramen at affordable prices. Service was quick and efficient, with an easy-to-read menu for first-timers. 

I had the chashu ramen with miso (you can also get it with shoyu or shio), which was amazing. Tender pork, rich and filling miso broth, perfectly cooked noodles, bamboo shoots, and egg: it's a bowl of tantalizing flavors, delicious from the first to the last spoonful. 

I can't ask for anything more in a comfortable ramen joint. It's far enough away from the Vegas strip craziness that you can hunker down with your bowl and warm up your bones as you try to forget about losing the kids' college fund at the craps table.

Never try ramen with sapporo style, but decide to try.. its really good. The broth is perfect tasted. 
Want to try spicy ramen but server told me they put jalapeño inside, and i little bit scared.. hahahahaa
And decide to try this ramen.. 
definitely will be back..
the best ramen place here in Vegas almost as close to Ezogiku back home in Hawaii Nei.
Went there during my Xmas vacation and had some quick dinner there, the ramen was pretty good and the price is very good as well. will return next visit.

Last year we came here when monta was crazy busy and it was good so we came back on a Tuesday for lunch. We got there right when it opened and there was no wait we got a table right away. However, they told us that water hadn't boiled yet and we would have to wait for ramen. It took almost 30 minutes! The broth was salty so didn't finish my bowl this time. Fried rice was good!

Great place.  One of the best ramen spots in Las Vegas.

A bit different flavor from Monta Ramen.  I can't necessarily say which one is "better" because I enjoy them both.

Broth is on point, noodles are cooked perfectly, and the regular sized bowl will fill you up.  They offer a larger sizes as well.

Came back here to eat and the gyoza was a vast improvement from the last time I was here. The food was very good. The only bad thing was the service from the wait staff. Water was never refilled and I got a feeling that they wanted me to leave for some reason. I really felt rushed the the restaurant was empty.

Best ramen ever! Big portions and the broth was amazing. The noodles were al dente and made it a great texture. The pork belly is tender and flavorful. The place is a bit small so if you come during a rush you'll be waiting a while.

I like them better than Monta, there I said it. 

Lately, Monta's been serving up some really salty broth, so my family and I needed to find another place for our ramen fix. Thank goodness Ramen Sora opened. I love their chewy noodles and the broth: for some may be flavorless, but to me it's not overpowering. My only gripe is their chashu, it's a little thin and it falls apart quickly (this is where Monta wins). So far so good. I'll have to come back when the weather gets colder to update my opinion on this place. Hopefully it doesn't disappoint.

My cousin took me and friends to this place and I've never had ramen before...boy it was so delicious I'll never eat pho ever again! I had the miso spicy ramen. Its rich and full of flavor. Spicy but just enough heat. We also had the fried rice, potlucks, & curry (Japanese curry) all also very delicious. And very speedy service! Once you order...poof...5mins later food on the table. Hot and fresh, along with very friendly staff!

It's about time I confess... I love ramen more than I love life itself. Especially ramen from Ramen Sora. A few years ago I had ramen for the first time at some sub-par restaurant that made me stray from ramen for a while. A year later I gave Ramen Sora a try. It was glorious and I fell in love. I love their ramen in all its salty & flavorful broth, thick noodles, crunchy menma(bamboo), and umami chasiu. 
During the time I've known Sora, I've strayed from my loyalty and tried multiple other ramen restaurants around the valley (& some in California!), but I have yet to find another that compares to Sora's rich soup, flawlessly boiled egg and the perfect fat-to meat ratio of the chasiu. Shio (soy sauce) broth is light and salty if you don't want a thick soup. Miso is thicker and flavorful with what I think are hints of ginger. Spicy pork is not too spicy, and ask for chili oil which delivers a nice kick. Screaming for vengeance is hottt and comparable to a crazy night out- you'll feel it more the day after if you know what I mean. Sora even has delicious and good sized portions of chasiu bowls and curry bowls if a ramen doesn't fill you up.  There's usually a bit of a wait at dinner time, but any wait is worth it for what Sora has to offer. 
Sora has everything I could've ever wanted in a love and more. 
My heart, and stomach, belongs to Ramen Sora. 
Til death do us part.

So I went to Monta and the next day I came here and it was so good, I was inspired to do something I normally don't do, which is a real review. I'm no food critic, but I know what pleases me. I got the Screaming For Vengeance and was pleasantly surprised with the heat and flavor. The broth was thick and flavorful and the noodles were thick and absorbed the flavor well. If you're going to drink, get the pitcher. More bang for your buck. Right now this is my go to ramen spot in Vegas, but I'm currently on a quest to try them all in the Southwest side of town until I find the best.

Ive been here before but haven't reviewed until
now. Came for lunch on a busy weekday as a party of 4. We walked in at 130pm and were seated without a wait! My party had the Screaming for Vengeance, and Miso Ramen. All items were served hot and were delicious! I will definitely be back to try the other items!

We thought this ramen place was good, but not great.  A couple of other people told us they thought it was better than Monta, so we gave it a try.  Respectively, we disagree, Ramen Sora, while very good, comes second to Monta in our opinion (family of 3)

Now I understand why everyone raves about Ramen Sora. I first visited a couple of years ago and now I'm kicking myself that I let so long go by before my second visit. This is some amazing ramen. 

The restaurant is very tiny and always busy. Once inside you'll add your name yourself to a clipboard on the counter. There are a couple of benches inside and a bench outside to wait until your name is called. It'll be worth the wait. Once seated our waitress didn't waste time in getting our orders taken and delivered to the table. She checked in often to refill our waters and see if we needed anything.

I ordered Spicy Ramen with Miso Broth. This was five days ago and I'm still thinking about it that amazing flavor. The broth is what really makes the flavor on this dish. The pork and spicy sausage are very flavorful. The whole dish comes together well for a very flavorful and filling dish. We also shared the Pork Belly Appetizer which was smoky and tasty. 

The restaurant doesn't really have an ambiance to speak of, but the food is really great and reasonably priced.
This is the best ramen place by far for me. My favorite to go place. Must try the miso ramen. Too bad it closes early. 10pm

Just stopped by during a conference. Hands down some of the best ramen that I've ever had. It is a little bit of a trek if you want to walk there from most of the hotels, but at their prices, it is well worth venturing in a cab. The bus also runs right nearby if you want to head out cheaply from the strip.
This is my favorite ramen place in Vegas!!!! I really wish they'd open another location in Henderson.. I either get the shio ramen deluxe or the spicy miso. Both are equally delicious!!

BEST RAMEN I'VE EVER ATE... 
and I've eaten a whole lot of ramen. 

Every time I visit Vegas I have to stop by this place. 
Some times twice before I leave back to the Bay. 

The Killer Spicey Ramen is the best.... Hurts so good. lol

Excellent ramen...great flavor, not as salty as Monta ramen. I particularly love the thicker ramen noodles cooked to al dente. The killer spicy miso ramen is delicious and super spicy! Water was always filled and filled about 4 times...place is small, but service is great. Highly recommended
Corn Butter Miso Ramen, Spicy Pork Fried Rice, and Chashu Bowl is always a must even if you aint hungry. Dont live with any regrets.
Someone told me that this place is amazing. Got the butter corn ramen (spicy). I thought it was fine, but did not live up to the hype of "amazing".
FOREVER WAIT! Waited 2hours just to get a bowl of ramen.. I'd rethink on going again. The taste is very authentic and it has decent amount of ramen inside the bowl.

Eh, maybe I'm a tough critic but this place met my standards for a DECENT Ramen joint. I've eaten a lot of Ramen from Las Vegas to So-cal and Nor-cal. I've even attempted Man vs Food's challenge at Orochan Ramen (Little Tokyo's) Spiciest & biggest Ramen bowl. So I know my Ramen, and this place was A-OK but I've tried better. 

Ramen Noodle:4/5 I liked the noodles, it was a bit thicker and chewier than most Ramen joints I've tried but I didn't like how chewy it was. Thicker was a plus but chewy no. 

Broth Spicy Miso: 3/5 I ordered the SPICY MISO RAMEN which was actually not spicy at all. Even though the soup turned red after mixing it a bit, but don't let looks fool you. The broth was a bit greasy you could see the oil bubbles this was definitely a turn off. The broth was very light, I felt like the broth was missing something. 

Broth Chashu Miso: 2/5 The broth was very light and oily. Once again I felt like it was missing something, NOT ENOUGH FLAVOR. I barely tasted the Miso and everyone knows Miso is salty which made the soup not as salty as most soups I've tried.

Chashu: 2/5 The Chashu pork, if you know what Chashu pork is its really Pork belly. That's simmered for about an hour slow cooking so its soft tasty and chewy. The pork belly they used was more pork less fat which was okay but everyone knows the flavor is in the fat. The Chashu pork was a bit chewier than most I've tried but also remember it was more meat than fat. My order came with one slice so I ordered extra Chashu because I love chashu pork, but I'm not a fan of theirs. 

Tamago (egg) : 0/5 REMEMBER! The order does not come with a Tamago, even if on the menu there's a picture of one. I guess I assumed on the menu the picture was exactly what I was ordering. I usually like 2 tamago's so I ordered 1 extra. Not knowing I was ordering just HALF of an egg. So When I got my miso ramen I was sad to see I only had 1 half of a tamago. THE TAMAGO was TASTELESS! No flavor at all. A real tamago is kepted over night in a soy sauce based sweet sauce. But this was NOT A TAMAGO. The Tamago WASN'T EVEN BROWN! The Tamago is my favorite part of my ramen and they totally ruined it.

Alcohol: 0/5 Currently they don't have their liquor license which makes it such a tease on the menu because who doesn't love to enjoy a Sapporo beer with their Ramen. Instead I was forced to enjoy my Ramen with a glass of water imprinted with the Sapporo sticker (even more of a tease)

Service: 2/5 The waitress and the waiter were super nice but not so much the manager. My boyfriend eats a lot, so he ordered a large which was suppose to have more noodles and more soup but it wasn't enough for him. So we asked and offered to pay for more noodles since he still had a lot of soup left but they said no we would have to buy a whole new bowl which was a big disappointment because at MONTA my boyfriend always orders more noodles with no problem 
 
Parking: 5/5 The place was dead, when I pulled in there had to be 2 other cars there. They have a small back parking lot which is a plus. 

Wait: 5/5 THERE IS NO WAIT! Which was awesome because I was hungry when I got there. I was seated quickly

A rainy day must! 11:30am and already a line waiting outside. What is this recent ramen obsession of mine? I used to be content eating Cup O Noodles with a cracked egg...don't judge, we've all been slummin' at some point.
A friend of mine recommended Sora and I'm glad to say I can still call her a friend.
First off, I appreciate the quick service and slightly more ample seating. The servers were on their game and quickly delivered the goods with a smile and thorough explanation of the menu. I initially expected to pay a la cart for tamago, chashu and spicy meat like at the other places. But for $8.50 I can get a SPICY MISO RAMEN with all of the above...what a great deal! Of course you can get extra portions of these items for just a $1 or $2...again not a bad deal considering some other ramen houses charge much more.
SPICY MISO RAMEN was perfect! I loved the spicy meat that should be a ramen staple...lean ground meat with a slight sweetness and once mixed into the rich, not too salty miso broth, completes the ramen experience. Chashu is a newly acquired taste for me as I wasn't a fan of fatty pork belly, but in a steamy bowl of ramen is now an unctuous treat I crave. Chashu, slow braised pork belly that takes hours to cook to achieve that tender, melt-in-your-mouth texture. The only thing I didn't like and will probably always have an aversion to is the fermented bamboo shoots..menma. I think it ruins my perfect bowl with its stinky presence...sort of like the uncle no one likes who keeps showing up at dinner. I must remember to omit it from now on.
I enjoyed the simplicity of Sora's ramen that didn't try to pack in everything and give you ramen ADD with adding things like black garlic, chili threads (offenders know who they are). Ramen is a simple bowl of comfort food meant to satisfy and warm the soul. Sora achieves this and is what a good Obaasan (grandma) would approve.

With so many places to go and get Ramen in town, you'd be sorry if you passed up this restaurant. It doesn't matter what anyone says to compare Ramen, you just go to get that fix of comfort food you know all to well and enjoy! I always enjoy the Super Size Miso or Super Size Deluxe Miso! Oh so much goodness in the broth. The Gyoza was ok but the Chasu Fried rice is another good choice by itself or as a combo. Only negative is the wait as with all other Ramen restaurants, it's just all about timing!

Hubby and I came here twice on our vacation! Found it using Yelp and we were so happy we did Tried the miso ramen on first visit and shoyu on second. Both hubby and I like the shoyu beat after trying it.

Portions were good. Ramen starts at $7.50 for any soup base of your choice and hubby got the chasu ramen for $9.50 which came with 3 large pieces of chasu instead of one. Had the gyoza of course which was good but not stellar....ooh and the mango ice cream mochi balls are the bomb though!

Service was awesome both times! Recommending it to all our friends when visiting Vegas!

This is my favorite Ramen location in Las Vegas!!!!!! Seriously, this place is amazing. I eat this shit when it's cold or 90 degrees outside. I don't care! Lol. I usually order the Spicy Ramen with Shoyu broth and add killer spicy meat. Last week I tried the Miso Ramen with killer spicy meat and was blown out of the water! Like damn! This is the best Miso Ramen I've had out of all of the Ramen restaurants I've tried here. The flavor was so bold and didn't lack in any way. It was really heaven in a bowl and I f*cked it up like a savage!!! The Pork Chashu bowl is also a favorite of mine and has changed my life. It's probably one of the best overall eats I've had in my entire life. Seriously! The pork is so soft and melts in your mouth. They have it down to a science! I've tried Jinya, and Fukumimi which I absolutely love, but Ramen Sora has my heart. This place is amazing and I always get great service here. The place is a little small though, so expect a wait if you come on a busy hour. I'm a Personal Chef so it takes a lot to get my props and they definitely did the job! :-)

FINALLY got to Ramen Sora last week before we went down to the strip for a getaway.  

My one and only negative to mention is that they are so popular that even during off times, you'll likely have quite a wait.  We went midweek, well after lunch hours, and still had about a 30 min wait for 2 of us to be seated.  That won't stop me from going back, because I now understand COMPLETELY why people line up inside and outside!  :)

The food lived up to all the hype and I found myself craving it again within hours.  We started with gyoza and found them to be some of the best we've had.  I had the Miso Ramen and hubby had the Spicy Miso.  Both of us really loved the broth!  The noodles are amazing and the pork is spoon tender.  I was a bit unsure about the egg, but found that it added wonderful flavor.  Who woulda thunk?  The "regular" sized bowls are FILLING and way big enough for both hubby and I.  

The table service is super friendly and FAST!

All in all, if we didn't live so freakin' far away, we'd be there 3-4 times a week!  As it is, we're determined to be back at least 1-2 a month.  

Long live, Ramen Sora!!!

Supertastyamazing! Had the spicy miso ramen (don't fear the spice, its very mild), and my fave the mini chashu (sp?) - love the mini $2.50 portion. Its pretty filling, btw. 
They created the ramen to-go-kit for me, and notified that for health reasons, the egg would not be coming with the to-go kit. Was fine. What a super tasty meal! It really was incredible. I am fighting a cold, so the soup broth really helped me. I'd go back just for the soup, no noodles (although they were good, too).

I took my mother and sister here on the recommendation of a coworker. Having passed it by before I warned my mother that it was not a big place and looked like a "hole in the wall" type of restaurant. But sometimes, those places are the best and this was one of them. We knew it when we arrived 15 minutes before it opened and already there was a line, and this was the day after Christmas! Fortunately, we were the second to last to be seated once they opened their doors.

The restaurant was clean and despite that there were only two servers, service was pretty good. Two tables were already being cleared as we were being seated. This is a ramen place afterall, order it, eat it (slurp it) and leave so the next person can get a table. I've driven past there several times since and have not once passed by without seeing a line out the door. It's that good. 

I haven't been to a ramen shop since I lived in Japan over 25 years ago. I thought the flavor and presentation were very authentic and would recommend it to everyone. I'll certainly be back!

There are many ramen shops in Vegas, I believe this is the best of them. I like that there is more space than Monta, and thus usually not as long as a wait. I stayed in Vegas for two weeks this past summer and went here four times, that's how delicious it was even though it was 110 degrees outside. 

They have three types, shio (salt), shoyu (soy), and miso. My goto is the Spicy Shio Ramen with extra chasu. Even better accompaniment is the Melon Creamy Soda that is perfect on a warm day. I can always go anywhere in Vegas to get a decent bowl of ramen, but nothing warrants such a craving except Ramen Sora. The broth is memorable and the chasu is soft and juicy. 

I only wish they were open past midnight...

How delicious! My friend took me here while I was visiting Vegas, and Monta Ramen was packed, so we went here! 

There was a slight wait, but seating was fairly efficient. 

I ordered the Screaming for Vengeance. I'm obsessed with spice and can never resist. I also typically order tonkotsu broth too, which wasn't offered at this location. I can never choose the shio, shoyu, or miso when there's so much more decadent options available! I couldn't find this information on Yelp when I was looking, but the difference between Screaming for Vengeance and Spicy Ramen is that SfV has spicy added to the broth as well in addition to the chili paste and spicy ground meat, whereas just plain spicy ramen is regular broth. 

It was fantastic! It was the perfect hurt. It didn't have a very spicy forefront (more of a slow painful build), and it did make my nose run! No sweating though. The noodles were such great consistency, on the thicker side with nice chew. Make sure you have plenty of water to cool yourself off! 

I took off a star since we had to get the waitress's attention several times since she wasn't checking on us.

I recently told my class about Monta Ramen, one of my students, from Japan, politely replied "Japanese people prefer Ramen Sora". So now I must try... THANK YOU!!! My new favorite number one ramen home.

This place was packed the night we got there. The ramen itself was delicious and so filling. I got the corn butter miso ramen and it was GOOD. Oh so good.... Except it was too salty in my opinion. I needed a lot of water. 

The downfall of the place, i dont know if it was because they were busy, but when we (2 people) were waiting to be seated there were a few tables already open and cleared that we could have sat at, but it took the waitresses some time to get us the table. 

Overall, good food and affordable compare to strip prices. Wait time was a bit longer than it should have been with the amount of space we could have been seated at.

This was my first time having real ramen; not that packaged stuff. Off the waiters suggestion I went with the Deluxe SORA Ramen. It was amazing. I did ask for extra spice because I look spicy food and it did not disappoint. So, just a fair warning to those who don't like spicy food and a suggestion for hose who do. I suggest everyone checking this place out. I had no idea Ramen could be so good.

After hearing this from a friend I decided to check it out with my dad. The staff guy was friendly and it wasn't packed. Anaconda started playing and I was like he ck yES.
Now onto the actual review. My first concern was if the chopsticks container have a daily cleaning, but I just brushed it off. My dad and I ordered both the deluxe with Miso soup. We didn't wait for a long time, so that was a plus. The noodles were hard to chew, but I got used to it and the broth was alright. The toppings were pretty standard, but boiled egg was my favorite! And the chashu was too chewy, not melt in your mouth, and it was kind of cold. I washed it all down with creamy melon soda. All in all, it the ramen was so so, but I might be coming back in the future.
This place is so small but definitely worth the wait! I always get the spicy Ramen miso base add corn and extra egg it is so perfect! Their garlic edamame is amazing also the gyozas are a must.

The ramen and gyoza are pretty decent here, but not IMHO as good as Monta Ramen up the street. Service is OK; but could be better if wait staff were a tad more responsive.

The main thing that I don't like about this place is they needlessly blast their music way too loud and makes it hard to hear your dining partner. What's up with that? Didn't come here for music, came here for ramen. Plus, even though they serve Coke products, they don't serve Sprite. Instead, they have that small-sized, over-priced Ramune soft drink that is a pain-in-the-butt to open. Sheesh!

Pretty good ramen in Las Vegas. Came here on a Monday and the wait for 4 was about 20 minutes. It's not that big there but the food comes out really quick. The spicy ramen was good, and don't forget to get the gyoza too! Can't go wrong with that.

I liked the ramen here at Ramen Sora, but it didn't blow me away like the ramen at Monta did. The flavors were distinctive and the ingredients seemed fresh and properly prepared. The flavors didn't seem to have some of the delicacy that I got at Monta.
I got the spicy miso ramen and it actually wasn't that spicy. But I could get it again and if I lived in Las Vegas I could see myself eating here regularly.
This place wasn't bad they rushed me a little bit but it was pretty good for lunch! The vibe is pretty chilll. I had the #1 and dumplings. The ramen was great, dumpling was okay.

The ramen was good. Not fantastic. Got spick ramen with miso broth..added a bunch of spice to it my self..not very spicy. Broth had a very earthy flavor... mushroom and bamboo shoot flavor. Defiantly won't return. Service was great though..

Excellent ramen that would keep me coming back. Pork was right blend of fat and meat. Service was quick and friendly. Between this place and Monta I could eat at this place over and over because the fat content is satisfying but not as over the top as a bowl at Monta. Super savory and delicious. Would come back again! Staple of Vegas not on the strip.
Great ramen broth on the thicker side, tender thick slice of meat and thicker noodle. Best value ramen I've seen

Oh... my... goodness... this is by far the BEST ramen I have ever had. I have tried the majority of the ramen places in Seattle and I must say that none come close to Ramen Sora. Ramen will never be the same for me....


Came here on a weekend night and came in right before a huge rush of people. The restaurant isn't very big and the place seems very popular. I ordered the spicy miso ramen with extra chashu. The broth was amazing and it wasn't too spicy. It was just enough to give it extra flavor without burning your mouth. I don't know how to describe this broth. It was warm, rich, and absolutely delicious!! The chashu was cooked perfectly. It was tender and practically melted in your mouth with the miso broth. I also thoroughly enjoyed the bamboo shoots that were still a bit crunchy, perfection!

I tried the shoyu broth as well, which was good, but nothing compares to the miso broth. If you come here, don't even contemplate about getting anything but the miso. It is a MUST! The ramen comes in regular or large, and by large I mean ginormous. It's a pretty big helping, so you've been warned. 

The service was on point. We were seated immediately. The waiter was very attentive and informative. He was able to explain the different broths and the different menu options. Everyone was able to decide what they wanted rather quickly after he educated us on the menu and everyone was satisfied with their order. So job well done. I can't wait to come back to satisfy my ramen cravings.

Came here based on Tony T's review. Ever since I watched the late Brittney Murphy's movie, "Ramen Girl," I have a fascination for Japanese style Ramen. I'm not a fan of miso based broth, but Sora's miso changed my perspective. It has a smooth and perhaps pork-like flavor. Too bad they do not have have Tonkatsu flavor. It is either Shio or Miso. Ordered the cha-siu Ramen. The pork slices are melt in your mouth tender infused with tasty fat. Prices IMO are on the high-side for a bowl of Ramen (I'm spoiled by Big Wong). The one thing that turned me off is that if I wanted extra green onions, they charge a $1.00.
Great ramen. Miso spicy is the bomb.can be a bit if a wait so definitely go before dinner rush. But well worth it

I really wanted to like this place - convenient location by the strip, friendly and fast service, fair pricing/serving sizes. But, for us, the miso ramen was just too oily, the ramen noodles were a bit rubbery, and the chashu had way too much fat for our liking. I'm usually not picky with my food, especially if it's ramen or any type of noodles/soup... But I forced myself to finish at least 3/4 of the bowl, just 'cause I hate wasting food. My fiance didn't finish his bowl either, and he eats everything and anything, so that's saying a lot, lol.

Granted, we did not try any other items from the menu besides the miso ramen, so if we feel optimistic we may come back to try the other dishes. But for now, we'll stick with Shoku Ramen-ya for our ramen cravings.

Place is small, price is decent. Very busy and loud also. Not good for big parties. 

The chashu ramen is pretty good.

I've been to Vegas couple of times but this is the first time I've tried Sora. I've heard a lot of good things about its Ramen and Cashu Bowl. That's why my friend and I have decided to order the most famous Miso Ramen and the Cashu Bowl. 

When I asked the waitress how big is the mini Cashu Bowl, she told me it was about the size of a bagel. This's too small for both of us, so we thought it would be better to order a large Cashu Bowl, since we were starving, and they only offer mini size and large size. When the Cashu Bowl came, it was huge. We were so shocked that we stared at each other for a few seconds, speechless. Fortunately, the Cashu Bowl was really good that we've finished it even though we were super full. The Miso Ramen was good too, but the Cashu Bowl has definitely over-shined the Miso Ramen.

Some of the best ramen noodles I ever had. Chewy, with bounce.  I had the shio base ramen and it was a very clean, refined broth as it should be in the Sapporo-style ramen.  Chasu was meltingly tender.  Sapporo on draft.  Perfect way to recover from the night before.
There's usually always a wait here because it's so good, but it's usually goes by pretty quick. Miso ramen was super tasty! Garlic edamame is to die for!
Ordered the Killer Spicy and it was GREAT!  Perfect of spices and left a killer kick at the end! lol

"Large, low sodium miso, chasu ramen with corn and extra chasu". That is the order that won't fail you! The large is only  $1 extra with 50% more noodles. It's pretty darn big, but I'll take it home and eat the leftovers for lunch the next day. I prefer this place to the one down the street...you know the one that starts with 'm" and ends with "a".

Why? Glad you asked:
-free standing restaurant with it's own parking
-much bigger, roomier seating area...no reason to feel up the stranger sitting next to you(unless that's your thing)
-never a long wait...and usually none at all
-there are different serving sizes you can choose from...not one size fits all!
-the miso ramen broth is simmered overnight and is ridiculously creamy and tasty
-the NOODLES are Sapporo style and are cooked al dente. Perfect noodles for ramen!
-the gyoza is hands down better
--just go already!

Nori ramen, deluxe ramen, fried rice, gyoza, mini chasu bowl, it all had a great amount of flavor. The ramen noodles are cooked really well and have a hearty thickness. The pork tends to be so tender, it almost melts into the base when you poke it with you chopstick. 

Expect to have a little bit of a wait and sign in, this restaurant, which you could swear was originally a small house, only has one seating area so space is limited. It's worth the wait for ramen connoisseurs!

My friend was craving ramen for her birthday meal so a group of about 8 of us came on a Tuesday around 6:30 pm for some grub. It's a super small spot with maybe about 10 tables. The wait was at least an hour which sucked, but it was worth the wait. 

I had the regular size spicy miso. The flavor was delicious! The perfect amount of spicy and not too over powering. The noodles were also very fresh and tasty. The regular size was just right for me and only around $8.50-9.

This definitely has to be one of the top 5 ramen places in Vegas. I just wish they expanded to a bigger location or second restaurant.

Not the best ramen in the world. Maybe I am just saying that coming back from Oahu where the Japanese influence is insanely strong and the ramen is tonkatsu driven and viscous and creamy and delicious. It was miso style which is nice in its lightness but the pork belly was undercooked, very fatty, the broth was either too salty (in my mans case) or the toppings were too cold (in my case). Also, it is mostly communal seating, which isn't a bad thing if you are there with a large group, but as a two-top we felt crowded at our large table filled with homecoming gowns and tuxes. 

It should be noted though that the service was great. We were checked on frequently. They were very nice friendly and helpful. The place, the tables and the bathrooms were immaculately clean. 

All in all, if you are looking for inexpensive casual ramen for lunch or with a large party, this place is great. Otherwise, maybe look elsewhere.

I must of caught them on a bad day or something?  I see everyone giving them a lot of stars, but I'm only giving 3 stars.  Basically there are four flavors, miso, shio, shoyu, and killer spicy.  I ordered  the miso ramen, the deluxe I think.  

The broth, was not salty, but wasn't as hot-temperature wise, too. The noodles are the thicker type noodles.  The deluxe has a slice of a boiled egg, three pieces of nori, 3 pieces of chashu, and green onions.  I found two small slices of bamboo so that was the only veggies I could dig up. I asked if they had other veggies and the waiter said they basically didn't have any.  Ok? At least get kimchee or bok Choy or sprouts, idk, something.  

Also ordered the gyoza. it's only three pieces, just your average gyoza.

It wasn't completely horrible, but perhaps not as impressive as the other reviewers made it to be.  I still plan to come back to give it another try.

This place is great!! It is small so there are times you have to wait for a table but well worth it. Service was good and importantly the food was very tasty.  We had a side order of pork curry, fired rice, and a Ramen bowl.

First EVER ramen stop in Vegas! 

Things to remember:  
This place is fairly small. I came here with a party of like 12-14 and we took up most of their tables. Sorry..

Food: Spicy Miso Ramen 
1. The spice level is perfect for my taste, I would say it was 5-6 on the spicy scale. 
2. Broth was tasty, creamy and not overly salty. 
3. Good amount of meat. 

Final Verdict:
Thumbs up.
One of the best Ramen places I've been to! The service was super fast, and Ramen was cooked to perfection.

I went here with my friends, but I could not eat anything. Everything had pork in it. I do not eat pork, so I did not order anything. My friends all loved it though. Everyone said there soups were outstanding. They should make some broth without pork in it.

OMG, this place is the sh*t legit! After discovering this place, I'm sure I'll gain lots of weight. Meats were perfectly marinade, soup base packed with flavor, and noodles perfectly cooked. Add friendly staff and this place is on my 'go-to' Vegas rotation.

I'm so very impressed by this place.  I had the Deluxe Bowl, the noodles were the perfect mix of soft without being too mushy, quite al dente.  The chashu pork was seasoned so perfectly and the miso broth was so hearty on a cold rainy night like this evening!  The staff was very helpful and friendly, ambiance was nice and clean.  I'll definitely be going back

We arrived at about 10 and there was a 5min wait. We were greeted immediately and they made sure to have us seated as soon as possible.

They helped us with the menu since we were unfamiliar with the bases of the ramen and my girlfriend does not eat pork. Note, they do only serve pork (unless I was informed wrong). We ordered the gyoza & 2 orders of the spicy ramen shio (salt) base. Also note that the spicy ramen is only spice due to the spicy meat (also pork). Our waitress offered to have the pork of my girlfriend's ramen on side in case I would want it but this would also mean her bowl would not be spicy. Though they do have spicy seasoning on the side. The gyoza was great, the filling was flavorful. Nothing out of this world though. The ramen was great. The broth was good and wasn't too salty. The noodles were perfect. The pork meat was very soft & tender. Everything worked out great. Even if my girlfriend's ramen wasn't spicy it was still good.
Service was super quick and the ramen was great, some of the best I've ever had. Definitely will return for more of the spicy miso goodness!

Best Ramen place in town. It looks like a hit of a hole-in-the-wall, but the food is amazing. The place gets pretty busy at peak dinner hours, but if you come there a little before 5:00pm or a little after 7:00pm it doesn't tend to be to bad. They have a decent selection of saki & beer and they're green tea is good as well. The staff are super friendly, the Ramen options are pretty big and the price is fantastic. Definitely my favorite spot in Chinatown!

I'm not a huge fan of Ramen Sora's interior, which is far too dark and spacious for a ramen-ya, and their staff is a bit too lukewarm for the sitdown restaurant look. I don't like the vibe here; if you're looking for the energetic, late-night bustle, you'll find happier places with happier people. 

What I do like is the miso ramen, though.
Ramen Sora is Sapporo-style.
Sapporo-style is Miso Ramen.
MISO RAMEN!!
That is all.

(No, really. When all you care about is getting a glorious bowl of miso ramen, just order it from Ramen Sora, super-size. 

Skip the chashu. It's unimpressive, and pops up awkwardly in between mouthfuls of miso. Don't suffer the distraction.

Gyoza's good. Get the gyoza. Get two orders. 
Oh, and don't forget the green onion and seaweed.)

Closer to a 3.5, but rounding up because best miso ramen.

This place is officially my favorite ramen spot. PERIOD. For a multitude of reasons...

1) Most importantly, I like my food spicy. I don't mean "spicy-tuna-roll-spicy"... I'm talkin' fiery hot, but the flavor has to be there too. It can't taste like those atomic hot wings tossed in chemical-like hot sauces. Ohhh ramen sora, thank you for having the PERFECT idea of spicy :). The killer spicy ramen is my dream come true broth. 

2) I enjoy variety. The mini chasu curry bowl and an order of gyoza are perfect side dishes to ramen. They also provide a great list of toppings for ramen (extra chasu, corn, etc). 

3) Ramen is NOT supposed to be expensive! Honestly, it can be just a tad cheaper but compared to most spots in Vegas, this place is the most reasonable. :)

4) Friendly workers. The service is always fantastic. I never see the bottom of my water, and trust me this is very important when you're enjoying a super-sized killer spicy ramen. Most Asian restaurants tend to neglect glasses of water and we are forced to wave down a waiter for a refill. Not Ramen Sora, they're on top of their game! 

5) Space. I didn't really want to compare Ramen Sora to Monta too much, but man, Monta really does need to expand for customer convenience. You won't have as much problem getting a table/seats at Ramen Sora. 

6) THE RAMEN HERE IS JUST PLAIN FANTASTIC. Great broth, amazing noodles cooked to perfection (not too soggy and just a tad thicker than Monta's), and several options for the broth: shio, shoyu, miso. Flavor reminds me of my favorite ramen spots in NYC, which says a lot. 

In conclusion, THANK YOU Ramen Sora for being present in Vegas, and so conveniently located as well ;) I only wish you'd offer delivery...

Food is amazing. This is by far my favorite for ramen. I only gave 4 stars cause the ladies here always seem to be having a bad day. Very abrupt and short tempered always. In 2 years of going here theyve had 1 nice server

5 stars for the broth! If you arrive early enough, you will get a table quickly. Otherwise, be prepared for a wait during peak hours. My favorite is the shoyu base deluxe. How to describe the broth... imagine sitting on your couch on a rainy day and putting Netflix on and all you want is some hot ramen to hit the spot. Their broth is like that plus 9000! The chashu is super tender and full of flavor. When you come here, definitely eat your ramen with a glass of melon cream soda. It pairs so well together.

Ramen Sora is our favorite ramen restaurant in town and it's good enough to get two 5 star reviews from me.
It's located across the street from my house, obviously making it incredibly convenient but I always know that there will be a line. I don't like to wait. People may find that selfish of me, but I choose not to. I mention that because I never mind waiting for Ramen Sora. They have a sign in sheet, which I saw only had three in front of us. It seems more traditional with the seating, meaning, you may be sitting at a long rectangular table with a couple other parties if you don't mind.
We sat after about ten minutes and were served within five. We always order the same three things a pork belly bowl with rice to split, Killer Spicy Ramen, and Spicy Ramen.. Always more than we can eat, which is downstairs now, but delicious on a level that you savor every last bite.
You have many options that range from what you'd like in your ramen, to the type of broth you prefer. It's a made to order dose of smiles and full tummies. 
Try it out if you ever visit the two block range of Las Vegas' China Town.. It's well worth the wait and make sure to have a chilled glass of ice and a cold can of oolong tea.. The creamy melon soda is a must for me too.. It's a vice.
Best ramen in town. Noodles are always cooked right and broth is delicious. Cha-siu is tender and less fat compared to other ramen places.

Ramen is great.  The miso soup is wonderful.  I love the flavor-it is authentic.  All of the ingredients are fresh.  Flavors are there but subtle.  Yes I need to experiment & order more!  But no matter what ramen I order the meat is tender but not over cooked.  
I like the decor it is perfect for a casual restaurant.  The location is good.  As a newcomer to Vegas it is easy to find since it stands alone.

Not bad, broth was pretty thick and had medium flavor.  i know a buncha yelpers and "food critics" are all about the quality etc etc blah blah, but when you get down to it, its a ramen place and you're eating to get full.  That being said, 1 freakin peice of chasu in my nori ramen?!!? really? cant a guy get at least 2 so i can dip one in sauce and try the other without or something?  o and btw do not order the premium chasu either.  Overprices 2 slices of semi-coldish pork belly slices.

however, even after the negatives, I still give this place about 3.5 stars.  It will defintely be on my mind when monta is overly packed as usual.

Really excellent miso ramen, maybe my #2 best ramen ever.  Flavorful broth that wasn't too salty or too fatty but just right.  Chashu melted like butter in my mouth and didn't have a old, gamey taste (a ramen pet peeve of mine).  The large was quite big and filling, and this is coming from a fat white girl.  I had to give some to my husband to finish.  

Prices are fair.  Service was good, frequent checks.  Restrooms are small but available (unlike some Asian restaurants).  I will definitely be back!  I just wish it was closer to my house.

The way the broth is made, the way the noodle is prepared, the way the ramen is prepared with these combined....   
Ahhhhhh this is closest thing to the real ramen.

One of the few places I can call as "ramen" on main land US.  Turned out to be in LAS....  better than most of ramen found in LAS/SFO/SJC... As good as in HNL....  somewhat close to those in my home world (no, not the land of fish, I refer my home world as the land of ramen... or Japan...)

  "let's get drunk and go eat ramen"  --anonymous

My daughter isn't a ramen person and I was really glad that they have mini chasu bowl.  She took a bite and went "hmm" means she likes it.  The mini chasu bowl actually comes with a lot of chasu.  They are nicely charred and not dried nor too fatty.  

Their gyoza is pretty good. Decent size too.

Both my husband and I had the deluxe sora shio ramen.  We both agreed that it's probably one of the better shio ramen we've had.  The broth had very deep pork flavor and yet not too salty especially with shio based.  We thought it's compareable to Ramen Yamada in OC but not oily at all and very tasty.

We had previously like Monta but it was closed for some reasons so Ramen Sora is a great option.  My sister had their miso and thought was just OK.  Their spicy fried rice was quite spicy.

The line starts like 5 minutes before it opens as a lot of family visiting Vegas probably want a bowl of hot ramen broth before they begin their journey back home.
Can my first ramen place be my favorite ramen place?! Finished a whole regular size Spicy Miso Ramen and loved EvErY sINgle BitE

Holy crap, how long has this place been open? and already that many yelp reviews?? geez!!

I go here with my girlfriend pretty much monthly (I occasionally get it for lunch because its so close to my work).  I get the miso ramen with extra noodles :), its very good.  I really like the look of the inside also!

They don't have there liquor license yet so no beer yet, once they do this place will be super popular on friday nights :).
I had the regular salt ramen and gyoza. I enjoyed both. However, the broth could be richer.  My friend ordered the spicy version. Both were tasty.

This is my third time coming to Ramen Sora, but my first time eating here as the other two times the waiting was just too long. However the wait tonight was on about twenty minutes so my friend and I decided to wait.

I ordered the screaming vengeance while he had to shoyu, added our fixings with a side of gyoza to start. 
 
The gyoza was not bad however it wasn't anything to rave about either.

As for the ramen, we both found it enjoyable for a price that was not overbearing.

Pros:
-Super sized portions for you noodle lovers
-Screaming vengeance option was really spicy for you spicy lovers, unlike those bs 'spicy miso' fakes
-Good clean broth (get the butter please)
-Chasu, although small, was tasty
-Prices are reasonable, two drinks, one app, two ramen with fixings = $34 before tip

Cons:
Egg really sucked for ramen standards

Will try out the other ramen places in Vegas before I come back but it was a good place to start.

I have eaten here tons of times. This is my favorite ramen restaurant in vegas. I live across town and will make the drive anytime (including rush hour) to eat here and/or get it to go. The staff is always very friendly and the food has never let me down. I tell everyone about this place. I wish they would open one in henderson

This place has the best Ramen I've ever eaten in my life. I ordered the large and I finished it, but I was so fat I couldn't get up afterwards. The pork is unlike anything I've ever had before.  It was literally perfect. This place is pretty small and there is always a wait at the door, with good reason. My friend's wife is Japanese, and a great cook herself, and this is her favorite ramen place in Vegas.  Protip: Order a Kirin on draft to go with your meal.

Had the Shio Ramen and it was really delicious. They have a lot of the most essential Ramen varieties and the flavors
are well balanced.

Also I recommend you try the Gyoza! It's really good with the accompanying sauce.
I get too excited to eat! I love eating here and have brought many of our friends to eat here with no regrets. All have enjoyed it and converted into long time customers.

When it comes to Ramen in Las Vegas I've read all the reviews for the 3 main places. But I held off on trying any because in the back of my mind ramen is the stuff you find in styrofoam cups or bricks of dried noodles wrapped in cellophane. Ramen Sora is not that kind of Ramen at all. Not even close. 

Ramen Sora is pushing it distance wise for my lunch choices, but I went anyway. (Gotta love Desert Inn - Super Arterials equal SPEED so getting past Las Vegas Blvd is not an issue!) The place is very clean, even a peek through the door into the kitchen showed it to be almost spotless. Service was fast, friendly, and most importantly very helpful. I can't recall everything I ordered, Green Tea, a side plate with eggs, Charsiu, and other yummy stuff, and a bowl of Miso Ramen. 

I have to say I'm typically NOT a pork fan. But when it comes to Charsiu...OMG I have never had anything like this before. Tender, easily pulled apart with chopsticks, and with a flavor I have rarely associated with pork in the past. Charsiu is incredible, more like mind blowing and it certainly adjusted my mindset on pork and how it can be prepared. But as good as the Charsiu was, the bowl of Miso Ramen was beyond incredible. Ok, I admit I didn't eat the egg they put in it, but that's the only thing I didn't eat as this was one of the most flavorful dishes I've had in a very long time. I can't really describe the complexity except to say I have never sat down with a noodle type dish before and finished with a smile from ear to ear because it was so damn good. Until now. 

I have a new found understanding on what true Ramen is, and how great it is. And I thank everyone who has taken the time to post on Yelp for helping point me towards one of the more incredible food experiences I've had to date since moving to Las Vegas. I will be back, I will bring others, and yes, this place is as awesome as others have said. 

5 Stars, without any question or hesitation. TRY IT!

This is one of the best ramen places in town. My family and i frequent this location quite a bit. Depending what time you go there is almost always a wait - not long unless you get there at prime meal time. The service is always on point, but the location is small, but cozy.  All the broths are delicious. Would recommend if looking for a ramen spot to call your own.

This was the first time we have had ramen so we were fortunate to have a waiter who walked us through the various options. My wife chose shoyu ramen which had a slightly funky taste (too much fish sauce?) while I opted for chasu miso ramen.  The pork was melt in your mouth good and the noodles were chewy, but neither of us are likely to order ramen again.  ($20.84, 2 Forks)

It says they close at 11pm. We walked in at 10:40pm and the host said they were closed and kicked us out. She said that there was a closed sign but there was no such thing in the front. Sucks, because we were so excited to go here. If you are going to deny customers at this time then say you close at 10:30!!! There were a lot of people in there but some empty seats so I'm pretty sure they could have taken us.

Meh. I think I have really high standards for ramen, being half Japanese and having lived in California.

The gyoza was pretty good, and large beer is HUGE. But, we came here for the ramen...
I wasn't too crazy about the noodles being so thick. It was also on the more chewy side & I prefer hard noodles.
My friend got the miso broth & I got the shio. Friend said miso was ok, shio was just ok too. 
The chashu was pretty good! Very large slices. But the egg was also lackluster to me. Not as sweet as your typical onsen tamago, and a little overcooked.
Server seemed to forget about us after bringing out our food.
There's not too many options for ramen in LV, but I'm sure there has to be better spots. This was just an ok meal to me. Satisfying but don't see myself ever craving it again.

For my own Battle Ramen, Sora was my last stop. My fiancé, Ruben had already visited Sora several times and raved about the Killer Spicy Miso Ramen. That sounded scary and knowing his tolerance for heat, I wasn't going to go near it. Anyway, even after taking him to Monta, he still liked Sora better, so I had to see for myself.

We visited one afternoon with his co-worker, waiting eagerly for them to open. Then, we were seated immediately. Both of them knew exactly what they wanted - Killer ramen bowls with the option for more noodles and broth. I went for a Miso Ramen. I really liked the flavor and everything about my ramen was delicious. Oh, and of course I had to try the Killer broth. It has that really deep chili flavor that lingers in the back of your throat. But wow, it was so, so tasty! I actually added a few spoonfuls of the Killer broth into my ramen! It was great.

At the end of the meal, my only problem was that I couldn't decide which ramen house I preferred (between Monta and Sora; I eliminated Fukumimi). They have different styles and I enjoyed both of them. What it came down to for me was the noodles (I prefer Monta's thick, wavy noodles), preference of Tonkotsu over Miso broth, and the availability of chili oil to control the spice level. So my favorite ramen offerings are Monta, however, I like Sora's miso broth better!

Best ramen I've ever had in the states. Omg, pork heaven in a bowl.  I randomly stumbled upon this place and I ended up eating it everyday of my vacation there. Highly recommended to all of you ramen lovers. Mmmmm... now I really want some.

Easy lot and street parking. Small place so there is a wait. 3 types of broth: should, ship and miso broth. 
Ordered the deluxe #1 w miso broth which has 3 large pieces of pork ( though beware that they are very fatty in case you do or don't want that). Miss broth was flavorful. 
Not too salty but you can ask them for broth to lessen the salt. 
Egg was soft, but not as flavorful as others I've had.

Yum!  Excellent bowl of miso ramen; chashu pork was tender, broth was rich and hot.  Everything about it was about as good as ramen gets.  And the staff are super nice, all cheerful and quick.  I'll be back!

I got the spicy miso ramen. It was good but the broth got a bit salty towards the end. I like the grounded pork in the ramen, added extra flavor but just a bit too much lol. There was a big space in the middle of the dinning area. They should just add 2 more tables there to shorten the wait.
The best ramen by far!!!  Just the right portion size, mix of ramen, onion, and chashu.  The soup bases were delicious and flavorful.  I would definitely come back for more.

Get over here and eat some ramen. 

The prices are more than reasonable and service is pretty fast as long as you get in ahead of the line!

If it's over 100 degrees outside, and I still look forward to eating at Ramen Sora, then I think that says a lot.  This is by far my favorite ramen to date; I love the Sapporo style ramen they serve here, with it's rich flavor and chewy, al dente noodles.  Having tried a few other spots in Vegas, as well as spot in LA and San Francisco, Ramen Sora remains my favorite!

The pork is always tender and flavorful.  Eggs are always cooked perfectly.  Plenty of topping combinations are available, but I usually go for the Nori Ramen; you're pretty much getting a Deluxe Bowl minus the extra pork for $1.50 less.  The miso broth is my favorite, and offers very rich flavors.  Not too salty, just rich.  Rich like Bruce Wayne going on a yacht with the entire Russian ballet.  The miso at other places is rich like Bruce Wayne doing the Batdance with Miranda Tate on the floor of a giant mansion with no electricity...it could be better.  Are those references even accurate?  I don't know.  But I do know that you should give Ramen Sora a try, even if you are already devoted to another ramen shop in town.

There is a small menu here so it'd easy to choose from. The most popular item was the spicy ramen so that's what we got. The noddles were really chew just how I like it but the broth was a little to salty. Also not good for big parties more than 5 because we had 11 and we had to split up and eat at different times
Good prices and service but very so-so ramen. I had the miso base and my ramen was a bit too "fishy" tasting.
Close to the strip cute little place great food great service good prices. Parking is food and place is clean

Use to be a Vegas local and came here often. I recently visited and can't believe how much busier it is! i always get the spicy ramen with an extra egg and side order of Gyoza. This place is really delicious, and the staff are very friendly and accommodating! The prices are VERY reasonable, and I always recommend this place for visitors who want to get off the beaten path of the Vegas strip.
Not impressed at all. Esp for the price $10 for bowl. Broth tasted a bit old and noodles didn't taste as good as usual places. Monta is way better
super yummy ramen! soft melt in your mouth meat with great soup base! however,  i was not impressed with the curry rice at all. must be ramen!

I was brought here for my birthday this year and I got hooked, it's delicious and even though I hate spicy food I always order the spicy ramen and I looove it!!!  highly recommend this place the girls are always really nice and the prices are even nicer on your wallet!!

This spot is amazing. Noodles and broth are completely on point. I'm glad everyone goes to Monta Ramen. That means Sora becomes less packed. Everyone has a preference and after living in Japan for most of my childhood, this really hits home for me. Spicy Shoyu Ramen with a side of chashu fried rice.

If I could give this place zero stars or less, I would. Terrible food, terrible service, and talk about a long wait. 

Let's start off with the setting. The parking is vey limited for a place that gets very busy so if there's little parking, you'll have to park on the side streets. Inside is crowded so you literally have to push people aside just to get through to either the restroom or to your table (if it's ready for you). I'm not going to lie, we had a big family to accommodate with kids, too. [Talk about 10 people so I understand that it was challenging for the workers especially on a busy Wednesday night with little seating trying to help everyone else].

When we were seated, they were being really pushy about what we wanted to eat. There was no sense of patience and when we asked what was popular on the menu, one of the ladies rolled her eyes and said "everything that is ramen". Okay? 

My cousin could not have anything because she does not eat meag and was also allergic to a lot of the ingredients on the menu. When she asked if she could get food elsewhere and bring it in, they told her she had to eat it outside because it was not "welcomed here." 

As for the food, the ramen was salty and the noodles were hard. Not good at all and will not plan on going back. Would not recommend especially with the bad service and rude behavior we were given. Get your ramen elsewhere.

Phenomenal.  

The extra chewy ramen is nothing that I've ever had before and the broth was delicious as well.  The egg was cooked perfectly and the cha she was very tender.  I almost went back a second day after my GF had introduced us to Ramen Sora.  Definitely staying as a bookmark!

p.s. The "spicy miso" ramen gets it's spicy from the scoop of meat that is added to the bowl.  The texture reminds me of a sausage.  I had a few really hot bites and if I order it again, I might get it on the side to control the level of heat.  The sauce is mixed in with the meat so once you stir it or let it sit, it gets in the broth & you've committed to that level of heat.  Tasty but I had two moments where it got me good!

For $7.50 it's a great value.  This is my first time here & I had the Miso ramen.  It was very salty and I had to ask for water to tone it down.  The ramen was nothing special but the pork slice included was tender and tastes good.
I freaking looooove this place omg so good excellent service excellent food excellent environment excellent location excellence at its best !!!!!!!

I have found that I have become very picky about my ramen now. Ramen that I thought was the best thing ever has become good but not the best thing ever. 

However, this ramen place has become one of my favorites. I went with a friend who told me that I had to try it before deciding what I thought was the best and man was he right. The ramen here is excellent. The flavor of the broth is delicious and the noodles are cooked perfectly. They have a really good taste. Also, I really enjoyed the Chasui Bowl. I like Chasui so long as its cooked well. I don't like it when it is so fatty that when I'm chewing it, it just is bleh. The Chasui both in my ramen and in the chase bowl was cooked really well and I enjoyed it. 

The service is good but the place is almost always packed. Although, the food makes up for it. 

I think the reason why this is 4 stars is because of how busy they are but they aren't always busy (only a majority of the time). I don't really like to wait so I always call before to see how busy they are and if they say the wait is about 25 mins then I decide to go somewhere else. But the food is delicious and worth the wait when your not in a hurry like I normally am.

I had to stop by and check this place out. I LOVE ramen and I heard that Ramen Sora was even better than Monta. Since Monta is my favorite, I had to see for myself.

I ordered the Shoyu ramen, my favorite. Trust me, I was very tempted by their spicy options but in order to truly compare the two noodle shops, I had to go for the classic. I really liked it! It was a little saltier than the broth at Monta and the noodles were thick and chewy. I was fine with these things, but I must admit, I would still pick Monta as my first choice. Don't get me wrong, I will be back to Sora. I guess it just depends on which of the two I'm craving since they're different. They have a couple of dessert options, so with my sweet tooth, this is a definite plus. They have mango mochi and Kurogoma Dango. I didn't get to try either one on this trip, but I shall try one next time.

I liked the fact that Sora's dining room is spacious and not quite as busy as Monta's. Service was fast and everyone was very nice. I'll definitely be back. I must try their spicy soup!

Looking for a bowl of ramen? Ramen Sora offers a solid serving. I had the Nori Ramen with Miso broth and of course, a side of gyoza. The ramen was solid, probably won't be the most memorable bowl of ramen you will have eaten but you will not leave feeling unsatisfied. While tasty, I felt the miso broth was either missing some umami or additional saltiness. A side of additional garlic may have also helped but by itself, I had myself wondering what it could be while eating. Inside the bowl was a piece of char siu which was very tender, falling apart as soon as it hit my tongue, nori and bamboo. Very simple and satisfying. The noodles were slippery good and cooked to the right degree of al dente. The gyoza were also very good but also missing something to make it truly memorable, perhaps a little more sesame oil would be more toward my taste. They were also not served super hot, a la fresh out of the pan, which is how I like them. Probably a minor complaint for most though as many people eat it over the course of the meal anyway when it will get warm. All in all a solid ramen eating experience if you're craving a bowl of ramen while in Vegas.
My favorite place for Sapporo style ramen.  Love their spicy miso ramen broth. The noodles are thick, chewy & delicious. Charsiu is tender and melts in your mouth.

Ramen Sora is definitely one of my top three in the city, if not my favourite restaurant ever.
The food is always delicious, the staff is always friendly, and the place is always clean. Excellent noodles and the broth is balanced. If you ask, the staff might say that the miso ramen is the best, but i would definitely say the shio ramen is the best. My boyfriend agrees with me, after having the miso ramen the first few times. All of the flavours are delicious, dont get me wrong, but the shio is an amazing savory broth without being too salty. Killer ramen is super spicy so beware. If you like it hot, try spicy ramen. Its spicy but also flavourful. Their gyoza are also good. I come here whenever i get the chance. The place can sometimes get busy at night but it is usually worth the wait.
Best ramen ever at least here in Las Vegas! Closest tasting to actual ramen from Japan. Amazing service as well!

I made the mistake of having Monta ramen a couple of days before trying this spot. The bar was set pretty high, so of course my judgement was a little jaded. The staff is friendly but I have to be honest, Monta beats them on flavor.
Wow. I'm glad there's more than 3 options.    The broth is super tasty. A pork lovers heaven. All pork everything.

After living in Japan for 4 years, I'm very particular about the kind of ramen I eat. However, Ramen Sora blew my taste buds. The corn butter ramen with miso broth was decadent, rich, and literally melted in my mouth. I get it everytime I come here. It's average price, about $8-$10 a bowl, but it is so worth it.
Small restaurant, fully packed all the time. I came here with party of four and waited for 30 minute. We all have ramen, all tasty. Love every single bite of it. Worth the wait! Also very affordable

This ramen restaurant really defines the term "hole the wall" - Just outside of the Las Vegas strip, we only found this restaurant because of Yelp reviews. Ramen Sora has the best ramen I've ever tasted. 

The restaurant is very small but minimal and clean. I had the spicy shio ramen and a bbq side dish. I don't remember what it was called, but it's under the appetizers part of the menu. The meat was so tender and saucy. The ramen was very flavorful but not overly salty like most ramen places. My friends and I barely talked to each other because we were too busy slurping down our bowls. I almost finished my bowl, which is very rare since I get full easily.

I'm writing this as I eat here for the 4th day in a row. I've been on a trek to find the best ramen in Chinatown, and so far have had Sora, Monta, Misoya, Jinya, and Yagyu. So far, no one compares to Sora. The noodles are thick and hearty, the broth always full of flavor. The best thing that no other restaurant compares to, though, is the chashu. I don't know what this place does that's so different, but it's a thicker cut of pork, and is so tender, one little poke of your chopstick, and it crumbles. The fat on the pork belly actually melts in your mouth when you eat it. It's incredible.

I did not have high expectations for this ramen place, but I absolutely loved my spicy miso ramen! The broth was so flavorful and the noodles were al dente! One of the must haves during the winter season:)! I just did not like the meat in the spicy miso because there was a certain smell to it.

just came here tonight for the first time for dinner with a friend. ramen sora is a small restaurant on spring mountain with a small parking lot. we arrived at the restaurant around 7pm and we were seated right away, the hostesses/servers are really friendly and makes you feel super welcomed. i ordered the spicy miso ramen because i've heard many good reviews about it and although it wasn't spicy like i thought it would be it was still delicious! i am a huge noodle soup fan and my taste buds were definitely satisfied :) i can only imagine it being even more amazing in the cold weather. overall, the prices and service are great and i will be back!

Drove in from California and wanted a quick and light lunch. Found Ramen Sora on yelp with excellent reviews. I'm a little selective and bias with ramen as I've had my share in Japantown in LA. 

No doubt, Ramen Sora was worth the pit stop. First, we were seated right away as we arrived after 130p (after the lunch rush). All tables were still occupied. Our order was also taken quickly and brought out quickly. 

My husband and I ordered the large Chashu bowl with miso base and spicy pork fried rice to share. Let's start with the Chashu bowl- miso base soup was savory and hot. The noodles were also cooked well, not too soft just right (like al dente pasta). Like any of the reviews the Chashu could be softer, the type that melts in your mouth. However, there were 3 large slices of Chashu included in the bowl. So no complaints there. The spicy pork fried rice was a nice compliment to the ramen. Nothing special, but had a good kick of spice to add that bite while eating your ramen. 

Definitely returning the next time I am in Vegas.

Just another ramen shop in Las Vegas - nothing to be too thrilled about.  At $10 for a bowl of Deluxe Shio Ramen, the broth isn't even a bone-stew like most other ramen shops.  I opted out of the miso broth, which I later regretted since it was a bit too salty to my liking. 

A couple things that I did like were the meat and the service.  The meat was very flavorful and at its perfect texture and ratio of meat and fat.  Service was excellent; we didn't have to wait more than 4 minutes for our food, and our tea cups and glasses were never empty. 

I would go back again just to give it another whirl (maybe try the spicy ramen) and just because there are only a handful of ramen shops in Vegas to go... 

Slurp away!

This has become our go to Ramen place in Las Vegas. It's well priced and the food is always consistent. Sometimes there's a small wait but it's a small hole in the wall place.

I love their Miso Chashu Ramen and their Melon Creme Soda - great for lunch and dinner!
I just had the No#1 Sora.  Sorry :l this wasnt my favorite. The bamboo shoots were strong that i disnt want to eat it. My favorite is still Daikokuya in Little Toyko.

I am new to Ramen. My GF took me about 6 months ago for my first bowl of awesome. I was shocked at how delicious it was. since then I have tried a few other places and nothing compares to Ramen Sora. This is my favorite spot by far. 

I get the spicy bowl with extra egg, miso broth. NOM!
My favorite place to come get spicy ramen. Always quick once you're seated! Lots of broth options which is awesome! Miso pork chasu with killer meat!

So I have never been a huge ramen fan but my gf had a craving for some before leaving Vegas and sitting in traffic back to LA so we decided on this place.  The noodles were cooked just how I like them - still a little hard - and the broth overall was good.  It was a little on the rich/oily side for me but flavor was spot on.  Another of my friend got the mini curry bowl with a a order or gyoza.  The gyoza were too greasy for me and not crispy enough on the bottom but the mini curry bowl was good.  It was actually a good amount for a mini bowl and the the price was super cheap too.  Overall I wouldn't mind stopping here again if someone I was hanging out with really wanted ramen but warning - it's not the biggest place so there might be a wait when you get here.

I really liked this place. When i first pulled up i was a bit nervous looked a bit on the divey side,but from the moment you enter you feel welcomed as all the servers shout something in what i guess is japanese,although it could be they are announcing another white boy coming to eat for all I know. The service was attentive and efficient. I had my bowl of soup in short order.Im not a master ramen person but I do enjoy a good bowl of noodle soup especially with chashu,which is what I had,I like the fact that you can pile on extra noodles too,I went for the 50% bigger,that was perfect! i think it was a bit more expensive then I remember from similar in los angeles,but by no means was it exorbitant. 15 bucks all in for soup and a coke. all and all I appreciated the whole experience and will return.

I went here with my family over a month ago.  It was our first time minus our younger sister.  It's a small hole in the wall spot.  We were to grab a bite around 5 PM.  I was surprised all the tables were already taken that early.  We had to wait about 15-20 minutes until it was our turn.

I had the regular Deluxe Sora Ramen.  The broth was good, it could be better.  The noodles were decent.  Meat was tender.  I would have to give this a 3 stars compared to my other ramen experiences.  I don't have any urgency in coming back anytime soon.
Honestly wasn't the best ramen I've tried in Vegas. The gyozas (pot stickers) weren't as crispy and the broth was a little too oily for me. This is coming from a native Japanese girl so, yeah.
Even better than the last trip. Besides the tight dinning area there is nothing to complain about. Great broth, great noodles, melt in your mouth pork.

Kirin drafts for only $5! Delicious ramen with a couple different options! Ramen Sora is an excellent choice to take your ramen cravings while in Vegas. Expect to wait a bit since this place is fairly popular but it is worth it by far.

Very delicious ramen at a reasonable price! The staff is always so friendly and attentive and the ambience is very intimate (small space). Some of our favorite are the nori ramen (shoyu base) and the pork gyoza appetizer. It gets pretty busy so I suggest coming in for lunch or an early dinner. It is actually better than Monta in my opinion.
I had the shio ramen and the soup was so plain and salty.   No meat flavour of the pork bone broth at all.  Was very disappointed.

My wife(who is Okinawan) had been researching Ramen places all day, and after thorough research and deliberation, we chose to go here. Not a bad choice at all. We got here at 10:33, and the let us in even though the last order is at 10:30. Not a big deal for us Americans, but the Japanese tend to be very punctual and not flexible(my observations during the 6 years I lived and worked there), so I was grateful and glad that they sat us. We ordered(deluxe Ramen for me, negi shio for the wife, and a deluxe to go for my mom who wanted a taste since she was keeping the little one during this excursion) and the food came quickly. It was delicious. Thick, juicy, flavorful slices of pork, delicious broth( not as creamy as some of the other reviews talk about), and plenty of food. The wife enjoyed hers as well. I really liked how they prepared our to go order. The broth was in one container, the noodles, meat, etc were in another, and the seaweed was wrapped separately on top of both containers. Total for all this came to $30, and it was well worth it. It is still slightly below our favorite place in L.A., but I liked here and would come here again. Though I haven't had Ramen anywhere else in Vegas, I don't think you could go wrong eating here. Try it!

This has been my favorite ramen place since late 2014. I go about once a month. Before I've tried a couple of other ramen places in the area but nothing beats Sora! The amazing flavor in their broth is insane. I always order the Deluxe Sora Ramen- has three pieces of chashu, three pieces of nori, green onion, kikurage, egg, and thick ramen noodles. I sometimes start drinking all of the soup before I even get to the noodles. Ugh their food is just heaven.
